types.name: AbandonedCheckout
types.description: A checkout that was abandoned by the customer.

fields.name: abandonedCheckoutUrl
fields.description: The URL for the buyer to recover their checkout.

fields.name: defaultCursor
fields.description: A default cursor that returns the single next record, sorted ascending by ID.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: A list of the line items in this checkout.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns up to the first `n` elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns up to the last `n` elements from the list.

args.name: reverse
args.description: Reverse the order of the underlying list.

fields.name: lineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The number of products in the checkout.

fields.name: totalPriceSet
fields.description: The sum of all items in the checkout, including discounts, shipping, taxes, and tips.

types.name: AbandonedCheckoutLineItem
types.description: A single line item in an abandoned checkout.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: A list of extra information that has been added to the line item.

fields.name: discountedTotalPriceSet
fields.description: Final total price for the entire quantity of this line item, including discounts.

fields.name: discountedTotalPriceWithCodeDiscount
fields.description: The total price for the entire quantity of this line item, after all discounts are applied, at both the line item and code-based line item level.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceSet
fields.description: The price of a single variant unit after discounts are applied at the line item level, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceWithCodeDiscount
fields.description: The price of a single variant unit after all discounts are applied, at both the line item and code-based line item level.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: image
fields.description:
The image associated with the line item's variant or product.
NULL if the line item has no product, or if neither the variant nor the product have an image.

fields.name: originalTotalPriceSet
fields.description: Original total price for the entire quantity of this line item, before discounts.

fields.name: originalUnitPriceSet
fields.description: Original price for a single unit of this line item, before discounts.

fields.name: product
fields.description:
Product for this line item.
NULL for custom line items and products that were deleted after checkout began.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the line item.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: SKU for the inventory item associated with the variant, if any.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the line item. Defaults to the product's title.

fields.name: variant
fields.description:
Product variant for this line item.
NULL for custom line items and variants that were deleted after checkout began.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description:
Title of the variant for this line item.
NULL for custom line items and products that don't have distinct variants.

fields.description: The item at the end of AbandonedCheckoutLineItemEdge.

fields.name: isFromOnlineStore

fields.name: isFromShopPay

fields.name: isMostSignificantAbandonment

fields.name: lastBrowseAbandonmentDate

fields.name: lastCartAbandonmentDate
fields.description: The date for the latest cart abandonment.

fields.name: lastCheckoutAbandonmentDate

fields.name: mostRecentStep

fields.name: productsAddedToCart
fields.description: The products added to the cart during the customer abandoned visit.

types.name: AccessScope
types.description: The permission required to access a Shopify Admin API or Storefront API resource for a shop. Merchants grant access scopes that are requested by applications.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the actions that the access scope allows an app to perform.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: A readable string that represents the access scope. The string usually follows the format `{action}_{resource}`. `{action}` is `read` or `write`, and `{resource}` is the resource that the action can be performed on. `{action}` and `{resource}` are separated by an underscore. For example, `read_orders` or `write_products`.

types.name: ApiVersion
types.description:
A version of the API, as defined by [Shopify API versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).
Versions are commonly referred to by their handle (for example, `2021-10`).

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The human-readable name of the version.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The unique identifier of an ApiVersion. All supported API versions have a date-based (YYYY-MM) or `unstable` handle.

fields.name: supported
fields.description: Whether the version is actively supported by Shopify. Supported API versions are guaranteed to be stable. Unsupported API versions include unstable, release candidate, and end-of-life versions that are marked as unsupported. For more information, refer to [Versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).

Corresponding AppInstallation for this shop and App.

fields.description: Detailed information about the app pricing.

fields.name: pricingDetailsSummary
fields.description: Summary of the app pricing details.

fields.name: privacyPolicyUrl
fields.description: Link to app privacy policy.

fields.name: publicCategory
fields.description: The public category for the app.

fields.name: published
fields.description: Whether the app is published to the Shopify App Store.

fields.name: requestedAccessScopes
fields.description: The access scopes requested by the app.

fields.name: screenshots
fields.description: Screenshots of the app.

fields.name: shopifyDeveloped
fields.description: Whether the app was developed by Shopify.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Name of the app.

fields.name: uninstallMessage
fields.description:
Message that appears when the app is uninstalled. For example:
By removing this app, you will no longer be able to publish products to MySocialSite or view this app in your Shopify admin. You can re-enable this channel at any time.

fields.name: uninstallUrl
fields.description: Webpage where you can uninstall the app.

fields.name: webhookApiVersion
fields.description: The webhook API version for the app.

fields.name: confirmationUrl
fields.description:
The URL that the merchant can access to approve or decline the newly created app one-time purchase.

If the merchant declines, then the merchant is redirected to the app and receives a notification message stating that the charge was declined.
If the merchant approves and they're successfully invoiced, then the state of the charge changes from `pending` to `active`.

You get paid after the charge is activated.

types.name: AppPurchaseStatus
types.description:
The approval status of the app purchase.

The merchant is charged for the purchase immediately after approval, and the status changes to `active`.
If the payment fails, then the app purchase remains `pending`.

Purchases start as `pending` and can change to: `active`, `declined`, `expired`. After a purchase changes, it
remains in that final state.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The app purchase has been approved by the merchant and is ready to be activated by the app. App purchases created through the GraphQL Admin API are activated upon approval.
enumValues.deprecationReason: As of API version 2021-01, when a merchant accepts an app purchase, the status immediately changes from `pending` to `active`.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The app purchase was approved by the merchant and has been activated by the app. Active app purchases are charged to the merchant and are paid out to the partner.

enumValues.name: DECLINED
enumValues.description: The app purchase was declined by the merchant.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The app purchase was not accepted within two days of being created.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The app purchase is pending approval by the merchant.

types.name: AppRecurringPricing

The object contains an interval (the frequency at which the shop is billed for an app subscription) and
a price (the amount to be charged to the subscribing shop at each interval).

fields.description: The frequency at which the subscribing shop is billed for an app subscription.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The amount and currency to be charged to the subscribing shop every billing interval.

types.name: AppSubscriptionReplacementBehavior
types.description: The replacement behavior when creating an app subscription for a merchant with an already existing app subscription.

enumValues.name: APPLY_IMMEDIATELY
enumValues.description: Cancels the merchant's current app subscription immediately and replaces it with the newly created app subscription.

enumValues.name: APPLY_ON_NEXT_BILLING_CYCLE
enumValues.description: Defers canceling the merchant's current app subscription and applying the newly created app subscription until the start of the next billing cycle. This value is ignored if the new app subscription is using a different currency than the current app subscription, in which case the new app subscription is applied immediately.

enumValues.name: STANDARD
enumValues.description:
Cancels the merchant's current app subscription immediately and replaces it with the newly created app subscription, with the exception of
the following scenarios where replacing the current app subscription will be deferred until the start of the next billing cycle.
1) The current app subscription is annual and the newly created app subscription is annual, using the same currency, but is of a lesser value.
2) The current app subscription is annual and the newly created app subscription is monthly and using the same currency.
3) The current app subscription and the newly created app subscription are identical except for the `discount` value.

types.name: AppSubscriptionStatus
types.description: The status of the app subscription.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The app subscription has been approved by the merchant and is ready to be activated by the app.
enumValues.deprecationReason: As of API version 2021-01, when a merchant approves an app subscription, the status immediately transitions from `pending` to `active`.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The app subscription has been approved by the merchant. Active app subscriptions are billed to the shop. After payment, partners receive payouts.

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The app subscription was cancelled by the app. This could be caused by the app being uninstalled, a new app subscription being activated, or a direct cancellation by the app. This is a terminal state.

enumValues.name: DECLINED
enumValues.description: The app subscription was declined by the merchant. This is a terminal state.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The app subscription wasn't approved by the merchant within two days of being created. This is a terminal state.

enumValues.name: FROZEN
enumValues.description: The app subscription is on hold due to non-payment. The subscription re-activates after payments resume.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The app subscription is pending approval by the merchant.

types.name: AppUsagePricing
types.description:
Defines a usage pricing model for the app subscription.
These charges are variable based on how much the merchant uses the app.

fields.name: balanceUsed
fields.description: The total usage records for interval.

fields.name: cappedAmount
fields.description:
The capped amount prevents the merchant from being charged for any usage over that amount during a billing period.
This prevents billing from exceeding a maximum threshold over the duration of the billing period.
For the merchant to continue using the app after exceeding a capped amount, they would need to agree to a new usage charge.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The frequency with which the app usage records are billed.

fields.name: terms
fields.description:
The terms and conditions for app usage pricing.
Must be present in order to create usage charges.
The terms are presented to the merchant when they approve an app's usage charges.

types.name: AppUsagePricingInput
types.description: The input fields to issue arbitrary charges for app usage associated with a subscription.

inputFields.name: cappedAmount
inputFields.description: The maximum amount of usage charges that can be incurred within a subscription billing interval.

inputFields.name: terms
inputFields.description: The terms and conditions for app usage. These terms stipulate the pricing model for the charges that an app creates.

types.name: BulkOperation
types.description:
An asynchronous long-running operation to fetch data in bulk or to bulk import data.

Bulk operations are created using the `bulkOperationRunQuery` or `bulkOperationRunMutation` mutation. After
they are created, clients should poll the `status` field for updates. When `COMPLETED`, the `url` field contains
a link to the data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.

Refer to the [bulk operations guide](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/bulk-operations/imports) for more details.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was successfully completed.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was created.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: Error code for failed operations.

fields.name: fileSize
fields.description: File size in bytes of the file in the `url` field.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: objectCount
fields.description:
A running count of all the objects processed.
For example, when fetching all the products and their variants, this field counts both products and variants.
This field can be used to track operation progress.

fields.name: partialDataUrl
fields.description:
The URL that points to the partial or incomplete response data (in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format) that was returned by a failed operation.
The URL expires 7 days after the operation fails. Returns `null` when there's no data available.

fields.name: query
fields.description: GraphQL query document specified in `bulkOperationRunQuery`.

fields.name: rootObjectCount
fields.description:
A running count of all the objects that are processed at the root of the query.
For example, when fetching all the products and their variants, this field only counts products.
This field can be used to track operation progress.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the bulk operation.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The bulk operation's type.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The URL that points to the response data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.
The URL expires 7 days after the operation completes.

enumValues.name: ACCESS_DENIED
enumValues.description:
The provided operation `query` returned access denied due to missing
[access scopes](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/access-scopes).
Review the requested object permissions and execute the query as a normal non-bulk GraphQL request to see more details.

enumValues.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
enumValues.description:
The operation resulted in partial or incomplete data due to internal server errors during execution.
These errors might be intermittent, so you can try performing the same query again.

enumValues.name: TIMEOUT
enumValues.description:
The operation resulted in partial or incomplete data due to query timeouts during execution.
In some cases, timeouts can be avoided by modifying your `query` to select fewer fields.

[checkoutBrandingUpsert](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/unstable/mutations/checkoutBrandingUpsert) mutation.

types.name: CheckoutBrandingCornerRadius
types.description:
The options for customizing the corner radius of checkout-related objects. Examples include the primary
button, the name text fields and the sections within the main area (if they have borders).
Refer to this complete [list](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/CheckoutBrandingCornerRadius#fieldswith)
for objects with customizable corner radii.

The design system defines the corner radius pixel size for each option. Modify the defaults by setting the
[designSystem.cornerRadius](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/input-objects/CheckoutBrandingDesignSystemInput#field-checkoutbrandingdesignsysteminput-cornerradius)
input fields.

enumValues.name: BASE
enumValues.description: The corner radius with a pixel value defined by designSystem.cornerRadius.base.

enumValues.name: LARGE
enumValues.description: The corner radius with a pixel value defined by designSystem.cornerRadius.large.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: The 0px corner radius (square corners).

enumValues.name: SMALL
enumValues.description: The corner radius with a pixel value defined by designSystem.cornerRadius.small.

types.name: CheckoutBrandingCornerRadiusVariables
types.description: Define the pixel size of corner radius options.

fields.name: base
fields.description: The value in pixels for base corner radii. Example: 5.

fields.name: large
fields.description: The value in pixels for large corner radii. Example: 10.

fields.name: small
fields.description: The value in pixels for small corner radii. Example: 3.

types.name: CheckoutBrandingCornerRadiusVariablesInput

inputFields.name: small
inputFields.description: The value in pixels for small corner radii. It should be greater than zero. Example: 3.

types.name: CheckoutBrandingFontLoadingStrategy
types.description:
The font loading strategy determines how a font face is displayed after it is loaded or failed to load.
For more information: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-display.

enumValues.name: AUTO
enumValues.description: The font display strategy is defined by the browser user agent.

enumValues.name: BLOCK
enumValues.description: Gives the font face a short block period and an infinite swap period.

enumValues.name: FALLBACK
enumValues.description: Gives the font face an extremely small block period and a short swap period.

enumValues.name: OPTIONAL
enumValues.description: Gives the font face an extremely small block period and no swap period.

enumValues.name: SWAP
enumValues.description: Gives the font face an extremely small block period and an infinite swap period.

fields.name: ratio

types.description: The input fields used to update the font size.

inputFields.name: base
inputFields.description: The base font size. Its value should be between 12.0 and 18.0.

inputFields.name: ratio
inputFields.description: The scale ratio used to derive all font sizes such as small and large. Its value should be between 1.0 and 1.4.

For more customizations options, set the [corner radius](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/CheckoutBrandingCornerRadius)
selection on specific objects while leaving the global corner radius unset.

enumValues.description: Set the global corner radius override to 0px (square corners).

font family and size for primary and secondary text elements.

Refer to the [typography tutorial](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/checkout/styling/customize-typography)
for further information on typography customization.

enumValues.description: Base or default kerning.

enumValues.name: EXTRA_LOOSE
enumValues.description: Extra loose kerning, leaving even more space in between characters.

enumValues.name: LOOSE
enumValues.description: Loose kerning, leaving more space than the default in between characters.

types.name: CheckoutBrandingTypographyLetterCase
types.description: Possible values for the typography letter case.

enumValues.name: LOWER
enumValues.description: All letters are is lower case.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: No letter casing applied.

enumValues.name: TITLE
enumValues.description: Capitalize the first letter of each word.

enumValues.name: UPPER
enumValues.description: All letters are uppercase.

Possible choices for the font size.

Note that the value in pixels of these settings can be customized with the
[typography size](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/input-objects/CheckoutBrandingFontSizeInput)

for more information.

types.name: Collection
types.description:
Represents a group of products that can be displayed in online stores and other sales channels in categories, which makes it easy for customers to find them. For example, an athletics store might create different collections for running attire, shoes, and accessories.

Collections can be defined by conditions, such as whether they match certain product tags. These are called smart or automated collections.

Collections can also be created for a custom group of products. These are called custom or manual collections.

fields.name: availablePublicationCount
fields.description: The number of publications a resource is published to without feedback errors.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A single-line, text-only description of the collection, stripped of any HTML tags and formatting that were included in the description.

args.name: truncateAt
args.description: Truncates string after the given length.

fields.name: descriptionHtml
fields.description: The description of the collection, including any HTML tags and formatting. This content is typically displayed to customers, such as on an online store, depending on the theme.

fields.name: feedback
fields.description: Information about the collection that's provided through resource feedback.

fields.name: handle
fields.description:
A unique string that identifies the collection. If a handle isn't specified when a collection is created, it's automatically generated from the collection's original title, and typically includes words from the title separated by hyphens. For example, a collection that was created with the title `Summer Catalog 2022` might have the handle `summer-catalog-2022`.

If the title is changed, the handle doesn't automatically change.

The handle can be used in themes by the Liquid templating language to refer to the collection, but using the ID is preferred because it never changes.

fields.name: hasProduct
fields.description: Whether the collection includes the specified product.

args.description: The ID of the product to check.

enumValues.name: ALPHA_ASC
enumValues.description: Alphabetically, in ascending order (A - Z).

enumValues.name: ALPHA_DESC
enumValues.description: Alphabetically, in descending order (Z - A).

enumValues.name: BEST_SELLING
enumValues.description: By best-selling products.

enumValues.name: CREATED
enumValues.description: By date created, in ascending order (oldest - newest).

enumValues.name: CREATED_DESC
enumValues.description: By date created, in descending order (newest - oldest).

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: In the order set manually by the merchant.

enumValues.name: PRICE_ASC
enumValues.description: By price, in ascending order (lowest - highest).

enumValues.name: PRICE_DESC
enumValues.description: By price, in descending order (highest - lowest).

types.name: CommentEvent
types.description:
Comment events are generated by staff members of a shop.
They are created when a staff member adds a comment to the timeline of an order, draft order, customer, or transfer.

fields.name: appTitle
fields.description: The name of the app that created the event.

fields.name: attachments
fields.description: The attachments associated with the comment event.

fields.name: attributeToApp
fields.description: Whether the event was created by an app.

fields.name: attributeToUser
fields.description: Whether the event was caused by an admin user.

fields.name: author
fields.description: The name of the user that authored the comment event.

fields.name: canDelete
fields.description: Whether the comment event can be deleted. If true, then the comment event can be deleted.

fields.name: canEdit
fields.description: Whether the comment event can be edited. If true, then the comment event can be edited.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the event was created.

fields.name: criticalAlert
fields.description: Whether the event is critical.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: Whether the comment event has been edited. If true, then the comment event has been edited.

fields.name: embed
fields.description: The object reference associated with the comment event. For example, a product or discount).

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Human readable text that describes the event.

fields.name: rawMessage
fields.description: The raw body of the comment event.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The parent subject to which the comment event belongs.

types.name: CommentEventAttachment
types.description: A file attachment associated to a comment event.

fields.name: fileExtension
fields.description: The file extension of the comment event attachment, indicating the file format.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image attached to the comment event.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The filename of the comment event attachment.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size of the attachment.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of the attachment.

types.name: CommentEventEmbed
types.description: The main embed of a comment event.

types.name: CommentEventSubject
types.description: The subject line of a comment event.

fields.name: hasTimelineComment
fields.description: Whether the timeline subject has a timeline comment. If true, then a timeline comment exists.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

types.name: CompanyAddress
types.description: Represents a billing or shipping address for a company location.

fields.name: address1
fields.description: The first line of the address. Typically the street address or PO Box number.

fields.name: address2
fields.description: The second line of the address. Typically the number of the apartment, suite, or unit.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The name of the city, district, village, or town.

fields.name: companyName
fields.description: The name of the company.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The name of the country.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description:
The two-letter code for the country of the address.
For example, US.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time ([ISO 8601 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)) at which the company address was created.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: The first name of the recipient.

fields.name: formattedAddress
fields.description: The formatted version of the address.

args.name: withCompanyName
args.description: Whether to include the company name in the formatted address.

args.name: withName
args.description: Whether to include the recipient's name in the formatted address.

fields.name: formattedArea
fields.description: A comma-separated list of the values for city, province, and country.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: The last name of the recipient.

fields.name: phone
fields.description:
A unique phone number for the customer.
Formatted using E.164 standard. For example, _+16135551111_.

fields.name: province
fields.description: The region of the address, such as the province, state, or district.

fields.name: recipient
fields.description: The identity of the recipient e.g. 'Receiving Department'.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time ([ISO 8601 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)) at which the company address was last updated.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The zip or postal code of the address.

fields.name: zoneCode
fields.description:
The two-letter code for the region.
For example, ON.

types.name: CountryCode
types.description:
The code designating a country/region, which generally follows ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 guidelines.
If a territory doesn't have a country code value in the `CountryCode` enum, then it might be considered a subdivision
of another country. For example, the territories associated with Spain are represented by the country code `ES`,
and the territories associated with the United States of America are represented by the country code `US`.

types.name: CountryHarmonizedSystemCode
types.description: The country-specific harmonized system code and ISO country code for an inventory item.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the country that issued the specified harmonized system code.

fields.name: harmonizedSystemCode
fields.description: The country-specific harmonized system code. These are usually longer than 6 digits.

types.name: CountryHarmonizedSystemCodeConnection
types.description: An auto-generated type for paginating through multiple CountryHarmonizedSystemCodes.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of the nodes contained in CountryHarmonizedSystemCodeEdge.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: CountryHarmonizedSystemCodeEdge
types.description: An auto-generated type which holds one CountryHarmonizedSystemCode and a cursor during pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of CountryHarmonizedSystemCodeEdge.

types.name: CountryHarmonizedSystemCodeInput
types.description: The input fields required to specify a harmonized system code.

inputFields.name: countryCode
inputFields.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the country that issued the specified harmonized system code.

inputFields.name: harmonizedSystemCode
inputFields.description: Country specific harmonized system code.

types.name: CreateMediaInput
types.description: The input fields required to create a media object.

inputFields.name: alt
inputFields.description: The alt text associated with the media.

inputFields.name: mediaContentType
inputFields.description: The media content type.

inputFields.name: originalSource
inputFields.description: The original source of the media object. This might be an external URL or a staged upload URL.

types.name: CropRegion
types.description: The part of the image that should remain after cropping.

enumValues.name: BOTTOM
enumValues.description: Keep the bottom of the image.

enumValues.name: CENTER
enumValues.description: Keep the center of the image.

enumValues.name: LEFT
enumValues.description: Keep the left of the image.

enumValues.name: RIGHT
enumValues.description: Keep the right of the image.

enumValues.name: TOP
enumValues.description: Keep the top of the image.

types.name: CurrencyCode
types.description:
The three-letter currency codes that represent the world currencies used in stores. These include standard ISO 4217 codes, legacy codes,
and non-standard codes.

types.name: Customer
types.description:
Represents information about a customer of the shop, such as the customer's contact details, their order
history, and whether they've agreed to receive marketing material by email.

**Caution:** Only use this data if it's required for your app's functionality. Shopify will restrict [access to scopes](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/access-scopes) for apps that don't have a legitimate use for the associated data.

fields.name: addresses
fields.description: A list of addresses associated with the customer.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

fields.name: amountSpent
fields.description: The total amount that the customer has spent on orders in their lifetime.

fields.name: canDelete
fields.description:
Whether the merchant can delete the customer from their store.

A customer can be deleted from a store only if they haven't yet made an order. After a customer makes an
order, they can't be deleted from a store.

fields.name: companyContactProfiles
fields.description: A list of the customer's company contact profiles.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the customer was added to the store.

fields.name: defaultAddress
fields.description: The default address associated with the customer.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description:
The full name of the customer, based on the values for first_name and last_name. If the first_name and
last_name are not available, then this falls back to the customer's email address, and if that is not available, the customer's phone number.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer's email address.

fields.name: emailMarketingConsent
fields.description:
The current email marketing state for the customer.
If the customer doesn't have an email address, then this property is `null`.

fields.name: events
fields.description: A list of events associated with the customer.

types.name: CustomerEmailMarketingConsentInput
types.description:
Information that describes when a customer consented to
        receiving marketing material by email.

inputFields.name: consentUpdatedAt
inputFields.description:
The latest date and time when the customer consented or objected to
          receiving marketing material by email.

inputFields.name: marketingOptInLevel
inputFields.description: The customer opt-in level at the time of subscribing to marketing material.

inputFields.name: marketingState
inputFields.description:
The current marketing state associated with the customer's email.
          If the customer doesn't have an email, then this field is `null`.

types.name: CustomerEmailMarketingConsentState
types.description: The record of when a customer consented to receive marketing material by email.

fields.name: consentUpdatedAt
fields.description:
The date and time at which the customer consented to receive marketing material by email.
The customer's consent state reflects the consent record with the most recent `consent_updated_at` date.
If no date is provided, then the date and time at which the consent information was sent is used.

fields.name: marketingOptInLevel
fields.description:
The marketing subscription opt-in level, as described by the M3AAWG best practices guidelines,
that the customer gave when they consented to receive marketing material by email.

fields.name: marketingState
fields.description: The current email marketing state for the customer.

types.name: CustomerInput
types.description: The input fields and values to use when creating or updating a customer.

inputFields.name: addresses
inputFields.description: The addresses for a customer.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The unique email address of the customer.

inputFields.name: emailMarketingConsent
inputFields.description:
Information that describes when the customer consented to receiving marketing
        material by email. The `email` field is required when creating a customer with email marketing
        consent information.

inputFields.name: firstName
inputFields.description: The customer's first name.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the customer to update.

inputFields.name: lastName
inputFields.description: The customer's last name.

inputFields.name: locale
inputFields.description: The customer's locale.

inputFields.name: metafields
inputFields.description: Additional metafields to associate to the customer.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: A note about the customer.

inputFields.name: phone
inputFields.description: The unique phone number for the customer.

inputFields.name: smsMarketingConsent
inputFields.description:
The marketing consent information when the customer consented to receiving marketing
        material by SMS. The `phone` field is required when creating a customer with SMS
        marketing consent information.

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description:
A list of tags to associate with the customer. Can be an array or a comma-separated list. Example values: `["tag1", "tag2", "tag3"]`, `"tag1, tag2, tag3"`

Updating `tags` overwrites any existing tags that were previously added to the customer. To add new tags without overwriting
existing tags, use the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/tagsadd)
mutation.

inputFields.name: taxExempt

types.name: CustomerMarketingOptInLevel
types.description:
The possible values for the marketing subscription opt-in level enabled at the time the customer consented to receive marketing information.

The levels are defined by [the M3AAWG best practices guideline
  document](https://www.m3aawg.org/sites/maawg/files/news/M3AAWG_Senders_BCP_Ver3-2015-02.pdf).

enumValues.name: CONFIRMED_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
After providing their information, the customer receives a confirmation and is required to
perform a intermediate step before receiving marketing information.

enumValues.name: SINGLE_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
After providing their information, the customer receives marketing information without any
intermediate steps.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The customer receives marketing information but how they were opted in is unknown.

The customer's last subscription contract expired and there are no other active or paused
subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description:
The customer's last subscription contract failed and there are no other active or paused
subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: NEVER_SUBSCRIBED
enumValues.description: The customer has never had a subscription contract.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description:
The customer has at least one paused subscription contract and there are no other active
subscription contracts.

types.name: CustomerVisit
types.description: Represents a customer's session visiting a shop's online store, including information about the marketing activity attributed to starting the session.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: landingPage
fields.description: URL of the first page the customer landed on for the session.

fields.name: landingPageHtml
fields.description: Landing page information with URL linked in HTML. For example, the first page the customer visited was store.myshopify.com/products/1.

fields.name: marketingEvent
fields.description:
Represent actions taken by an app, on behalf of a merchant,
to market Shopify resources such as products, collections, and discounts.

fields.name: occurredAt
fields.description: The date and time when the customer's session occurred.

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
Marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit the store.
Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_.
For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

fields.name: referralInfoHtml
fields.description: Referral information with URLs linked in HTML.

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description:
Webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to the online store.
For example, _https://randomblog.com/page1_ or _android-app://com.google.android.gm_.

fields.name: source
fields.description:
Source from which the customer visited the store, such as a platform (Facebook, Google), email, direct,
a website domain, QR code, or unknown.

fields.name: sourceDescription
fields.description: Describes the source explicitly for first or last session.

fields.name: sourceType
fields.description: Type of marketing tactic.

fields.name: utmParameters
fields.description: A set of UTM parameters gathered from the URL parameters of the referrer.

types.name: Date
types.description:
Represents an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)-encoded date string.
For example, September 7, 2019 is represented as `"2019-07-16"`.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
Represents an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)-encoded date and time string.
For example, 3:50 pm on September 7, 2019 in the time zone of UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) is
represented as `"2019-09-07T15:50:00Z`".

inputFields.name: zonesToUpdate

**Note:** due to the potential complexity of the nested data, it is recommended to send no more than 5 zones per each request.

types.name: Discount
types.description: A discount.

types.name: DiscountAllocation
types.description: An amount that's allocated to a line based on an associated discount application.

fields.name: allocatedAmount
fields.description: The money amount that's allocated to a line based on the associated discount application.

fields.name: allocatedAmountSet
fields.description: The money amount that's allocated to a line based on the associated discount application in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: discountApplication
fields.description: The discount application that the allocated amount originated from.

types.name: DiscountAmount
types.description: The fixed amount value of a discount, and whether the amount is applied to each entitled item or spread evenly across the entitled items.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The value of the discount.

fields.name: appliesOnEachItem
fields.description: If true, then the discount is applied to each of the entitled items. If false, then the amount is split across all of the entitled items.

types.name: DiscountAmountInput
types.description: The input fields for the value of the discount and how it is applied.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The value of the discount.

inputFields.name: appliesOnEachItem
inputFields.description: If true, then the discount is applied to each of the entitled items. If false, then the amount is split across all of the entitled items.

types.name: DiscountApplication
types.description:
Discount applications capture the intentions of a discount source at
the time of application on an order's line items or shipping lines.

Discount applications don't represent the actual final amount discounted on a line (line item or shipping line). The actual amount discounted on a line is represented by the [DiscountAllocation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/discountallocation) object.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is applied to its entitled items.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
An ordered index that can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

types.name: DiscountApplicationAllocationMethod
types.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated onto its entitled lines.

enumValues.name: ACROSS
enumValues.description: The value is spread across all entitled lines.

enumValues.name: EACH
enumValues.description: The value is applied onto every entitled line.

enumValues.name: ONE
enumValues.description: The value is specifically applied onto a particular line.
enumValues.deprecationReason: Use ACROSS instead.

fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.description: A list of the nodes contained in DiscountApplicationEdge.

types.name: DiscountApplicationLevel
types.description: The level at which the discount's value is applied.

enumValues.name: LINE
enumValues.description:
The discount is applied at the line level.
Line level discounts are factored into the discountedUnitPriceSet on line items.

enumValues.name: ORDER
enumValues.description:
The discount is applied at the order level.
Order level discounts are not factored into the discountedUnitPriceSet on line items.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetSelection
types.description:
The lines on the order to which the discount is applied, of the type defined by
the discount application's `targetType`. For example, the value `ENTITLED`, combined with a `targetType` of
`LINE_ITEM`, applies the discount on all line items that are entitled to the discount.
The value `ALL`, combined with a `targetType` of `SHIPPING_LINE`, applies the discount on all shipping lines.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto all the lines.

enumValues.name: ENTITLED
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto only the lines that it's entitled for.

enumValues.name: EXPLICIT
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto explicitly chosen lines.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetType
types.description: The type of line (i.e. line item or shipping line) on an order that the discount is applicable towards.

enumValues.name: LINE_ITEM
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto line items.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_LINE
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto shipping lines.

types.name: DiscountAutomatic
types.description: The type of discount associated to the automatic discount. For example, the automatic discount might offer a basic discount using a fixed percentage, or a fixed amount, on specific products from the order. The automatic discount may also be a BXGY discount, which offers customer discounts on select products if they add a specific product to their order.

types.name: DiscountCode
types.description: The type of discount associated with the discount code. For example, the discount code might offer a basic discount of a fixed percentage, or a fixed amount, on specific products or the order. Alternatively, the discount might offer the customer free shipping on their order. A third option is a Buy X, Get Y (BXGY) discount, which offers a customer discounts on select products if they add a specific product to their order.

types.name: DiscountCodeApplication
types.description:
Discount code applications capture the intentions of a discount code at
the time that it is applied onto an order.

Discount applications don't represent the actual final amount discounted on a line (line item or shipping line). The actual amount discounted on a line is represented by the [DiscountAllocation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/discountallocation) object.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is applied to its entitled items.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The string identifying the discount code that was used at the time of application.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
An ordered index that can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

Alternatively, it might be a fixed amount evenly distributed across all items or on each individual item. A third example is a percentage discount on all items.

types.name: DiscountCustomerSelection
types.description: The type used for targeting a set of customers who are eligible for the discount. For example, the discount might be available to all customers or it might only be available to a specific set of customers. You can define the set of customers by targeting a list of customer segments, or by targeting a list of specific customers.

inputFields.name: customers
inputFields.description: The list of customer IDs to add or remove from the list of customers.

types.name: DiscountErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `DiscountUserError`.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE_PERIOD_OVERLAP
enumValues.description: The active period overlaps with other automatic discounts. At any given time, only one automatic discount can be active.

enumValues.name: BLANK
enumValues.description: The input value is blank.

enumValues.name: CONFLICT
enumValues.description: The attribute selection contains conflicting settings.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The input value is already present.

enumValues.name: EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be equal to the value allowed.

enumValues.name: EXCEEDED_MAX
enumValues.description: The value exceeded the maximum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than the minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than or equal to the minimum value allowed.

enumValues.name: IMPLICIT_DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The value is already present through another selection.

enumValues.name: INCLUSION
enumValues.description: The input value isn't included in the list.

enumValues.name: INTERNAL_ERROR
enumValues.description: Unexpected internal error happened.

enumValues.name: INVALID
enumValues.description: The input value is invalid.

enumValues.name: INVALID_COMBINES_WITH_FOR_DISCOUNT_CLASS
enumValues.description: The `combinesWith` settings are invalid for the discount class.

enumValues.name: INVALID_DISCOUNT_CLASS_FOR_PRICE_RULE
enumValues.description: The discountClass is invalid for the price rule.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than or equal to the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: MAX_APP_DISCOUNTS
enumValues.description: The active period overlaps with too many other app-provided discounts. There's a limit on the number of app discounts that can be active at any given time.

enumValues.name: MINIMUM_SUBTOTAL_AND_QUANTITY_RANGE_BOTH_PRESENT
enumValues.description: Specify a minimum subtotal or a quantity, but not both.

enumValues.name: MISSING_ARGUMENT
enumValues.description: Missing a required argument.

enumValues.name: PRESENT
enumValues.description: The input value needs to be blank.

enumValues.name: TAKEN
enumValues.description: The input value is already taken.

enumValues.name: TOO_LONG
enumValues.description: The input value is too long.

enumValues.name: TOO_MANY_ARGUMENTS
enumValues.description: Too many arguments provided.

enumValues.name: TOO_SHORT
enumValues.description: The input value is too short.

enumValues.name: VALUE_OUTSIDE_RANGE
enumValues.description: The value is outside of the allowed range.

types.name: DiscountItems
types.description: The type used to target the items required for discount eligibility, or the items to which the application of a discount might apply. For example, for a customer to be eligible for a discount, they're required to add an item from a specified collection to their order. Alternatively, a customer might be required to add a specific product or product variant. When using this type to target which items the discount will apply to, the discount might apply to all items on the order, or to specific products and product variants, or items in a given collection.

types.name: DiscountItemsInput
types.description: The input fields for the items attached to a discount. You can specify the discount items by product ID or collection ID.

inputFields.name: all
inputFields.description: Whether all items should be selected.

inputFields.name: collections
inputFields.description: The collections that are attached to a discount.

inputFields.name: products
inputFields.description: The products and product variants that are attached to a discount.

types.description: The input fields for the minimum quantity required for the discount.

inputFields.name: greaterThanOrEqualToQuantity
inputFields.description: The minimum quantity of items that's required for the discount to be applied.

types.name: DiscountMinimumRequirement
types.description: The type of minimum requirement that must be met for the discount to be applied. For example, a customer must spend a minimum subtotal to be eligible for the discount. Alternatively, a customer must purchase a minimum quantity of items to be eligible for the discount.

types.name: DiscountMinimumRequirementInput
types.description: The input fields for the minimum quantity or subtotal required for a discount.

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The minimum required quantity.

inputFields.name: subtotal
inputFields.description: The minimum required subtotal.

types.description: The input fields for the minimum subtotal required for a discount.

inputFields.name: greaterThanOrEqualToSubtotal
inputFields.description: The minimum subtotal that's required for the discount to be applied.

types.name: DraftOrder
types.description:
An order that a merchant creates on behalf of a customer. Draft orders are useful for merchants that need to do the following tasks:

- Create new orders for sales made by phone, in person, by chat, or elsewhere. When a merchant accepts payment for a draft order, an order is created.
- Send invoices to customers to pay with a secure checkout link.
- Use custom items to represent additional costs or products that aren't displayed in a shop's inventory.
- Re-create orders manually from active sales channels.
- Sell products at discount or wholesale rates.
- Take pre-orders.
- Save an order as a draft and resume working on it later.

For Draft orders in multiple currencies `presentment_money` is the source of truth for what a customer is going to be charged and `shop_money` is an estimate of what the merchant might receive in their local currency.

**Caution:** Only use this data if it's required for your app's functionality. Shopify will restrict [access to scopes](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/access-scopes) for apps that don't have a legitimate use for the associated data.

inputFields.name: appliedDiscount
inputFields.description:
The discount that will be applied to the draft order.
A draft order line item can have one discount. A draft order can also have one order-level discount.

inputFields.name: billingAddress
inputFields.description: The mailing address associated with the payment method.

inputFields.name: customAttributes
inputFields.description: Extra information added to the customer.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The customer's email address.

inputFields.description:
Product variant line item or custom line item associated to the draft order.
Each draft order must include at least one line item.

inputFields.description: The localization extensions attached to the draft order. For example, Tax IDs.

inputFields.name: marketRegionCountryCode
inputFields.description: The selected country code that determines the pricing of the draft order.

inputFields.name: metafields
inputFields.description: Metafields attached to the draft order.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the draft order.

inputFields.name: paymentTerms
inputFields.description: The fields used to create payment terms.

inputFields.name: phone
inputFields.description: The customer's phone number.

inputFields.name: poNumber
inputFields.description: The purchase order number.

inputFields.name: presentmentCurrencyCode
inputFields.description: The payment currency of the customer for this draft order.

inputFields.name: purchasingEntity
inputFields.description: The purchasing entity for this draft order.

inputFields.name: reserveInventoryUntil
inputFields.description: Time after which inventory will automatically be restocked.

inputFields.name: shippingAddress
inputFields.description: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped.

inputFields.name: shippingLine
inputFields.description: A shipping line object, which details the shipping method used.

inputFields.name: sourceName
inputFields.description:
The source of the checkout.
          To use this field for sales attribution, you must register the channels that your app is managing.
          You can register the channels that your app is managing by completing
          [this Google Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScmVTZRQNjOJ7RD738mL1lGeFjqKVe_FM2tO9xsm21QEo5Ozg/viewform?usp=sf_link).
          After you've submitted your request, you need to wait for your request to be processed by Shopify.
          You can find a list of your channels in the Partner Dashboard, in your app's Marketplace extension.
          You need to specify the handle as the `source_name` value in your request.
          The handle is the channel that the order was placed from.

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description: A comma separated list of tags that have been added to the draft order.

inputFields.name: taxExempt
inputFields.description:
Whether or not taxes are exempt for the draft order.
If false, then Shopify will refer to the taxable field for each line item.
If a customer is applied to the draft order, then Shopify will use the customer's tax exempt field instead.

inputFields.name: useCustomerDefaultAddress
inputFields.description: Sent as part of a draft order object to load customer shipping information.

inputFields.name: visibleToCustomer
inputFields.description: Whether the draft order will be visible to the customer on the self-serve portal.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE_FILENAME_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because a file with the same name already exists.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_EMBED_DISABLED
enumValues.description: File could not be created because embed permissions are disabled for this video.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_EMBED_NOT_FOUND_OR_TRANSCODING
enumValues.description: File could not be created because video is either not found or still transcoding.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_INVALID_ASPECT_RATIO
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the external video has an invalid aspect ratio.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the external video could not be found.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_UNLISTED
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the external video is not listed or is private.

enumValues.name: FILE_STORAGE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the cumulative file storage limit would be exceeded.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_FILE_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the source could not be downloaded.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_FILE_INVALID_SIZE
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the size is too large.

enumValues.name: IMAGE_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the image could not be downloaded.

enumValues.name: IMAGE_PROCESSING_FAILURE
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the image could not be processed.

enumValues.name: INVALID_IMAGE_ASPECT_RATIO
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the image has an invalid aspect ratio.

enumValues.name: INVALID_IMAGE_FILE_SIZE
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the image size is too large.

enumValues.name: INVALID_IMAGE_RESOLUTION
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the image's resolution exceeds the max limit.

enumValues.name: INVALID_SIGNED_URL
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the signed URL was invalid.

enumValues.name: MEDIA_TIMEOUT_ERROR
enumValues.description: File timed out because it is currently being modified by another operation.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_GLB_OUTPUT_CREATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the model file failed processing.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_GLB_TO_USDZ_CONVERSION_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the model can't be converted to USDZ format.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_PROCESSING_FAILURE
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the model file failed processing.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_THUMBNAIL_GENERATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the model's thumbnail generation failed.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_THUMBNAIL_REGENERATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an issue while trying to generate a new thumbnail.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_VALIDATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Model failed validation.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: File error has occurred for an unknown reason.

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_IMAGE_FILE_TYPE
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the image is an unsupported file type.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_INVALID_FILETYPE_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it has an invalid file type.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_DURATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the maximum duration requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_HEIGHT_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the maximum height requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_WIDTH_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the maximum width requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_METADATA_READ_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the metadata could not be read.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_DURATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the minimum duration requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_HEIGHT_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the minimum height requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_WIDTH_ERROR
enumValues.description: File could not be created because it does not meet the minimum width requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_VALIDATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Video failed validation.

types.name: FinancialSummaryDiscountAllocation
types.description: An amount that's allocated to a line item based on an associated discount application.

fields.name: approximateAllocatedAmountPerItem
fields.description: The money amount that's allocated per unit on the associated line based on the discount application in shop and presentment currencies. If the allocated amount for the line cannot be evenly divided by the quantity, then this amount will be an approximate amount, avoiding fractional pennies. For example, if the associated line had a quantity of 3 with a discount of 4 cents, then the discount distribution would be [0.01, 0.01, 0.02]. This field returns the highest number of the distribution. In this example, this would be 0.02.

fields.name: discountApplication
fields.description: The discount application that the allocated amount originated from.

types.name: FinancialSummaryDiscountApplication
types.description:
Discount applications capture the intentions of a discount source at
the time of application on an order's line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is applied to its entitled items.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

Allowed tags: * `a` (allowed attributes: `href`, `target`) * `b` * `br` * `em` * `i` * `strong` * `u` Use [HTML](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/scalars/HTML) instead if you need to include other HTML tags. Example value: `"Your current domain is johns-apparel.myshopify.com."`

types.name: Fulfillment
types.description:
Represents a fulfillment.
In Shopify, a fulfillment represents a shipment of one or more items in an order.
When an order has been completely fulfilled, it means that all the items that are included
in the order have been sent to the customer.
There can be more than one fulfillment for an order.

fields.description: The date and time when the fulfillment was created.

fields.name: deliveredAt
fields.description: The date that this fulfillment was delivered.

fields.name: displayStatus
fields.description: Human readable display status for this fulfillment.

fields.name: estimatedDeliveryAt
fields.description: The estimated date that this fulfillment will arrive.

fields.name: events
fields.description: The history of events associated with this fulfillment.

types.name: FulfillmentOrder
types.description:
The FulfillmentOrder object represents either an item or a group of items in an
[Order](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Order)
that are expected to be fulfilled from the same location.
There can be more than one fulfillment order for an
[order](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Order)
at a given location.

{{ '/api/reference/fulfillment_order_relationships.png' | image }}

Fulfillment orders represent the work which is intended to be done in relation to an order.
When fulfillment has started for one or more line items, a
[Fulfillment](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Fulfillment)
is created by a merchant or third party to represent the ongoing or completed work of fulfillment.

[See below for more details on creating fulfillments](#the-lifecycle-of-a-fulfillment-order-at-a-location-which-is-managed-by-a-fulfillment-service).

> Note:
> Shopify creates fulfillment orders automatically when an order is created.
> It is not possible to manually create fulfillment orders.
>
> [See below for more details on the lifecycle of a fulfillment order](#the-lifecycle-of-a-fulfillment-order).

## Retrieving fulfillment orders

### Fulfillment orders from an order

All fulfillment orders related to a given order can be retrieved with the
[Order.fulfillmentOrders](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Order#connection-order-fulfillmentorders)
connection.

[API access scopes](#api-access-scopes)
govern which fulfillments orders are returned to clients.
An API client will only receive a subset of the fulfillment orders which belong to an order
if they don't have the necessary access scopes to view all of the fulfillment orders.

### Fulfillment orders assigned to the app for fulfillment

Fulfillment service apps can retrieve the fulfillment orders which have been assigned to their locations with the
[Shop.assignedFulfillmentOrders](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Shop#connection-shop-assignedfulfillmentorders)
connection.
Use the `assignmentStatus` argument to control whether all assigned fulfillment orders
should be returned or only those where a merchant has sent a
[fulfillment request](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrderMerchantRequest)
and it has yet to be responded to.

The API client must be granted the `read_assigned_fulfillment_orders` access scope to access
the assigned fulfillment orders.

### All fulfillment orders

Apps can retrieve all fulfillment orders with the
[fulfillmentOrders](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/queries/fulfillmentOrders)
query. This query returns all assigned, merchant-managed, and third-party fulfillment orders on the shop,
which are accessible to the app according to the
[fulfillment order access scopes](#api-access-scopes) it was granted with.

## The lifecycle of a fulfillment order

### Fulfillment Order Creation

After an order is created, a background worker performs the order routing process which determines
which locations will be responsible for fulfilling the purchased items.
Once the order routing process is complete, one or more fulfillment orders will be created
and assigned to these locations. It is not possible to manually create fulfillment orders.

Once a fulfillment order has been created, it will have one of two different lifecycles depending on
the type of location which the fulfillment order is assigned to.

### The lifecycle of a fulfillment order at a merchant managed location

Fulfillment orders are completed by creating
[fulfillments](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Fulfillment).
Fulfillments represents the work done.

For digital products a merchant or an order management app would create a fulfilment once the digital asset
has been provisioned.
For example, in the case of a digital gift card, a merchant would to do this once
the gift card has been activated - before the email has been shipped.

On the other hand, for a traditional shipped order,
a merchant or an order management app would create a fulfillment after picking and packing the items relating
to a fulfillment order, but before the courier has collected the goods.

[Learn about managing fulfillment orders as an order management app](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/order-management-apps/manage-fulfillments).

### The lifecycle of a fulfillment order at a location which is managed by a fulfillment service

For fulfillment orders which are assigned to a location that is managed by a fulfillment service,
a merchant or an Order Management App can
[send a fulfillment request](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderSubmitFulfillmentRequest)
to the fulfillment service which operates the location to request that they fulfill the associated items.
A fulfillment service has the option to
[accept](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderAcceptFulfillmentRequest)
or [reject](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderRejectFulfillmentRequest)
this fulfillment request.

Once the fulfillment service has accepted the request, the request can no longer be cancelled by the merchant
or order management app and instead a
[cancellation request must be submitted](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderSubmitCancellationRequest)
to the fulfillment service.

Once a fulfillment service accepts a fulfillment request,
then after they are ready to pack items and send them for delivery, they create fulfillments with the
[fulfillmentCreateV2](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentCreateV2)
mutation.
They can provide tracking information right away or create fulfillments without it and then
update the tracking information for fulfillments with the
[fulfillmentTrackingInfoUpdateV2](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentTrackingInfoUpdateV2)
mutation.

[Learn about managing fulfillment orders as a fulfillment service](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments).

## API access scopes

Fulfillment orders are governed by the following API access scopes:

* The `read_merchant_managed_fulfillment_orders` and
  `write_merchant_managed_fulfillment_orders` access scopes
  grant access to fulfillment orders assigned to merchant-managed locations.
* The `read_assigned_fulfillment_orders` and `write_assigned_fulfillment_orders`
  access scopes are intended for fulfillment services.
  These scopes grant access to fulfillment orders assigned to locations that are being managed
  by fulfillment services.
* The `read_third_party_fulfillment_orders` and `write_third_party_fulfillment_orders`
  access scopes grant access to fulfillment orders
  assigned to locations managed by other fulfillment services.

### Fulfillment service app access scopes

Usually, **fulfillment services** have the `write_assigned_fulfillment_orders` access scope
and don't have the `*_third_party_fulfillment_orders`
or `*_merchant_managed_fulfillment_orders` access scopes.
The app will only have access to the fulfillment orders assigned to their location
(or multiple locations if the app registers multiple fulfillment services on the shop).
The app will not have access to fulfillment orders assigned to merchant-managed locations
or locations owned by other fulfillment service apps.

### Order management app access scopes

**Order management apps** will usually request `write_merchant_managed_fulfillment_orders` and
`write_third_party_fulfillment_orders` access scopes. This will allow them to manage all fulfillment orders
on behalf of a merchant.

If an app combines the functions of an order management app and a fulfillment service,
then the app should request all
access scopes to manage all assigned and all unassigned fulfillment orders.

## Notifications about fulfillment orders

Fulfillment services are required to
[register](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentService)
a self-hosted callback URL which has a number of uses. One of these uses is that this callback URL will be notified
whenever a merchant submits a fulfillment or cancellation request.

Both merchants and apps can
[subscribe](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments#webhooks)
to the
[fulfillment order webhooks](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/WebhookSubscriptionTopic#value-fulfillmentorderscancellationrequestaccepted)
to be notified whenever fulfillment order related domain events occur.

[Learn about fulfillment workflows](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment).

fields.name: assignedLocation
fields.description:
The fulfillment order's assigned location. This is the location where the fulfillment is expected to happen.

The fulfillment order's assigned location might change in the following cases:

- The fulfillment order has been entirely moved to a new location. For example, the [fulfillmentOrderMove](
  https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderMove
  ) mutation has been called, and you see the original fulfillment order in the [movedFulfillmentOrder](
  https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderMove#field-fulfillmentordermovepayload-movedfulfillmentorder
  ) field within the mutation's response.
- Work on the fulfillment order hasn't yet begun, which means that the fulfillment order has the
    [OPEN](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-open),
    [SCHEDULED](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-scheduled), or
    [ON_HOLD](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-onhold)
    status, and the shop's location properties might be undergoing edits (for example, in the Shopify admin).
