types.name: FulfillmentOrderAction
types.description: The actions that can be taken on a fulfillment order.

enumValues.name: CANCEL_FULFILLMENT_ORDER
enumValues.description: Cancels a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderCancel`.

enumValues.name: CREATE_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Creates a fulfillment for selected line items in the fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentCreateV2`.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL
enumValues.description: Opens an external URL to initiate the fulfillment process outside Shopify. This action should be paired with `FulfillmentOrderSupportedAction.externalUrl`.

enumValues.name: HOLD
enumValues.description: Applies a fulfillment hold on an open fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderHold`.

enumValues.name: MARK_AS_OPEN
enumValues.description: Marks the fulfillment order as open. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderOpen`.

enumValues.name: MERGE
enumValues.description: Merges a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderMerge`.

enumValues.name: MOVE
enumValues.description: Moves a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderMove`.

enumValues.name: RELEASE_HOLD
enumValues.description: Releases the fulfillment hold on the fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderReleaseHold`.

enumValues.name: REQUEST_CANCELLATION
enumValues.description: Sends a cancellation request to the fulfillment service of a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderSubmitCancellationRequest`.

enumValues.name: REQUEST_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Sends a request for fulfilling selected line items in a fulfillment order to a fulfillment service. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderSubmitFulfillmentRequest`.

enumValues.name: SPLIT
enumValues.description: Splits a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is `fulfillmentOrderSplit`.

types.name: FulfillmentOrderAssignedLocation
types.description:
The fulfillment order's assigned location. This is the location where the fulfillment is expected to happen.

 The fulfillment order's assigned location might change in the following cases:

  - The fulfillment order has been entirely moved to a new location. For example, the [fulfillmentOrderMove](
    https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderMove
    ) mutation has been called, and you see the original fulfillment order in the [movedFulfillmentOrder](
    https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderMove#field-fulfillmentordermovepayload-movedfulfillmentorder
    ) field within the mutation's response.

  - Work on the fulfillment order has not yet begun, which means that the fulfillment order has the
      [OPEN](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-open),
      [SCHEDULED](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-scheduled), or
      [ON_HOLD](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-onhold)
      status, and the shop's location properties might be undergoing edits (for example, in the Shopify admin).

If the [fulfillmentOrderMove](
https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentOrderMove
) mutation has moved the fulfillment order's line items to a new location,
but hasn't moved the fulfillment order instance itself, then the original fulfillment order's assigned location
doesn't change.
This happens if the fulfillment order is being split during the move, or if all line items can be moved
to an existing fulfillment order at a new location.

Once the fulfillment order has been taken into work or canceled,
which means that the fulfillment order has the
[IN_PROGRESS](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-inprogress),
[CLOSED](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-closed),
[CANCELLED](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-cancelled), or
[INCOMPLETE](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderStatus#value-incomplete)
status, `FulfillmentOrderAssignedLocation` acts as a snapshot of the shop's location content.
Up-to-date shop's location data may be queried through [location](
  https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrderAssignedLocation#field-fulfillmentorderassignedlocation-location
) connection.

fields.name: movedFulfillmentOrder
fields.description:
The fulfillment order which now contains the moved line items and is assigned to the destination location.

**First scenario:** All line items belonging to the original fulfillment order are re-assigned.

In this case, this will be the original fulfillment order.

**Second scenario:** A subset of the line items belonging to the original fulfillment order are re-assigned.

If the new location is already assigned to fulfill line items on the order, then
this will be an existing active fulfillment order.
Otherwise, this will be a new fulfillment order with the moved line items assigned.

fields.name: originalFulfillmentOrder
fields.description:
The final state of the original fulfillment order.

As a result of the move operation, the original fulfillment order might be moved to the new location
or remain in the original location. The original fulfillment order might have the same status or be closed.

types.name: FulfillmentService
types.description:
A **Fulfillment Service** is a third party warehouse that prepares and ships orders
on behalf of the store owner. Fulfillment services charge a fee to package and ship items
and update product inventory levels. Some well known fulfillment services with Shopify integrations
include: Amazon, Shipwire, and Rakuten. When an app registers a new `FulfillmentService` on a store,
Shopify automatically creates a `Location` that's associated to the fulfillment service.
To learn more about fulfillment services, refer to
[Manage fulfillments as a fulfillment service app](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps)
guide.

## Mutations

You can work with the `FulfillmentService` object with the
[fulfillmentServiceCreate](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentServiceCreate),
[fulfillmentServiceUpdate](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentServiceUpdate),
and [fulfillmentServiceDelete](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentServiceDelete)
mutations.

## Hosted endpoints

Fulfillment service providers integrate with Shopify by providing Shopify with a set of hosted endpoints that
Shopify can query on certain conditions.
These endpoints must have a common prefix, and this prefix should be supplied in the `callbackUrl` parameter
in the
[fulfillmentServiceCreate](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentServiceCreate)
mutation.

- Shopify sends POST requests to the `<callbackUrl>/fulfillment_order_notification` endpoint
  to notify the fulfillment service about fulfillment requests and fulfillment cancellation requests,
  if `fulfillment_orders_opt_in` is set to `true`.

  [As of the 2022-07 API version](https://shopify.dev/changelog/legacy-fulfillment-api-deprecation),
  it's mandatory for a fulfillment service to follow a fulfillment order based workflow by
  having `fulfillment_orders_opt_in` set to `true`,
  hosting the `<callbackUrl>/fulfillment_order_notification` endpoint, and acting on fulfillment requests and cancellations.

  For more information, refer to
  [Receive fulfillment requests and cancellations](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments#step-2-receive-fulfillment-requests-and-cancellations).
- Shopify sends GET requests to the `<callbackUrl>/fetch_tracking_numbers` endpoint to retrieve tracking numbers for orders,
  if `trackingSupport` is set to `true`.

  For more information, refer to
  [Enable tracking support](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments#step-8-enable-tracking-support-optional).

  Fulfillment services can also update tracking information with the
  [fulfillmentTrackingInfoUpdateV2](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fulfillmentTrackingInfoUpdateV2) mutation,
  rather than waiting for Shopify to ask for tracking numbers.
- Shopify sends GET requests to the `<callbackUrl>/fetch_stock` endpoint to retrieve inventory levels,
  if `inventoryManagement` is set to `true`.

  For more information, refer to
  [Sharing inventory levels with Shopify](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments#step-9-share-inventory-levels-with-shopify-optional).

To make sure you have everything set up correctly, you can test the `callbackUrl`-prefixed endpoints
in your development store.

## Resources and webhooks

There are a variety of objects and webhooks that enable a fulfillment service to work.
To exchange fulfillment information with Shopify, fulfillment services use the
[FulfillmentOrder](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrder),
[Fulfillment](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Fulfillment) and
[Order](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Order) objects and related mutations.
To act on fulfillment process events that happen on the Shopify side,
besides awaiting calls to `callbackUrl`-prefixed endpoints,
fulfillment services can subscribe to the
[fulfillment order](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments#webhooks)
and [order](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-rest/latest/resources/webhook)
webhooks.

fields.name: callbackUrl
fields.description:
The callback URL that the fulfillment service has registered for requests. The following considerations apply:

- Shopify queries the `<callbackUrl>/fetch_tracking_numbers` endpoint to retrieve tracking numbers
    for orders, if `trackingSupport` is set to `true`.
- Shopify queries the `<callbackUrl>/fetch_stock` endpoint to retrieve inventory levels,
    if `inventoryManagement` is set to `true`.
- Shopify uses the `<callbackUrl>/fulfillment_order_notification` endpoint to send
    [fulfillment and cancellation requests](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments#step-2-receive-fulfillment-requests-and-cancellations),
    if the fulfillment service has opted in to the fulfillment order based workflow for managing fulfillments
    (`fulfillmentOrdersOptIn` is set to `true`).

fields.name: fulfillmentOrdersOptIn
fields.description:
Whether the fulfillment service uses the [fulfillment order based workflow](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments) for managing fulfillments.

As the migration is now finished, the `fulfillmentOrdersOptIn` property is [deprecated](
https://shopify.dev/changelog/deprecation-of-the-fulfillmentservice-fulfillmentordersoptin-field)
and is always set to `true` on correctly functioning fulfillment services.
fields.deprecationReason: Migration period ended. All correctly functioning fulfillment services have `fulfillmentOrdersOptIn` set to `true`.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: Human-readable unique identifier for this fulfillment service.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the fulfillment service.

fields.name: inventoryManagement
fields.description: Whether the fulfillment service tracks product inventory and provides updates to Shopify.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Location associated with the fulfillment service.

fields.name: permitsSkuSharing
fields.description: Whether the fulfillment service can stock inventory alongside other locations.

fields.name: productBased
fields.description: Whether the fulfillment service supports local deliveries.

fields.name: serviceName
fields.description: The name of the fulfillment service as seen by merchants.

fields.name: shippingMethods
fields.description: Shipping methods associated with the fulfillment service provider. Applies only to Fulfill By Amazon fulfillment service.
fields.deprecationReason: The Fulfillment by Amazon feature will no longer be supported from March 30, 2023. To continue using Amazon fulfillment, merchants need to set up a Multi-Channel Fulfillment solution recommended by Amazon: https://help.shopify.com/manual/shipping/fulfillment-services/amazon#activate-fulfillment-by-amazon

fields.description: Type associated with the fulfillment service.

enumValues.name: ERROR

enumValues.name: FAILURE

enumValues.name: OPEN

enumValues.deprecationReason: This is a legacy status and is due to be deprecated.

types.name: FulfillmentTrackingInfo
types.description: Represents the tracking information for a fulfillment.

fields.name: company
fields.description:
The name of the tracking company.

For tracking company names from the list below
Shopify will automatically build tracking URLs for all provided tracking numbers,
which will make the tracking numbers clickable in the interface.

Additionally, for the tracking companies listed on the
[Shipping Carriers help page](https://help.shopify.com/manual/shipping/understanding-shipping/shipping-carriers#integrated-shipping-carriers)
Shopify will automatically update the fulfillment's `shipment_status` field during the fulfillment process.

### Supported tracking companies

The following tracking companies display for shops located in any country:

  * 4PX
  * AGS
  * Amazon Logistics UK
  * Amazon Logistics US
  * An Post
  * Anjun Logistics
  * APC
  * Asendia USA
  * Australia Post
  * Bonshaw

fields.name: number
fields.description:
The tracking number of the fulfillment.

The tracking number is clickable in the interface if one of the following applies
(the highest in the list has the highest priority):

* Tracking url provided in the `url` field.
* [Shopify-known tracking company name](#supported-tracking-companies) specified in the `company` field.
  Shopify will build the tracking URL automatically based on the tracking number specified.
* The tracking number has a Shopify-known format.
  Shopify will guess the tracking provider and build the tracking url based on the tracking number format.
  Not all tracking carriers are supported, and multiple tracking carriers may use similarly formatted tracking numbers.
  This can result in an invalid tracking URL.
  It is highly recommended that you send the tracking company and the tracking URL.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The URLs to track the fulfillment.

The tracking URL is displayed in the merchant's admin on the order page.
The tracking URL is displayed in the shipping confirmation email, which can optionally be sent to the customer.
When accounts are enabled, it's also displayed in the customer's order history.

types.name: FulfillmentTrackingInfoUpdateV2Payload
types.description: Return type for `fulfillmentTrackingInfoUpdateV2` mutation.

fields.name: fulfillment
fields.description: The updated fulfillment with tracking information.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: The list of errors that occurred from executing the mutation.

types.name: FulfillmentTrackingInput
types.description:
The input fields that specify all possible fields for tracking information.

> Note:
> If you provide the `url` field, you should not provide the `urls` field.
>
> If you provide the `number` field, you should not provide the `numbers` field.
>
> If you provide the `url` field, you should provide the `number` field.
>
> If you provide the `urls` field, you should provide the `numbers` field.

inputFields.name: company
inputFields.description:
The name of the tracking company.

If you specify a tracking company name from
[the list](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentTrackingInfo#supported-tracking-companies),
Shopify will automatically build tracking URLs for all provided tracking numbers,
which will make the tracking numbers clickable in the interface.
The same tracking company will be applied to all tracking numbers specified.

Additionally, for the tracking companies listed on the
[Shipping Carriers help page](https://help.shopify.com/manual/shipping/understanding-shipping/shipping-carriers#integrated-shipping-carriers)
Shopify will automatically update the fulfillment's `shipment_status` field during the fulfillment process.

> Note:
> Send the tracking company name exactly as written in
> [the list](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentTrackingInfo#supported-tracking-companies)
> (capitalization matters).

inputFields.name: number
inputFields.description:
The tracking number of the fulfillment.

The tracking number will be clickable in the interface if one of the following applies
(the highest in the list has the highest priority):

* Tracking url provided in the `url` field.
* [Shopify-known tracking company name](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentTrackingInfo#supported-tracking-companies)
  specified in the `company` field.
  Shopify will build the tracking URL automatically based on the tracking number specified.
* The tracking number has a Shopify-known format.
  Shopify will guess the tracking provider and build the tracking url based on the tracking number format.
  Not all tracking carriers are supported, and multiple tracking carriers may use similarly formatted tracking numbers.
  This can result in an invalid tracking URL.
  It is highly recommended that you send the tracking company and the tracking URL.

inputFields.name: numbers
inputFields.description:
The tracking numbers of the fulfillment, one or many.

With multiple tracking numbers, you can provide tracking information
for all shipments associated with the fulfillment, if there are more than one.
For example, if you're shipping assembly parts of one furniture item in several boxes.

Tracking numbers will be clickable in the interface if one of the following applies
(the highest in the list has the highest priority):

* Tracking URLs provided in the `urls` field.
  The tracking URLs will be matched to the tracking numbers based on their positions in the arrays.
* [Shopify-known tracking company name](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentTrackingInfo#supported-tracking-companies)
  specified in the `company` field.
  Shopify will build tracking URLs automatically for all tracking numbers specified.
  The same tracking company will be applied to all tracking numbers.
* Tracking numbers have a Shopify-known format.
  Shopify will guess tracking providers and build tracking URLs based on the tracking number formats.
  Not all tracking carriers are supported, and multiple tracking carriers may use similarly formatted tracking numbers.
  This can result in an invalid tracking URL.
  It is highly recommended that you send the tracking company and the tracking URLs.

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description:
The URL to track the fulfillment.

The tracking URL is displayed in the merchant's admin on the order page.
The tracking URL is displayed in the shipping confirmation email, which can optionally be sent to the customer.
When accounts are enabled, it's also displayed in the customer's order history.

The URL must be an [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986) and
[RFC 3987](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987)-compliant URI string.
For example, `"https://www.myshipping.com/track/?tracknumbers=TRACKING_NUMBER"` is a valid URL.
It includes a scheme (`https`) and a host (`myshipping.com`).

inputFields.name: urls
inputFields.description:
The URLs to track the fulfillment, one or many.

The tracking URLs are displayed in the merchant's admin on the order page.
The tracking URLs are displayed in the shipping confirmation email, which can optionally be sent to the customer.
When accounts are enabled, the tracking URLs are also displayed in the customer's order history.

If you're not specifying a
[Shopify-known](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentTrackingInfo#supported-tracking-companies)
tracking company name in the `company` field,
then provide tracking URLs for all tracking numbers from the `numbers` field.

Tracking URLs from the `urls` array field are being matched with the tracking numbers from the `numbers` array
field correspondingly their positions in the arrays.

Each URL must be an [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986) and
[RFC 3987](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987)-compliant URI string.
For example, `"https://www.myshipping.com/track/?tracknumbers=TRACKING_NUMBER"` is a valid URL.
It includes a scheme (`https`) and a host (`myshipping.com`).

types.name: FulfillmentV2Input
types.description: The input fields used to create a fulfillment from fulfillment orders.

inputFields.name: lineItemsByFulfillmentOrder
inputFields.description:
Pairs of `fulfillment_order_id` and `fulfillment_order_line_items` that represent the fulfillment
order line items that have to be fulfilled for each fulfillment order.  For any given pair, if the
fulfillment order line items are left blank then all the fulfillment order line items of the
associated fulfillment order ID will be fulfilled.

inputFields.name: notifyCustomer
inputFields.description:
Whether the customer is notified.
If `true`, then a notification is sent when the fulfillment is created. The default value is `false`.

inputFields.name: originAddress
inputFields.description: Address information about the location from which the order was fulfilled.

inputFields.name: trackingInfo
inputFields.description:
The fulfillment's tracking information, including a tracking URL, a tracking number,
and the company associated with the fulfillment.

types.name: GiftCardCreateInput
types.description: The input fields to issue a gift card.

inputFields.name: code
inputFields.description:
The gift card's code. It must be 8-20 characters long and contain only letters(a-z) and numbers(0-9).
It isn't case sensitive. If not provided, then a random code will be generated.

inputFields.name: customerId
inputFields.description: The ID of the customer who will receive the gift card. Requires `write_customers` access_scope.

inputFields.name: expiresOn
inputFields.description: The date at which the gift card will expire. If not provided, then the gift card will never expire.

inputFields.name: initialValue
inputFields.description: The initial value of the gift card.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: The note associated with the gift card, which isn't visible to the customer.

inputFields.name: templateSuffix
inputFields.description:
The suffix of the Liquid template that's used to render the gift card online.
For example, if the value is `birthday`, then the gift card is rendered using the template `gift_card.birthday.liquid`.
If not provided, then the default `gift_card.liquid` template is used.

fields.name: src
fields.description: The location of the image as a URL.

fields.name: transformedSrc
fields.description:
The location of the transformed image as a URL.

All transformation arguments are considered "best-effort". If they can be applied to an image, they will be.
Otherwise any transformations which an image type doesn't support will be ignored.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.name: preferredContentType
args.description: Best effort conversion of image into content type (SVG -> PNG, Anything -> JPG, Anything -> WEBP are supported).

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The location of the image as a URL.

If no transform options are specified, then the original image will be preserved including any pre-applied transforms.

All transformation options are considered "best-effort". Any transformation that the original image type doesn't support will be ignored.

If you need multiple variations of the same image, then you can use [GraphQL aliases](https://graphql.org/learn/queries/#aliases).

args.name: transform
args.description: A set of options to transform the original image.

fields.name: width
fields.description: The original width of the image in pixels. Returns `null` if the image isn't hosted by Shopify.

types.name: ImageTransformInput
types.description:
The available options for transforming an image.

All transformation options are considered best effort. Any transformation that the original image type doesn't support will be ignored.

inputFields.name: crop
inputFields.description:
The region of the image to remain after cropping.
Must be used in conjunction with the `maxWidth` and/or `maxHeight` fields, where the `maxWidth` and `maxHeight` aren't equal.
The `crop` argument should coincide with the smaller value. A smaller `maxWidth` indicates a `LEFT` or `RIGHT` crop, while
a smaller `maxHeight` indicates a `TOP` or `BOTTOM` crop. For example, `{ maxWidth: 5, maxHeight: 10, crop: LEFT }` will result
in an image with a width of 5 and height of 10, where the right side of the image is removed.

inputFields.name: maxHeight
inputFields.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 5760.

inputFields.name: maxWidth
inputFields.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 5760.

inputFields.name: preferredContentType
inputFields.description:
Convert the source image into the preferred content type.
Supported conversions: `.svg` to `.png`, any file type to `.jpg`, and any file type to `.webp`.

inputFields.name: scale
inputFields.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be within 1..3.

The change can either involve the same quantity name between different locations,
or involve different quantity names between the same location.

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: Details about where the move will be made from.

inputFields.name: inventoryItemId
inputFields.description: Specifies the inventory item to which the change will be applied.

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The amount by which the inventory quantity will be changed.

inputFields.name: to
inputFields.description: Details about where the move will be made to.

types.name: InventoryMoveQuantityTerminalInput
types.description: The input fields representing the change to be made to an inventory item at a location.

inputFields.name: ledgerDocumentUri
inputFields.description: The ledger document URI for the quantity move. Not allowed for 'available' and required for other quantity names.

inputFields.name: locationId
inputFields.description: Specifies the location at which the change will be applied.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description:
The quantity
[name](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/fulfillment/inventory-management-apps#inventory-states) to be
moved.

The number of pendings orders on the shop.
Limited to a maximum of 10000.

types.name: LineItem
types.description: Represents individual products and quantities purchased in the associated order.

fields.name: canRestock
fields.description: Whether the line item can be restocked.

fields.name: contract
fields.description: The subscription contract associated with this line item.

fields.name: currentQuantity
fields.description: The line item's quantity, minus the removed quantity.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: A list of attributes that represent custom features or special requests.

fields.name: discountAllocations
fields.description: The discounts that have been allocated onto the line item by discount applications, not including order edits and refunds.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: The total line price after discounts are applied, in shop currency.

fields.name: discountedTotalSet
fields.description: The total line price after discounts are applied, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: The approximate split price of a line item unit, in shop currency. This value doesn't include discounts applied to the entire order.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceAfterAllDiscountsSet
fields.description: The approximate split price of the line item, including any discounts that apply to the entire order.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceSet
fields.description: The approximate split price of a line item unit, in shop and presentment currencies. This value doesn't include discounts applied to the entire order.

fields.name: duties
fields.description: The duties associated with the line item.

fields.name: fulfillableQuantity
fields.description: The total number of units to fulfill.

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
The fulfillment service that stocks the product variant belonging to a line item.

This is a third-party fulfillment service in the following scenarios:

**Scenario 1**
- The product variant is stocked by a single fulfillment service.
- The [FulfillmentService](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentService) is a third-party fulfillment service. Third-party fulfillment services don't have a handle with the value `manual`.

**Scenario 2**
- Multiple fulfillment services stock the product variant.
- The last time that the line item was unfulfilled, it was awaiting fulfillment by a third-party fulfillment service. Third-party fulfillment services don't have a handle with the value `manual`.

If none of the above conditions are met, then the fulfillment service has the `manual` handle.
fields.deprecationReason:
The [relationship between a product variant and a fulfillment service was changed in the `2022-07` API version](/changelog/fulfillment-service-sku-sharing). A [ProductVariant](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/ProductVariant) can be stocked by multiple fulfillment services. As a result, we recommend that you use the [inventoryItem field](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/ProductVariant#field-productvariant-inventoryitem) if you need to determine where a product variant is stocked.

If you need to determine whether a product is a gift card, then you should continue to use this field until an alternative is available.

Altering the locations which stock a product variant won't change the value of this field for existing orders.

Learn about [managing inventory quantities and states](/apps/fulfillment/inventory-management-apps/quantities-states).

fields.name: fulfillmentStatus
fields.description:
The line item's fulfillment status. Returns 'fulfilled' if fulfillableQuantity >= quantity,
'partial' if  fulfillableQuantity > 0, and 'unfulfilled' otherwise.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image associated to the line item's variant.

fields.name: lineItemGroup
fields.description: The line item group associated to the line item.

fields.name: merchantEditable
fields.description: Whether the line item can be edited or not.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The title of the product, optionally appended with the title of the variant (if applicable).

fields.name: nonFulfillableQuantity
fields.description: The total number of units that can't be fulfilled. For example, if items have been refunded, or the item is not something that can be fulfilled, like a tip. Please see the [FulfillmentOrder](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrder) object for more fulfillment details.

fields.name: originalTotal
fields.description:
The total price without discounts applied, in shop currency.
This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalTotalSet
fields.description: The total price in shop and presentment currencies, without discounts applied. This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: The variant unit price without discounts applied, in shop currency.

fields.name: originalUnitPriceSet
fields.description: The variant unit price without discounts applied, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The Product object associated with this line item's variant.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of variant units ordered.

fields.name: refundableQuantity
fields.description: The line item's quantity, minus the refunded quantity.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: restockable
fields.description: Whether the line item can be restocked.

fields.name: sellingPlan
fields.description: The selling plan details associated with the line item.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: The variant SKU number.

fields.name: staffMember
fields.description: Staff attributed to the line item.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: The taxes charged for this line item.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the product at time of order creation.

fields.name: totalDiscount
fields.description: The total amount of the discount allocated to the line item in the shop currency.

fields.name: totalDiscountSet
fields.description: The total amount of the discount that's allocated to the line item, in the shop and presentment currencies. This field must be explicitly set using draft orders, Shopify scripts, or the API.

fields.name: unfulfilledDiscountedTotal
fields.description: The total discounted value of unfulfilled units, in shop currency.

fields.name: unfulfilledDiscountedTotalSet
fields.description: The total discounted value of unfulfilled units, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: unfulfilledOriginalTotal
fields.description: The total price, without any discounts applied. This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity of all unfulfilled units, in shop currency.

fields.name: unfulfilledOriginalTotalSet
fields.description: The total price, without any discounts applied. This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity of all unfulfilled units, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: unfulfilledQuantity
fields.description: The number of units not yet fulfilled.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: The Variant object associated with this line item.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: The title of the variant at time of order creation.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: The name of the vendor who made the variant.

types.name: LineItemMutable
types.description: Represents a single line item on an order.

fields.name: canRestock
fields.description: Whether the line item can be restocked.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: A list of attributes that represent custom features or special requests.

fields.name: discountAllocations
fields.description: The discounts that have been allocated onto the line item by discount applications.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: The total line price after discounts are applied, in shop currency.

fields.name: discountedTotalSet
fields.description: The total line price after discounts are applied, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: The approximate split price of a line item unit, in shop currency. This value doesn't include discounts applied to the entire order.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceSet
fields.description: The approximate split price of a line item unit, in shop and presentment currencies. This value doesn't include discounts applied to the entire order.

fields.name: fulfillableQuantity
fields.description: The total number of units to fulfill.

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
The service provider that fulfills the line item.

Deleted fulfillment services will return null.

fields.name: fulfillmentStatus
fields.description:
The line item's fulfillment status. Returns 'fulfilled' if fulfillableQuantity >= quantity,
'partial' if  fulfillableQuantity > 0, and 'unfulfilled' otherwise.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image associated to the line item's variant.

fields.name: merchantEditable
fields.description: Whether the line item can be edited or not.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the product.

fields.name: nonFulfillableQuantity
fields.description: The total number of units that can't be fulfilled. For example, if items have been refunded, or the item isn't something that can be fulfilled, like a tip.

fields.name: originalTotal
fields.description: The total price without any discounts applied, in shop currency. ""This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalTotalSet
fields.description: The total price in shop and presentment currencies, without discounts applied. This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: The variant unit price without discounts applied, in shop currency.

fields.name: originalUnitPriceSet
fields.description: The variant unit price without discounts applied, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The Product object associated with this line item's variant.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of variant units ordered.

fields.name: refundableQuantity
fields.description: The line item's quantity, minus the refunded quantity.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: restockable
fields.description: Whether the line item can be restocked.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: The variant SKU number.

fields.name: staffMember
fields.description: Staff attributed to the line item.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: The TaxLine object connected to this line item.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the product.

fields.name: totalDiscount
fields.description: The total amount of the discount allocated to the line item in the shop currency. This field must be explicitly set using draft orders, Shopify scripts, or the API. Instead of using this field, Shopify recommends using `discountAllocations`, which provides the same information.

fields.name: totalDiscountSet
fields.description: The total amount of the discount allocated to the line item in the presentment currency. This field must be explicitly set using draft orders, Shopify scripts, or the API. Instead of using this field, Shopify recommends using `discountAllocations`, which provides the same information.

fields.name: unfulfilledDiscountedTotal
fields.description: The total discounted value of unfulfilled units, in shop currency.

fields.name: unfulfilledDiscountedTotalSet
fields.description: The total discounted value of unfulfilled units, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: unfulfilledOriginalTotal
fields.description: The total price without any discounts applied. This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity of all unfulfilled units, in shop currency.

fields.name: unfulfilledOriginalTotalSet
fields.description: The total price without any discounts applied. This value is based on the unit price of the variant x quantity of all unfulfilled units, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: unfulfilledQuantity
fields.description: The number of units not yet fulfilled.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: The Variant object associated with this line item.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: The name of the variant.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: The name of the vendor who made the variant.

fields.name: deactivatedAt
fields.description: The date and time ([ISO 8601 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)) that the location was deactivated at. For example, 3:30 pm on September 7, 2019 in the time zone of UTC (Universal Time Coordinated) is represented as `"2019-09-07T15:50:00Z`".

fields.name: hasUnfulfilledOrders

fields.name: inventoryLevel
fields.description: The quantities of an inventory item at this location.

enumValues.name: FAILED_TO_RELOCATE_INCOMING_MOVEMENTS

enumValues.name: HAS_FULFILLMENT_ORDERS_ERROR

enumValues.name: HAS_INCOMING_MOVEMENTS_ERROR

enumValues.name: PERMANENTLY_BLOCKED_FROM_DEACTIVATION_ERROR

enumValues.name: TEMPORARILY_BLOCKED_FROM_DEACTIVATION_ERROR

types.name: ManualDiscountApplication
types.description:
Manual discount applications capture the intentions of a discount that was manually created for an order.

Discount applications don't represent the actual final amount discounted on a line (line item or shipping line). The actual amount discounted on a line is represented by the [DiscountAllocation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/discountallocation) object.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is applied to its entitled items.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the discount application.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
An ordered index that can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the discount application.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

types.name: Market
types.description:
A market is a group of one or more regions that you want to target for international sales.
By creating a market, you can configure a distinct, localized shopping experience for
customers from a specific area of the world. For example, you can
[change currency](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/current/mutations/marketCurrencySettingsUpdate),
[configure international pricing](https://shopify.dev/apps/internationalization/product-price-lists),
or [add market-specific domains or subfolders](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/current/objects/MarketWebPresence).

fields.name: webPresence
fields.description:
The markets web presence, which defines its SEO strategy. This can be a different domain,
subdomain, or subfolders of the primary domain. Each web presence comprises one or more
language variants. If a market doesn't have its own web presence, then the market is accessible on the
primary market's domains using [country
selectors](https://shopify.dev/themes/internationalization/multiple-currencies-languages#the-country-selector).
If it's the primary market and it has multiple web presences, then this field will return the primary domain web presence.

fields.name: webPresences
fields.description:
The markets web presences, which defines its SEO strategy. This can be a different domain,
subdomain, or subfolders of the primary domain. Each web presence comprises one or more
language variants. If a market doesn't have any web presences, then the market is accessible on the
primary market's domains using [country
selectors](https://shopify.dev/themes/internationalization/multiple-currencies-languages#the-country-selector).

types.name: MarketCreateInput
types.description: The input fields required to create a market.

inputFields.name: enabled
inputFields.description:
Whether the market is enabled to receive visitors and sales. If a
value isn't provided, then the market is enabled by default if all
included regions have shipping rates, and disabled if any regions don't
have shipping rates.

**Note**: Regions in inactive markets can't be selected on the
storefront or in checkout.

inputFields.name: handle
inputFields.description:
A unique identifier for the market. For example `"ca"`.
If the handle isn't provided, then the handle is auto-generated based on the country or name.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the market. Not shown to customers.

inputFields.name: regions
inputFields.description:
The regions to be included in the market. Each region can only be included in one market at
a time.

fields.description: The market object.

fields.description: The list of errors that occurred from executing the mutation.

types.name: MarketCurrencySettings
types.description: A market's currency settings.

fields.name: baseCurrency
fields.description:
The currency which this market's prices are defined in, and the
currency which its customers must use if local currencies are disabled.

fields.name: localCurrencies
fields.description:
Whether or not local currencies are enabled. If enabled, then prices will
be converted to give each customer the best experience based on their
region. If disabled, then all customers in this market will see prices
in the market's base currency. For single country markets this will be true when
the market's base currency is the same as the default currency for the region.

types.name: MarketCurrencySettingsUpdateInput
types.description: The input fields used to update the currency settings of a market.

inputFields.name: baseCurrency
inputFields.description:
The currency which this markets prices are defined in, and the
currency which its customers must use if local currencies are disabled.

inputFields.name: localCurrencies
inputFields.description:
Whether or not local currencies are enabled. If enabled, then prices will
be converted to give each customer the best experience based on their
region. If disabled, then all customers in this market will see prices
in the market's base currency.

types.name: MarketWebPresence
types.description:
The markets web presence, which defines its SEO strategy. This can be a different domain
(e.g. `example.ca`), subdomain (e.g. `ca.example.com`), or subfolders of the primary
domain (e.g. `example.com/en-ca`). Each web presence comprises one or more language
variants. If a market does not have its own web presence, it is accessible on the shops
primary domain via [country
selectors](https://shopify.dev/themes/internationalization/multiple-currencies-languages#the-country-selector).

Note: while the domain/subfolders defined by a markets web presence are not applicable to
custom storefronts, which must manage their own domains and routing, the languages chosen
here do govern [the languages available on the Storefront
API](https://shopify.dev/custom-storefronts/internationalization/multiple-languages) for the countries in
this market.

fields.name: alternateLocales
fields.description:
The ISO codes for the alternate locales. When a domain is used, these locales will be
available as language-specific subfolders. For example, if English is an
alternate locale, and `example.ca` is the markets domain, then
`example.ca/en` will load in English.

fields.name: defaultLocale
fields.description:
The ISO code for the default locale. When a domain is used, this is the locale that will
be used when the domain root is accessed. For example, if French is the default locale,
and `example.ca` is the markets domain, then `example.ca` will load in French.

fields.name: domain
fields.description:
The web presences domain.
This field will be null if `subfolderSuffix` isn't null.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: market
fields.description: The associated market.

fields.name: rootUrls
fields.description: The list of root URLs for each of the web presences locales. As of version `2024-04` this value will no longer have a trailing slash.

fields.name: subfolderSuffix
fields.description: The market-specific suffix of the subfolders defined by the web presence. Example: in `/en-us` the subfolder suffix is `us`. This field will be null if `domain` isn't null.

types.name: MarketWebPresenceConnection
types.description: An auto-generated type for paginating through multiple MarketWebPresences.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of the nodes contained in MarketWebPresenceEdge.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: MarketWebPresenceCreateInput
types.description: The input fields used to create a web presence for a market.

inputFields.name: alternateLocales
inputFields.description: The alternate locales for the markets web presence.

inputFields.name: defaultLocale
inputFields.description: The default locale for the markets web presence.

inputFields.name: domainId
inputFields.description: The web presence's domain ID. This field must be `null` if the `subfolderSuffix` isn't `null`.

inputFields.name: subfolderSuffix
inputFields.description:
The market-specific suffix of the subfolders defined by the web presence.
For example: in `/en-us`, the subfolder suffix is `us`.
Only ASCII characters are allowed. This field must be `null` if the `domainId` isn't `null`.

inputFields.name: adSpend
inputFields.description: The amount spent on the marketing activity.

inputFields.name: budget
inputFields.description: The budget for this marketing activity.

inputFields.description: The unique string identifier of the channel to which this activity belongs. For the correct handle for your channel, contact your partner manager.

inputFields.name: end
inputFields.description: The date and time at which the activity ended. If omitted or set to `null`, the current time will be used if the status is set to `INACTIVE` or `DELETED_EXTERNALLY`.

inputFields.description: The hierarchy level of the activity within a campaign. The hierarchy level can't be updated.

inputFields.description: The medium through which the marketing activity and event reached consumers. This is used for reporting aggregation.

inputFields.name: parentActivityId
inputFields.description: The ID for the parent marketing activity, if creating hierarchical activities.

inputFields.name: parentRemoteId
inputFields.description: The remote ID for the parent marketing activity, if creating hierarchical activities.

inputFields.name: referringDomain
inputFields.description: The domain from which ad clicks are forwarded to the shop.

inputFields.name: remoteId
inputFields.description: The ID of an activity that's hosted outside of Shopify.

inputFields.name: remotePreviewImageUrl
inputFields.description: The URL for a preview image that's used for the marketing activity.

inputFields.name: remoteUrl
inputFields.description: The URL for viewing and/or managing the activity outside of Shopify.

inputFields.name: scheduledEnd
inputFields.description: The date and time at which the activity is scheduled to end.

inputFields.name: scheduledStart
inputFields.description: The date and time at which the activity is scheduled to start.

inputFields.name: start
inputFields.description: The date and time at which the activity started. If omitted or set to `null`, the current time will be used.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: The status of the marketing activity. If status isn't set it will default to UNDEFINED.

inputFields.name: tactic
inputFields.description: The method of marketing used for this marketing activity. The marketing tactic determines which default fields are included in the marketing activity.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The title of the marketing activity.

inputFields.name: urlParameterValue
inputFields.description: Value for a query parameters that gets inserted into storefront URLs for matching storefront traffic to this activity. This feature is currently available on a limited basis to some partners only. UTMs should continue to be used for most partners. Either the URL parameter value or UTM can be set, but not both.

inputFields.name: utm
inputFields.description: Specifies the [Urchin Traffic Module (UTM) parameters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTM_parameters) that are associated with a related marketing campaign. Either the URL parameter value or UTM can be set, but not both.

types.name: MarketingActivityExternalStatus
types.description: Set of possible statuses for an external marketing activity.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is currently running.

enumValues.name: DELETED_EXTERNALLY
enumValues.description: This marketing activity was deleted and it was triggered from outside of Shopify.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: This marketing activity has completed running.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is currently not running.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is scheduled to run.

enumValues.name: UNDEFINED
enumValues.description: The marketing activity's status is unknown.

types.name: MarketingActivityHierarchyLevel
types.description: Hierarchy levels for external marketing activities.

enumValues.name: AD
enumValues.description: An advertisement activity. Must be parented by an ad group or a campaign activity, and must be assigned tracking parameters (URL or UTM).

enumValues.name: AD_GROUP
enumValues.description: A group of advertisement activities. Must be parented by a campaign activity.

enumValues.name: CAMPAIGN
enumValues.description: A campaign activity. May contain either ad groups or ads as child activities. If childless, then the campaign activity should have tracking parameters assigned (URL or UTM) otherwise it won't appear in marketing reports.

types.name: MarketingActivitySortKeys
types.description: The set of valid sort keys for the MarketingActivity query.

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT
enumValues.description: Sort by the `created_at` value.

enumValues.name: ID
enumValues.description: Sort by the `id` value.

enumValues.name: RELEVANCE
enumValues.description:
Sort by relevance to the search terms when the `query` parameter is specified on the connection.
Don't use this sort key when no search query is specified.

enumValues.name: TITLE
enumValues.description: Sort by the `title` value.

types.name: MarketingActivityStatus
types.description: Status helps to identify if this marketing activity has been completed, queued, failed etc.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is currently running.

enumValues.name: DELETED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is permanently unavailable.

enumValues.name: DELETED_EXTERNALLY
enumValues.description: This marketing activity was deleted and it was triggered from outside of Shopify.

enumValues.name: DISCONNECTED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is disconnected and no longer editable.

enumValues.name: DRAFT
enumValues.description: This marketing activity has been edited, but it is not yet created.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is unable to run.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: This marketing activity has completed running.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is currently not running.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is pending creation on the app's marketing platform.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: This marketing activity is scheduled to run.

enumValues.name: UNDEFINED
enumValues.description: The marketing activity's status is unknown.

types.name: MarketingActivityStatusBadgeType
types.description: StatusBadgeType helps to identify the color of the status badge.

enumValues.name: ATTENTION
enumValues.description: This status badge has type attention.

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: This status badge has type default.

enumValues.name: INFO
enumValues.description: This status badge has type info.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: This status badge has type success.

enumValues.name: WARNING
enumValues.description: This status badge has type warning.

types.name: MarketingEngagement
types.description: Marketing engagement represents customer activity taken on a marketing activity or a marketing channel.

fields.name: adSpend
fields.description: The total ad spend for the marketing content. Recurring weekly, monthly, or yearly spend needs to be divided into daily amounts.

fields.name: channelHandle
fields.description: The unique string identifier of the channel to which the engagement metrics are being provided. This should be set when and only when providing channel-level engagements. This should be nil when providing activity-level engagements. For the correct handle for your channel, contact your partner manager.

fields.name: clicksCount
fields.description: The total number of interactions, such as a button press or a screen touch, that occurred on the marketing content.

fields.name: commentsCount
fields.description: The total number of comments on the marketing content.

fields.name: complaintsCount
fields.description: The total number of complaints on the marketing content. For message-based platforms such as email or SMS, this represents the number of marketing emails or messages that were marked as spam. For social media platforms, this represents the number of dislikes or the number of times marketing content was reported.

fields.name: failsCount
fields.description: The total number of fails for the marketing content. For message-based platforms such as email or SMS, this represents the number of bounced marketing emails or messages.

fields.name: favoritesCount
fields.description: The total number of favorites, likes, saves, or bookmarks on the marketing content.

fields.name: firstTimeCustomers
fields.description: The number of customers that have placed their first order. Doesn't include adjustments such as edits, exchanges, or returns.

fields.name: impressionsCount
fields.description: The total number of times marketing content was displayed to users, whether or not an interaction occurred. For message-based platforms such as email or SMS, this represents the number of marketing emails or messages that were delivered.

fields.name: isCumulative
fields.description: Whether the engagements are reported as lifetime totals rather than daily increments.

fields.name: marketingActivity
fields.description: The marketing activity object related to this engagement. This corresponds to the marketingActivityId passed in on creation of the engagement.

fields.name: occurredOn
fields.description: The date that the engagements occurred on.

fields.name: orders
fields.description: The number of orders generated from the marketing content.

fields.name: returningCustomers
fields.description: The number of returning customers that have placed an order. Doesn't include adjustments such as edits, exchanges, or returns.

fields.name: sales
fields.description: The amount of sales generated from the marketing content.

fields.name: sendsCount
fields.description: The total number of marketing emails or messages that were sent.

fields.name: sessionsCount
fields.description: The number of online store sessions generated from the marketing content.

fields.name: sharesCount
fields.description: The total number of times marketing content was distributed or reposted to either one's own network of followers through a social media platform or other digital channels. For message-based platforms such as email or SMS, this represents the number of times marketing emails or messages were forwarded.

fields.name: uniqueClicksCount
fields.description: The total number of unique clicks on the marketing content.

fields.name: uniqueViewsCount
fields.description: The total number of all users who saw marketing content since it was published. For  message-based platforms such as email or SMS, this represents the number of unique users that opened a  marketing email or message. For video-based content, this represents the number of unique users that  played video content.

fields.name: unsubscribesCount
fields.description: The total number of unsubscribes on the marketing content. For social media platforms, this represents the number of unfollows.

fields.name: utcOffset
fields.description: The time difference, in hours, between UTC and the time zone used to aggregate these metrics.

fields.name: viewsCount
fields.description: The total number of views on the marketing content. For message-based platforms such as email or SMS, this represents the number of times marketing emails or messages were opened. For video-based content, this represents the number of times videos were played.

types.name: MarketingEvent
types.description: Represents actions that market a merchant's store or products.

fields.name: app
fields.description: The app that the marketing event is attributed to.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The medium through which the marketing activity and event reached consumers. This is used for reporting aggregation.

fields.name: channelHandle
fields.description: The unique string identifier of the channel to which this activity belongs. For the correct handle for your channel, contact your partner manager.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of the marketing event.

fields.name: endedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the marketing event ended.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: manageUrl
fields.description: The URL where the marketing event can be managed.

fields.name: marketingChannelType
fields.description: The medium through which the marketing activity and event reached consumers. This is used for reporting aggregation.

fields.name: previewUrl
fields.description: The URL where the marketing event can be previewed.

fields.name: remoteId
fields.description: An optional ID that helps Shopify validate engagement data.

fields.name: scheduledToEndAt
fields.description: The date and time when the marketing event is scheduled to end.

fields.name: sourceAndMedium
fields.description:
Where the `MarketingEvent` occurred and what kind of content was used.
Because `utmSource` and `utmMedium` are often used interchangeably, this is
based on a combination of `marketingChannel`, `referringDomain`, and `type` to
provide a consistent representation for any given piece of marketing
regardless of the app that created it.

fields.name: startedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the marketing event started.

fields.name: targetTypeDisplayText
fields.description: The display text for the marketing event type.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The marketing event type.

fields.name: utmCampaign
fields.description: The name of the marketing campaign.

fields.name: utmMedium
fields.description: The medium that the marketing campaign is using. Example values: `cpc`, `banner`.

fields.name: utmSource
fields.description: The referrer of the marketing event. Example values: `google`, `newsletter`.

fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: MediaError
types.description:
Represents a media error. This typically occurs when there is an issue with the media itself causing it to fail validation.
Check the media before attempting to upload again.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Code representing the type of error.

fields.name: details
fields.description: Additional details regarding the error.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Translated error message.

types.name: MediaErrorCode
types.description: Error types for media.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE_FILENAME_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because a file with the same name already exists.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_EMBED_DISABLED
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because embed permissions are disabled for this video.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_EMBED_NOT_FOUND_OR_TRANSCODING
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because video is either not found or still transcoding.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_INVALID_ASPECT_RATIO
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the external video has an invalid aspect ratio.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the external video could not be found.

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_VIDEO_UNLISTED
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the external video is not listed or is private.

enumValues.name: FILE_STORAGE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the cumulative file storage limit would be exceeded.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_FILE_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE
enumValues.description: File could not be processed because the source could not be downloaded.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_FILE_INVALID_SIZE
enumValues.description: File could not be created because the size is too large.

enumValues.name: IMAGE_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE
enumValues.description: Media could not be processed because the image could not be downloaded.

enumValues.name: IMAGE_PROCESSING_FAILURE
enumValues.description: Media could not be processed because the image could not be processed.

enumValues.name: INVALID_IMAGE_ASPECT_RATIO
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the image has an invalid aspect ratio.

enumValues.name: INVALID_IMAGE_FILE_SIZE
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the image size is too large.

enumValues.name: INVALID_IMAGE_RESOLUTION
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the image's resolution exceeds the max limit.

enumValues.name: INVALID_SIGNED_URL
enumValues.description: Media could not be processed because the signed URL was invalid.

enumValues.name: MEDIA_TIMEOUT_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media timed out because it is currently being modified by another operation.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_GLB_OUTPUT_CREATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the model file failed processing.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_GLB_TO_USDZ_CONVERSION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the model can't be converted to USDZ format.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_PROCESSING_FAILURE
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the model file failed processing.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_THUMBNAIL_GENERATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the model's thumbnail generation failed.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_THUMBNAIL_REGENERATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an issue while trying to generate a new thumbnail.

enumValues.name: MODEL3D_VALIDATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Model failed validation.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Media error has occured for unknown reason.

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_IMAGE_FILE_TYPE
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the image is an unsupported file type.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_INVALID_FILETYPE_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because it has an invalid file type.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_DURATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because it does not meet the maximum duration requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_HEIGHT_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because it does not meet the maximum height requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MAX_WIDTH_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because it does not meet the maximum width requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_METADATA_READ_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because the metadata could not be read.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_DURATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because it does not meet the minimum duration requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_HEIGHT_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because it does not meet the minimum height requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_MIN_WIDTH_ERROR
enumValues.description: Media could not be created because it does not meet the minimum width requirement.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_VALIDATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: Video failed validation.

args.name: reverse

types.name: MediaWarning
types.description:
Represents a media warning. This occurs when there is a non-blocking concern regarding your media.
Consider reviewing your media to ensure it is correct and its parameters are as expected.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The code representing the type of warning.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Translated warning message.

types.name: MediaWarningCode
types.description: Warning types for media.

enumValues.name: MODEL_LARGE_PHYSICAL_SIZE
enumValues.description: 3D model physical size might be invalid. The dimensions of your model are very large. Consider reviewing your model to ensure they are correct.

enumValues.name: MODEL_SMALL_PHYSICAL_SIZE
enumValues.description: 3D model physical size might be invalid. The dimensions of your model are very small. Consider reviewing your model to ensure they are correct.

types.name: MerchandiseDiscountClass
types.description: The class of the discount for combining purposes.

enumValues.name: ORDER
enumValues.description: Combined as an order discount.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT
enumValues.description: Combined as a product discount.

types.name: MerchantApprovalSignals
types.description: Merchant approval for accelerated onboarding to channel integration apps.

fields.name: identityVerified
fields.description: Whether the shop's Shopify Payments account identity is verified. Returns `false` if the identity is unverified or if the shop doesn't have a Shopify Payments account.

fields.name: verifiedByShopify
fields.description: Whether Shopify has pre-verified the merchant's business for onboarding to channel integration apps. Returns `false` if the shop isn't marked for verification.

fields.name: verifiedByShopifyTier
fields.description: Which tier of the Shopify verification was determined for the merchant's business for onboarding to channel integration apps.

types.name: Metafield
types.description:
Metafields enable you to attach additional information to a Shopify resource, such as a [Product](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/product) or a [Collection](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/collection).
For more information about where you can attach metafields refer to [HasMetafields](https://shopify.dev/api/admin/graphql/reference/common-objects/HasMetafields).
Some examples of the data that metafields enable you to store are specifications, size charts, downloadable documents, release dates, images, or part numbers.
Metafields are identified by an owner resource, namespace, and key. and store a value along with type information for that value.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the metafield was created.

fields.name: definition
fields.description: The metafield definition that the metafield belongs to, if any.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the metafield.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The unique identifier for the metafield within its namespace.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: The container for a group of metafields that the metafield is associated with.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The resource that the metafield is attached to.

fields.name: ownerType
fields.description: The type of resource that the metafield is attached to.

fields.name: reference
fields.description: Returns a reference object if the metafield definition's type is a resource reference.

fields.name: references
fields.description: A list of reference objects if the metafield's type is a resource reference list.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns up to the first `n` elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns up to the last `n` elements from the list.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The type of data that is stored in the metafield.
Refer to the list of [supported types](https://shopify.dev/apps/metafields/types).

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the metafield was updated.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The data stored in the metafield. Always stored as a string, regardless of the metafield's type.

enumValues.description: Owner gets full access. The merchant has read-only access. No one else has access rights.

types.name: MetafieldDefinitionValidation
types.description:
A configured metafield definition validation.

For example, for a metafield definition of `number_integer` type, you can set a validation with the name `max`
and a value of `15`. This validation will ensure that the value of the metafield is a number less than or equal to 15.

Refer to the [list of supported validations](https://shopify.dev/api/admin/graphql/reference/common-objects/metafieldDefinitionTypes#examples-Fetch_all_metafield_definition_types).

fields.name: name
fields.description: The validation name.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The name for the metafield type of this validation.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The validation value.

types.name: MetafieldDefinitionValidationInput
types.description:
The name and value for a metafield definition validation.

For example, for a metafield definition of `single_line_text_field` type, you can set a validation with the name `min` and a value of `10`.
This validation will ensure that the value of the metafield is at least 10 characters.

Refer to the [list of supported validations](https://shopify.dev/api/admin/graphql/reference/common-objects/metafieldDefinitionTypes#examples-Fetch_all_metafield_definition_types).

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name for the metafield definition validation.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: The value for the metafield definition validation.

enumValues.description: All of this definition's metafields are valid.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Asynchronous validation of this definition's metafields is in progress.

enumValues.name: SOME_INVALID
enumValues.description: Some of this definition's metafields are invalid.

types.name: MetafieldInput
types.description:
The input fields to use to create or update a metafield through a mutation on the owning resource.
An alternative way to create or update a metafield is by using the
[metafieldsSet](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/metafieldsSet) mutation.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description:
The unique ID of the metafield.

Required when updating a metafield, but shouldn't be included when creating as it's created automatically.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description:
The unique identifier for a metafield within its namespace.

Required when creating a metafield, but optional when updating. Used to help identify the metafield when
updating, but can't be updated itself.

Must be 3-64 characters long and can contain alphanumeric, hyphen, and underscore characters.

inputFields.name: namespace
inputFields.description:
The container for a group of metafields that the metafield is or will be associated with. Used in tandem with
`key` to lookup a metafield on a resource, preventing conflicts with other metafields with the same `key`.

Required when creating a metafield, but optional when updating. Used to help identify the metafield when
updating, but can't be updated itself.

Must be 3-255 characters long and can contain alphanumeric, hyphen, and underscore characters.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description:
The type of data that is stored in the metafield.
Refer to the list of [supported types](https://shopify.dev/apps/metafields/types).

Required when creating a metafield, but optional when updating.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: The data stored in the metafield. Always stored as a string, regardless of the metafield's type.

types.name: MetafieldStorefrontVisibility
types.description:
By default, the Storefront API can't read metafields. To make specific metafields visible in the Storefront API,
you need to create a `MetafieldStorefrontVisibility` record. A `MetafieldStorefrontVisibility` record is a list
of the metafields, defined by the `owner_type`, `namespace`, and `key`, to make visible in the Storefront API.

Learn about [exposing metafields in the Storefront API]
(https://shopify.dev/custom-storefronts/products-collections/metafields)
for more details.

types.name: MetafieldsSetInput

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description:
The unique identifier for a metafield within its namespace.

Must be 3-64 characters long and can contain alphanumeric, hyphen, and underscore characters.

inputFields.name: namespace
inputFields.description:
The container for a group of metafields that the metafield is or will be associated with. Used in tandem
with `key` to lookup a metafield on a resource, preventing conflicts with other metafields with the
same `key`. If omitted the app-reserved namespace will be used.

Must be 3-255 characters long and can contain alphanumeric, hyphen, and underscore characters.

inputFields.name: ownerId
inputFields.description: The unique ID of the resource that the metafield is attached to.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description:
The type of data that is stored in the metafield.
The type must be one of the [supported types](https://shopify.dev/apps/metafields/types).

Required when there is no corresponding definition for the given `namespace`, `key`, and
owner resource type (derived from `ownerId`).

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: The data stored in the metafield. Always stored as a string, regardless of the metafield's type.

enumValues.description: The metafield violates a capability restriction.

enumValues.name: INVALID_TYPE

enumValues.name: INVALID_VALUE
enumValues.description: The value is invalid for metafield type or for definition options.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than or equal to the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: PRESENT
