types.name: MetaobjectAdminAccess
types.description: Defines how the metaobjects of a definition can be accessed in admin API surface areas.

enumValues.name: MERCHANT_READ
enumValues.description:
Applications that act on behalf of merchants can read metaobjects.
Only the owning application can write metaobjects.

enumValues.name: MERCHANT_READ_WRITE
enumValues.description:
The owning application, as well as applications that act on behalf of merchants can read and write metaobjects.
No other applications can read or write metaobjects.

enumValues.name: PRIVATE
enumValues.description: Only the application that owns a metaobject can read and write to it.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC_READ
enumValues.description:
All applications with the `metaobjects` access scope can read metaobjects.
Only the owning application can write metaobjects.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC_READ_WRITE
enumValues.description: All applications with the `metaobjects` access scope can read and write metaobjects.

types.name: Model3dSource
types.description:
A source for a Shopify-hosted 3d model.

Types of sources include GLB and USDZ formatted 3d models, where the former
is an original 3d model and the latter has been converted from the original.

If the original source is in GLB format and over 15 MBs in size, then both the
original and the USDZ formatted source are optimized to reduce the file size.

fields.description: The 3d model source's filesize.

fields.name: format
fields.description: The 3d model source's format.

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: The 3d model source's MIME type.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The 3d model source's URL.

args.description: The delivery timestamp if the activity delivered.

fields.name: appPurchaseOneTimeCreate
fields.description:
Charges a shop for features or services one time.
This type of charge is recommended for apps that aren't billed on a recurring basis.
Test and demo shops aren't charged.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the one-time purchase from the app.

args.name: price
args.description: The amount to be charged to the store for the app one-time purchase.

args.name: returnUrl
args.description: The URL where the merchant is redirected after approving the app one-time purchase.

args.name: test
args.description: Whether the app one-time purchase is a test transaction.

fields.name: appSubscriptionCancel
fields.description: Cancels an app subscription on a store.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the app subscription to be cancelled.

args.name: prorate
args.description:
Whether to issue prorated credits for the unused portion of the app subscription.  There will
be a corresponding deduction (based on revenue share) to your Partner account.
For example, if a $10.00 app subscription (with 0% revenue share) is cancelled and prorated half way
through the billing cycle, then the merchant will be credited $5.00 and that amount will be deducted
from your Partner account.

fields.name: appSubscriptionCreate
fields.description: Allows an app to charge a store for features or services on a recurring basis.

args.name: lineItems
args.description: Attaches one or more pricing plans to an app subscription. Only one pricing plan can be defined for each available type.

args.name: name
args.description: A descriptive name for the app subscription.

args.name: replacementBehavior
args.description: The replacement behavior when creating an app subscription for a merchant with an already existing app subscription.

args.name: returnUrl
args.description: The URL pointing to the page where the merchant is redirected after approving the app subscription.

args.name: test
args.description: Whether the app subscription is a test transaction.

args.name: trialDays
args.description: The number of days of the free trial period, beginning on the day that the merchant approves the app charges.

fields.name: appSubscriptionLineItemUpdate
fields.description: Updates the capped amount on the usage pricing plan of an app subscription line item.

args.name: cappedAmount
args.description: The new maximum amount of usage charges that can be incurred within a subscription billing interval.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the app subscription line item to be updated.

fields.name: appSubscriptionTrialExtend
fields.description: Extends the trial of an app subscription.

args.name: days
args.description: The number of days to extend the trial. The value must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1000.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the app subscription to extend the trial for.

fields.name: appUsageRecordCreate
fields.description:
Enables an app to charge a store for features or services on a per-use basis.
The usage charge value is counted towards the `cappedAmount` limit that was specified in the `appUsagePricingDetails` field when the app subscription was created.
If you create an app usage charge that causes the total usage charges in a billing interval to exceed the capped amount, then a `Total price exceeds balance remaining` error is returned.

args.name: description
args.description: The description of the app usage record.

args.name: idempotencyKey
args.description: A unique key generated by the client to avoid duplicate charges. Maximum length of 255 characters.

args.name: price
args.description: The price of the app usage record.

args.name: subscriptionLineItemId
args.description: The ID of the app subscription line item to create the usage record under. This app subscription line item must have a usage pricing plan.

fields.name: bulkOperationCancel

Starts the cancelation process of a running bulk operation.

There may be a short delay from when a cancelation starts until the operation is actually canceled.

fields.name: checkoutBrandingUpsert
fields.description:
Updates the checkout branding settings for a
[checkout profile](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/unstable/queries/checkoutProfile).

If the settings don't exist, then new settings are created. The checkout branding settings applied to a
published checkout profile will be immediately visible within the store's checkout. The checkout branding
settings applied to a draft checkout profile could be previewed within the admin checkout editor.

To learn more about updating checkout branding settings, refer to the checkout branding
[tutorial](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/checkout/styling).

args.name: checkoutBrandingInput
args.description: The input fields to use to upsert the checkout branding settings (pass null to reset them to default).

args.name: checkoutProfileId
args.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: collectionAddProducts
fields.description: Adds products to a collection.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the collection that's being updated. This can't be a smart collection.

args.name: productIds
args.description:
The IDs of the products that are being added to the collection.
If any of the products is already present in the input collection,
then an error is raised and no products are added.

fields.name: collectionAddProductsV2
fields.description: Asynchronously adds a set of products to a given collection. It can take a long time to run. Instead of returning a collection, it returns a job which should be polled.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the collection that's being updated.

args.name: productIds
args.description: The IDs of the products that are being added to the collection. If the collection's sort order is manual, the products will be added in the order in which they are provided.

fields.description: Creates a collection.

args.name: input
args.description: The properties to use when creating the collection.

fields.name: collectionDelete
fields.description: Deletes a collection.

args.description: The collection to delete.

fields.description: Publishes a collection to a channel.

fields.name: collectionRemoveProducts
fields.description: Removes a set of products from a given collection. The mutation can take a long time to run. Instead of returning an updated collection the mutation returns a job, which should be [polled](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/queries/job). For use with manual collections only.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the collection to remove products from. The ID must reference an existing manual collection.

args.name: productIds
args.description: The IDs of products to remove from the collection. The mutation doesn't validate that the products belong to the collection or whether the products exist.

fields.name: collectionReorderProducts
fields.description: Asynchronously reorders a set of products within a specified collection. Instead of returning an updated collection, this mutation returns a job, which should be [polled](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/queries/job). The [`Collection.sortOrder`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Collection#field-collection-sortorder) must be `MANUAL`. Displaced products will have their position altered in a consistent manner, with no gaps.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the collection on which to reorder products.

args.name: moves
args.description: A list of moves to perform, which will be evaluated in order. Up to 250 moves are supported, the `newPosition` does not have to be unique.

fields.name: collectionUnpublish
fields.description: Unpublishes a collection.

args.name: input
args.description: Specify a collection to unpublish and the sales channels to remove it from.

args.name: input
args.description: The updated properties for the collection.

fields.name: draftOrderUpdate
fields.description:
Updates a draft order.

If a checkout has been started for a draft order, any update to the draft will unlink the checkout. Checkouts
are created but not immediately completed when opening the merchant credit card modal in the admin, and when a
buyer opens the invoice URL. This is usually fine, but there is an edge case where a checkout is in progress
and the draft is updated before the checkout completes. This will not interfere with the checkout and order
creation, but if the link from draft to checkout is broken the draft will remain open even after the order is
created.

args.name: id
args.description: Specifies the draft order to update.

args.name: input
args.description: The draft order properties to update.

fields.name: fulfillmentOrderMove
fields.description:
Changes the location which is assigned to fulfill a number of unfulfilled fulfillment order line items.

Moving a fulfillment order will fail in the following circumstances:

* The fulfillment order is closed.
* The destination location has never stocked the requested inventory item.
* The API client doesn't have the correct permissions.

Line items which have already been fulfilled can't be re-assigned
and will always remain assigned to the original location.

You can't change the assigned location while a fulfillment order has a
[request status](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderRequestStatus)
of `SUBMITTED`, `ACCEPTED`, `CANCELLATION_REQUESTED`, or `CANCELLATION_REJECTED`.
These request statuses mean that a fulfillment order is awaiting action by a fulfillment service
and can't be re-assigned without first having the fulfillment service accept a cancellation request.
This behavior is intended to prevent items from being fulfilled by multiple locations or fulfillment services.

### How re-assigning line items affects fulfillment orders

**First scenario:** Re-assign all line items belonging to a fulfillment order to a new location.

In this case, the
[assignedLocation](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/fulfillmentorder#field-fulfillmentorder-assignedlocation)
of the original fulfillment order will be updated to the new location.

**Second scenario:** Re-assign a subset of the line items belonging to a fulfillment order to a new location.
You can specify a subset of line items using the `fulfillmentOrderLineItems` parameter
(available as of the `2023-04` API version),
or specify that the original fulfillment order contains line items which have already been fulfilled.

If the new location is already assigned to another active fulfillment order, on the same order, then
a new fulfillment order is created. The existing fulfillment order is closed and line items are recreated
in a new fulfillment order.

args.name: fulfillmentOrderLineItems
args.description:
The fulfillment order line items to be moved.
If left blank, all unfulfilled line items belonging to the fulfillment order are moved.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the fulfillment order to be moved.

args.name: newLocationId
args.description: The ID of the location where the fulfillment order will be moved.

fields.name: fulfillmentServiceCreate
fields.description:
Creates a fulfillment service.

## Fulfillment service location

When creating a fulfillment service, a new location will be automatically created on the shop
and will be associated with this fulfillment service.
This location will be named after the fulfillment service and inherit the shop's address.

If you are using API version `2023-10` or later, and you need to specify custom attributes for the fulfillment service location
(for example, to change its address to a country different from the shop's country),
use the
[LocationEdit](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/locationEdit)
mutation after creating the fulfillment service.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.description: The URL to send requests for the fulfillment service. The following considerations apply: - Shopify queries the callback_url/fetch_tracking_numbers endpoint to retrieve tracking numbers for orders, if `trackingSupport` is set to `true`. - Shopify queries the callback_url/fetch_stock endpoint to retrieve inventory levels, if `inventoryManagement` is set to `true`. - Shopify uses the callback_url/fulfillment_order_notification endpoint to send [fulfillment and cancellation requests](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments#step-2-receive-fulfillment-requests-and-cancellations).

args.name: fulfillmentOrdersOptIn
args.description:
Whether the fulfillment service uses the [fulfillment order based workflow](
  https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/fulfillment-service-apps/manage-fulfillments
) for managing fulfillments.

[As of 2022-07 API version](https://shopify.dev/changelog/legacy-fulfillment-api-deprecation),
the fulfillment order based workflow is the only way to manage fulfillments,
and `fulfillmentOrdersOptIn` must be set to `true`.

fields.name: productCreate
fields.description:
Creates a product.

If you need to create a product with many
[variants](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/input-objects/ProductVariantInput)
that are active at several
[locations](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/input-objects/InventoryLevelInput),
especially with a lot of
[collections](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/productCreate#field-productinput-collectionstojoin)
and
[tags](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/productCreate#field-productinput-tags),
then you should first create the product with just the variants.

After the product is created, you can activate the variants at locations
and add the other related objects to the product. This reduces the size of each mutation and increases the likelihood that it will
complete before the operation times out.

The following example shows how you might break up product creation and object association into multiple steps:

1. Create the product with variants. Don't specify any tags or collections on the product, and don't specify
[inventory quantities](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/input-objects/ProductVariantInput#field-productvariantinput-inventoryquantities)
for each variant.

2. After the product is created, add tags to the product using the
[tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/tagsAdd) mutation, and add collections using the
[collectionsAddProducts](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/collectionAddProducts) mutation.

3. Use the [inventoryBulkToggleActivation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/inventoryBulkToggleActivation) mutation
on each [inventory item](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/InventoryItem) to activate it at the appropriate locations.

4. After activating the variants at the locations, adjust inventory quantities at each location using the
[inventoryBulkAdjustQuantityAtLocation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/inventoryBulkAdjustQuantityAtLocation) mutation.

args.name: input
args.description: The properties of the new product.

args.name: media
args.description: List of new media to be added to the product.

Deletes a product, including all associated variants and media.

As of API version `2023-01`, if you need to delete a large product, such as one that has many
[variants](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/input-objects/ProductVariantInput)
that are active at several
[locations](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/input-objects/InventoryLevelInput),
you may encounter timeout errors. To avoid these timeout errors, you can instead use the asynchronous
[ProductDeleteAsync](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/productDeleteAsync)
mutation.

args.name: input
args.description: Specifies the product to delete by its ID.

Duplicates a product.

As of API version `2023-01`, if you need to duplicate a large product, such as one that has many

[locations](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/input-objects/InventoryLevelInput),
you may encounter timeout errors. To avoid these timeout errors, you can instead use the asynchronous
[ProductDuplicateAsyncV2](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/productDuplicateAsyncV2)
mutation.

fields.name: scriptTagCreate
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Script tag deprecation

Script tags will be sunset for the Order status page on August 28, 2025. Upgrade to Checkout Extensibility before this date. Shopify Scripts will continue to work alongside Checkout Extensibility until August 28, 2025.

Creates a new script tag.

args.name: input
args.description: The input fields for a script tag.

fields.name: scriptTagDelete
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Script tag deprecation

Script tags will be sunset for the Order status page on August 28, 2025. Upgrade to Checkout Extensibility before this date. Shopify Scripts will continue to work alongside Checkout Extensibility until August 28, 2025.

Deletes a script tag.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the script tag to delete.

fields.name: scriptTagUpdate
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Script tag deprecation

Script tags will be sunset for the Order status page on August 28, 2025. Upgrade to Checkout Extensibility before this date. Shopify Scripts will continue to work alongside Checkout Extensibility until August 28, 2025.

Updates a script tag.

args.name: input

fields.name: shopResourceFeedbackCreate
fields.description:
The `ResourceFeedback` object lets your app report the status of shops and their resources. For example, if
your app is a marketplace channel, then you can use resource feedback to alert merchants that they need to connect their marketplace account by signing in.

Resource feedback notifications are displayed to the merchant on the home screen of their Shopify admin, and in the product details view for any products that are published to your app.

This resource should be used only in cases where you're describing steps that a merchant is required to complete. If your app offers optional or promotional set-up steps, or if it makes recommendations, then don't use resource feedback to let merchants know about them.

## Sending feedback on a shop

You can send resource feedback on a shop to let the merchant know what steps they need to take to make sure that your app is set up correctly. Feedback can have one of two states: `requires_action` or `success`. You need to send a `requires_action` feedback request for each step that the merchant is required to complete.

If there are multiple set-up steps that require merchant action, then send feedback with a state of `requires_action` as merchants complete prior steps. And to remove the feedback message from the Shopify admin, send a `success` feedback request.

#### Important
Sending feedback replaces previously sent feedback for the shop. Send a new `shopResourceFeedbackCreate` mutation to push the latest state of a shop or its resources to Shopify.

args.name: input
args.description: The fields required to create shop feedback.

types.name: Navigable
types.description:
A default cursor that you can use in queries to paginate your results. Each edge in a connection can
return a cursor, which is a reference to the edge's position in the connection. You can use an edge's cursor as
the starting point to retrieve the nodes before or after it in a connection.

To learn more about using cursor-based pagination, refer to
[Paginating results with GraphQL](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/pagination-graphql).

types.name: Order
types.description:
An order is a customer's request to purchase one or more products from a shop. You can retrieve and update orders using the `Order` object.
Learn more about
[editing an existing order with the GraphQL Admin API](https://shopify.dev/apps/fulfillment/order-management-apps/order-editing).

Only the last 60 days' worth of orders from a store are accessible from the `Order` object by default. If you want to access older orders,
then you need to [request access to all orders](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/access-scopes#orders-permissions). If your app is granted
access, then you can add the `read_all_orders` scope to your app along with `read_orders` or `write_orders`.
[Private apps](https://shopify.dev/apps/auth/basic-http) are not affected by this change and are automatically granted the scope.

**Caution:** Only use this data if it's required for your app's functionality. Shopify will restrict [access to scopes](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/access-scopes) for apps that don't have a legitimate use for the associated data.

fields.description: A list of sales agreements associated with the order.

fields.description: Whether the order can be manually marked as paid.

The reason provided when the order was canceled.
Returns `null` if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.description: Cancellation details for the order.

The date and time when the order was canceled.
Returns `null` if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.description: Whether payment for the order can be captured.

fields.description: The total order-level discount amount, before returns, in shop currency.

fields.name: cartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The total order-level discount amount, before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The channel that created the order.

fields.name: channelInformation
fields.description: Details about the channel that created the order.

fields.name: clientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the API client that created the order.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Whether the order is closed.

fields.name: closedAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was closed.
Returns `null` if the order isn't closed.

fields.name: confirmationNumber
fields.description:
A randomly generated alpha-numeric identifier for the order that may be shown to the customer
instead of the sequential order name. For example, "XPAV284CT", "R50KELTJP" or "35PKUN0UJ".
This value isn't guaranteed to be unique.

fields.name: confirmed
fields.description: Whether inventory has been reserved for the order.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: The shop currency when the order was placed.

fields.name: currentCartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The current order-level discount amount after all order updates, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: currentSubtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for all line items that contribute to the order's current subtotal price.

fields.name: currentSubtotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The sum of the prices for all line items after discounts and returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
If `taxesIncluded` is `true`, then the subtotal also includes tax.

fields.name: currentTaxLines
fields.description:
A list of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, after returns.
Tax line prices represent the total price for all tax lines with the same `rate` and `title`.

fields.name: currentTotalAdditionalFeesSet
fields.description:
The total amount of additional fees after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
Returns `null` if there are no additional fees for the order.

fields.name: currentTotalDiscountsSet
fields.description:
The total amount discounted on the order after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes both order and line level discounts.

fields.name: currentTotalDutiesSet
fields.description:
The total amount of duties after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
Returns `null` if duties aren't applicable.

fields.name: currentTotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The total price of the order, after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes taxes and discounts.

fields.name: currentTotalTaxSet
fields.description: The sum of the prices of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: currentTotalWeight
fields.description: The total weight of the order after returns, in grams.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: A list of the custom attributes added to the order.

fields.description: The customer that placed the order.

fields.name: customerAcceptsMarketing
fields.description: Whether the customer agreed to receive marketing materials.

fields.name: customerJourney
fields.description: The customer's visits and interactions with the online store before placing the order.

fields.name: customerJourneySummary
fields.description: The customer's visits and interactions with the online store before placing the order.

fields.name: customerLocale
fields.description: A two-letter or three-letter language code, optionally followed by a region modifier.

fields.name: discountApplications
fields.description: A list of discounts that are applied to the order, not including order edits and refunds.

This field returns `false` when the order has no fulfillable line items.
For a more granular view of the fulfillment status, refer to the [FulfillmentOrder](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrder) object.

fields.name: fulfillmentOrders
fields.description:
A list of fulfillment orders for a specific order.

[FulfillmentOrder API access scopes](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrder#api-access-scopes)
govern which fulfillments orders are returned.
An API client will only receive a subset of the fulfillment orders which belong to an order
if they don't have the necessary access scopes to view all of the fulfillment orders.
In the case that an API client does not have the access scopes necessary to view
any of the fulfillment orders that belong to an order, an empty array will be returned.

fields.name: location
fields.description:
The fulfillment location that was assigned when the order was created.
Orders can have multiple fulfillment orders. These fulfillment orders can each be assigned to a different location which is responsible for fulfilling a subset of the items in an order. The `Order.location` field will only point to one of these locations.
Use the [`FulfillmentOrder`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/fulfillmentorder)
object for up-to-date fulfillment location information.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was processed.
This date and time might not match the date and time when the order was created.

fields.name: publication
fields.description: The publication that the order was created from.

fields.name: purchasingEntity
fields.description: The purchasing entity for the order.

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
The marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit the store.
Supports the following URL attributes: "ref", "source", or "r".
For example, if the URL is `{shop}.myshopify.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2`, then this value is `j2tj1tn2`.

fields.name: referrerDisplayText
fields.description: A web domain or short description of the source that sent the customer to your online store. For example, "shopify.com" or "email".

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description: The URL of the webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to your online store.

fields.name: refundDiscrepancySet
fields.description: The difference between the suggested and actual refund amount of all refunds that have been applied to the order. A positive value indicates a difference in the merchant's favor, and a negative value indicates a difference in the customer's favor.

fields.name: refundable
fields.description: Whether the order can be refunded.

fields.name: refunds
fields.description: A list of refunds that have been applied to the order.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

fields.name: registeredSourceUrl
fields.description: The URL of the source that the order originated from, if found in the domain registry.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether the order has shipping lines or at least one line item on the order that requires shipping.

fields.name: restockable
fields.description: Whether any line item on the order can be restocked.

fields.name: returnStatus
fields.description: The order's aggregated return status for display purposes.

fields.name: returns
fields.description: A list of returns for the order.

fields.name: shopifyProtect
fields.description: The Shopify Protect details for the order. If Shopify Protect is disabled for the shop, then this will be null.

fields.name: sourceIdentifier
fields.description:
A unique POS or third party order identifier.
For example, "1234-12-1000" or "111-98567-54". The `receipt_number` field is derived from this value for POS orders.

fields.name: subtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for all line items that contribute to the order's subtotal price.

fields.name: subtotalPrice
fields.description:
The sum of the prices for all line items after discounts and before returns, in shop currency.
If `taxesIncluded` is `true`, then the subtotal also includes tax.

fields.name: subtotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The sum of the prices for all line items after discounts and before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
If `taxesIncluded` is `true`, then the subtotal also includes tax.

fields.name: suggestedRefund
fields.description: A suggested refund for the order.

args.name: refundDuties
args.description: The duties from the order to include in the refund.

args.name: refundLineItems
args.description: The line items from the order to include in the refund.

args.name: refundShipping
args.description: Whether to refund the full shipping amount.

args.name: shippingAmount
args.description:
The amount to refund for shipping. Overrides the `refundShipping` argument.
Use the `shippingAmountV2` argument for multi-currency orders.

args.name: suggestFullRefund
args.description:
Whether the suggested refund should be created from all refundable line items on the order.
If `true`, the `refundLineItems` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: tags
fields.description:
A comma separated list of tags associated with the order. Updating `tags` overwrites
any existing tags that were previously added to the order. To add new tags without overwriting
existing tags, use the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/tagsadd)
mutation.

fields.name: taxExempt
fields.description: Whether taxes are exempt on the order.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description:
A list of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, before returns.
Tax line prices represent the total price for all tax lines with the same `rate` and `title`.

fields.name: taxesIncluded
fields.description: Whether taxes are included in the subtotal price of the order.

fields.name: test
fields.description:
Whether the order is a test.
Test orders are made using the Shopify Bogus Gateway or a payment provider with test mode enabled.
A test order can't be converted into a real order and vice versa.

fields.name: totalCapturable
fields.description:
The authorized amount that's uncaptured or undercaptured, in shop currency.
This amount isn't adjusted for returns.

fields.name: totalCapturableSet
fields.description:
The authorized amount that's uncaptured or undercaptured, in shop and presentment currencies.
This amount isn't adjusted for returns.

fields.name: totalDiscounts
fields.description:
The total amount discounted on the order before returns, in shop currency.
This includes both order and line level discounts.

fields.name: totalDiscountsSet
fields.description:
The total amount discounted on the order before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes both order and line level discounts.

fields.name: totalOutstandingSet
fields.description:
The total amount not yet transacted for the order, in shop and presentment currencies.
A positive value indicates a difference in the merchant's favor (payment from customer to merchant) and a negative value indicates a difference in the customer's favor (refund from merchant to customer).

fields.name: totalPrice
fields.description:
The total price of the order, before returns, in shop currency.
This includes taxes and discounts.

fields.name: totalPriceSet
fields.description:
The total price of the order, before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes taxes and discounts.

fields.name: totalReceived
fields.description: The total amount received from the customer before returns, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalReceivedSet
fields.description: The total amount received from the customer before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalRefunded
fields.description: The total amount that was refunded, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalRefundedSet
fields.description: The total amount that was refunded, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalRefundedShippingSet
fields.description: The total amount of shipping that was refunded, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalShippingPrice
fields.description: The total shipping amount before discounts and returns, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalShippingPriceSet
fields.description: The total shipping amount before discounts and returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: The total tax amount before returns, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalTaxSet
fields.description: The total tax amount before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalTipReceived
fields.description: The sum of all tip amounts for the order, in shop currency.

fields.name: totalTipReceivedSet
fields.description: The sum of all tip amounts for the order, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalWeight
fields.description: The total weight of the order before returns, in grams.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: A list of transactions associated with the order.

Filter transactions by whether they can be resolved manually.

types.name: OrderDisplayFinancialStatus
types.description: Represents the order's current financial status.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Authorized**.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Expired**.

enumValues.name: PAID
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Paid**.

enumValues.name: PARTIALLY_PAID
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Partially paid**.

enumValues.name: PARTIALLY_REFUNDED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Partially refunded**.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Pending**.

enumValues.name: REFUNDED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Refunded**.

enumValues.name: VOIDED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Voided**.

types.name: OrderDisplayFulfillmentStatus
types.description: Represents the order's aggregated fulfillment status for display purposes.

enumValues.name: FULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Fulfilled**. All the items in the order have been fulfilled.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Displayed as **In progress**. Some of the items in the order have been fulfilled, or a request for fulfillment has been sent to the fulfillment service.

enumValues.name: ON_HOLD
enumValues.description: Displayed as **On hold**. All of the unfulfilled items in this order are on hold.

enumValues.name: OPEN
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Open**. None of the items in the order have been fulfilled. Replaced by "UNFULFILLED" status.

enumValues.name: PARTIALLY_FULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Partially fulfilled**. Some of the items in the order have been fulfilled.

enumValues.name: PENDING_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Pending fulfillment**. A request for fulfillment of some items awaits a response from the fulfillment service. Replaced by the "IN_PROGRESS" status.

enumValues.name: RESTOCKED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Restocked**. All the items in the order have been restocked. Replaced by the "UNFULFILLED" status.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Scheduled**. All of the unfulfilled items in this order are scheduled for fulfillment at later time.

enumValues.name: UNFULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Unfulfilled**. None of the items in the order have been fulfilled.

types.name: OrderReturnStatus
types.description:
The order's aggregated return status that's used for display purposes.
An order might have multiple returns, so this field communicates the prioritized return status.
The `OrderReturnStatus` enum is a supported filter parameter in the [`orders` query](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/queries/orders#:~:text=reference_location_id-,return_status,-risk_level).

enumValues.name: INSPECTION_COMPLETE
enumValues.description: All return shipments from a return in this order were inspected.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Some items in the order are being returned.

enumValues.name: NO_RETURN
enumValues.description: No items in the order were returned.

enumValues.name: RETURNED
enumValues.description: Some items in the order were returned.

enumValues.name: RETURN_FAILED
enumValues.description: Some returns in the order were not completed successfully.

enumValues.name: RETURN_REQUESTED
enumValues.description: A return was requested for some items in the order.

types.name: OrderRisk
types.description:
Represents a fraud check on an order.
As of version 2024-04 this resource is deprecated. Risk Assessments can be queried via the
[OrderRisk Assessments API](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/2024-04/objects/OrderRiskAssessment).

fields.name: display
fields.description: Whether the risk level is shown in the Shopify admin. If false, then this order risk is ignored when Shopify determines the overall risk level for the order.
fields.deprecationReason: This field is deprecated in version 2024-04

fields.name: level
fields.description:
The likelihood that an order is fraudulent, based on this order risk.

The level can be set by Shopify risk analysis or by an app.
fields.deprecationReason: This field is deprecated in version 2024-04. Please use OrderRiskAssessment.riskLevel

fields.name: message
fields.description: The risk message that's shown to the merchant in the Shopify admin.
fields.deprecationReason: This field is deprecated in version 2024-04

types.name: OrderRiskLevel
types.description: The likelihood that an order is fraudulent.

enumValues.name: HIGH
enumValues.description: There is a high level of risk that this order is fraudulent.

enumValues.name: LOW
enumValues.description: There is a low level of risk that this order is fraudulent.

enumValues.name: MEDIUM
enumValues.description: There is a medium level of risk that this order is fraudulent.

types.name: OrderTransaction

fields.name: accountNumber

fields.name: errorCode

fields.description:
The transaction receipt that the payment gateway attaches to the transaction.
The value of this field depends on which payment gateway processed the transaction.

fields.name: totalUnsettledV2
fields.description:
Specifies the available amount with currency to capture on the gateway.
Only available when an amount is capturable or manually mark as paid.

types.name: OrderTransactionInput
types.description: The input fields for the information needed to create an order transaction.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount of money for this transaction.

inputFields.name: gateway
inputFields.description: The payment gateway to use for this transaction.

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: The kind of transaction.

inputFields.name: orderId
inputFields.description: The ID of the order associated with the transaction.

inputFields.name: parentId
inputFields.description: The ID of the optional parent transaction, for example the authorization of a capture.

types.name: OrderTransactionKind
types.description: The different kinds of order transactions.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description:
An amount reserved against the cardholder's funding source.
Money does not change hands until the authorization is captured.

enumValues.name: CAPTURE
enumValues.description: A transfer of the money that was reserved by an authorization.

enumValues.name: CHANGE
enumValues.description: The money returned to the customer when they've paid too much during a cash transaction.

enumValues.name: EMV_AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description: An authorization for a payment taken with an EMV credit card reader.

enumValues.name: REFUND
enumValues.description:
A partial or full return of captured funds to the cardholder.
A refund can happen only after a capture is processed.

enumValues.name: SALE
enumValues.description: An authorization and capture performed together in a single step.

enumValues.name: SUGGESTED_REFUND
enumValues.description: A suggested refund transaction that can be used to create a refund.

enumValues.name: VOID
enumValues.description: A cancelation of an authorization transaction.

enumValues.description: Awaiting a response.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the transaction.

enumValues.name: FAILURE
enumValues.description: The transaction failed.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The transaction is pending.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: The transaction succeeded.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The transaction status is unknown.

enumValues.name: COMPONENTS_SUM
enumValues.description: The price of the parent will be the sum of the components price times their quantity.

enumValues.name: FIXED
enumValues.description: The price of the parent will be set to the price provided.

enumValues.description: The price of the parent will not be adjusted.

The specific type of calculation done to determine the price of the parent variant.
The price is calculated during Bundle creation. Updating a component variant won't recalculate the price.

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: The price of the parent product variant. This will be be used if calcualtion is set to 'FIXED'.

types.name: PriceList
types.description:
Represents a price list, including information about related prices and eligibility rules.
You can use price lists to specify either fixed prices or adjusted relative prices that
override initial product variant prices. Price lists are applied to customers
using context rules, which determine price list eligibility.

  For more information on price lists, refer to
  [Support different pricing models](https://shopify.dev/apps/internationalization/product-price-lists).

fields.name: catalog
fields.description: The catalog that the price list is associated with.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The currency for fixed prices associated with this price list.

fields.name: fixedPricesCount
fields.description: The number of fixed prices on the price list.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The unique name of the price list, used as a human-readable identifier.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: Relative adjustments to other prices.

fields.name: prices
fields.description: A list of prices associated with the price list.

types.name: PriceRule
types.description:
Price rules are a set of conditions, including entitlements and prerequisites, that must be met in order for a discount code to apply.

We recommend using the types and queries detailed at [Getting started with discounts](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/selling-strategies/discounts/getting-started) instead. These will replace the GraphQL `PriceRule` object and REST Admin `PriceRule` and `DiscountCode` resources.

fields.name: allocationLimit
fields.description: The maximum number of times that the price rule can be allocated onto an order.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the price rule's value is allocated to its entitled items.

fields.name: app
fields.description: The application that created the price rule.

fields.name: combinesWith
fields.description: Determines which discount classes the discount can combine with.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the price rule was created.

fields.name: customerSelection
fields.description: The customers that can use this price rule.

fields.name: discountClass
fields.description: The class of the discount for combining purposes.

fields.name: discountCodes
fields.description: List of the price rule's discount codes.

types.name: PricingPercentageValue
types.description:
One type of value given to a customer when a discount is applied to an order.
The application of a discount with this value gives the customer the specified percentage off a specified item.

fields.name: percentage
fields.description: The percentage value of the object. This is a number between -100 (free) and 0 (no discount).

types.name: PricingValue
types.description: The type of value given to a customer when a discount is applied to an order. For example, the application of the discount might give the customer a percentage off a specified item. Alternatively, the application of the discount might give the customer a monetary value in a given currency off an order.

types.name: PrivateMetafield
types.description:
Private metafields represent custom metadata that is attached to a resource.
Private metafields are accessible only by the application that created them and only from the GraphQL Admin API.

An application can create a maximum of 10 private metafields per shop resource.

types.name: Product
types.description: The Product resource lets you manage products in a merchants store. You can use [ProductVariants](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/productvariant) to create or update different versions of the same product. You can also add or update product [Media](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/interfaces/media). Products can be organized by grouping them into a [Collection](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/collection).

types.name: ProductClaimOwnershipInput
types.description: The input fields to claim ownership for Product features such as Bundles.

inputFields.name: bundles
inputFields.description:
Claiming ownership of bundles lets the app render a custom UI for the bundles' card on the
products details page in the Shopify admin.

Bundle ownership can only be claimed when creating the product. If you create `ProductVariantComponents`
in any of its product variants, then the bundle ownership is automatically assigned to the app making the call.

[Learn more](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/selling-strategies/bundles/product-config).

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
The fulfillment service that stocks a product variant.

This is a third-party fulfillment service if the following conditions are met:
- The product variant is stocked by a single fulfillment service.
- The [FulfillmentService](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentService) is a third-party fulfillment service. Third-party fulfillment services don't have a handle with the value `manual`.
- The fulfillment service hasn't [opted into SKU sharing](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentService#field-fulfillmentservice-permitsskusharing).

If the conditions aren't met, then the fulfillment service has the `manual` handle.
fields.deprecationReason:
The [relationship between a product variant and a fulfillment service was changed in the `2022-07` API version](/changelog/fulfillment-service-sku-sharing). A [ProductVariant](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/ProductVariant) can be stocked by multiple fulfillment services. As a result, we recommend that you use the [inventoryItem field](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/ProductVariant#field-productvariant-inventoryitem) if you need to determine where a product variant is stocked.

If you need to determine whether a product is a gift card, then you should continue to use this field until an alternative is available.

Learn more about [managing inventory quantities and states](/apps/fulfillment/inventory-management-apps/quantities-states).

fields.name: fulfillmentServiceEditable
fields.description: Whether changes to the fulfillment service for the product variant are allowed.

fields.name: harmonizedSystemCode
fields.description: The Harmonized System Code (or HS Tariff Code) for the variant.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The featured image for the variant.

fields.name: inventoryItem
fields.description: The inventory item, which is used to query for inventory information.

fields.name: inventoryManagement
fields.description: The fulfillment service that tracks the number of items in stock for the product variant.

fields.name: inventoryPolicy
fields.description: Whether customers are allowed to place an order for the product variant when it's out of stock.

fields.name: inventoryQuantity
fields.description: The total sellable quantity of the variant.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: media
fields.description: The media associated with the product variant.

inputFields.name: mediaId
inputFields.description: The ID of the media to associate with the variant. This field can only be used in mutations that create media images and must match one of the IDs being created on the product. This field only accepts one value.

inputFields.name: mediaSrc
inputFields.description: The URL of the media to associate with the variant. This field can only be used in mutations that create media images and must match one of the URLs being created on the product. This field only accepts one value.

inputFields.name: metafields
inputFields.description: Additional customizable information about the product variant.

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description: The custom properties that a shop owner uses to define product variants.

inputFields.name: position
inputFields.description: The order of the product variant in the list of product variants. The first position in the list is 1.

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: The price of the variant.

inputFields.name: productId
inputFields.description: The product to create the variant for. Used as input only to the `productVariantCreate` mutation.

inputFields.name: requiresComponents
inputFields.description:
Whether a product variant requires components. The default value is `false`.
If `true`, then the product variant can only be purchased as a parent bundle with components and it will be omitted
from channels that don't support bundles.

inputFields.name: requiresShipping
inputFields.description: Whether the variant requires shipping.

inputFields.name: sku
inputFields.description: The SKU for the variant. Case-sensitive string.

inputFields.name: taxCode
inputFields.description: The tax code associated with the variant.

inputFields.name: taxable
inputFields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

inputFields.name: weight
inputFields.description: The weight of the variant.

inputFields.name: weightUnit
inputFields.description: The unit of weight that's used to measure the variant.

types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `ProductVariantRelationshipBulkUpdateUserError`.

enumValues.name: CIRCULAR_REFERENCE
enumValues.description: A parent product variant cannot contain itself as a component.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE_PRODUCT_VARIANT_RELATIONSHIP
enumValues.description: A parent product variant must not contain duplicate product variant relationships.

enumValues.name: EXCEEDED_PRODUCT_VARIANT_RELATIONSHIP_LIMIT
enumValues.description: Exceeded the maximum allowable product variant relationships in a parent product variant.

enumValues.name: FAILED_TO_CREATE
enumValues.description: Unable to create parent product variant.

enumValues.name: FAILED_TO_REMOVE
enumValues.description: Unable to remove product variant relationships.

enumValues.name: FAILED_TO_UPDATE
enumValues.description: Unable to update product variant relationships.

enumValues.name: FAILED_TO_UPDATE_PARENT_PRODUCT_VARIANT_PRICE
enumValues.description: Unable to update parent product variant price.

enumValues.name: INVALID_QUANTITY
enumValues.description: Product variant relationships must have a quantity greater than 0.

enumValues.name: MUST_SPECIFY_COMPONENTS
enumValues.description: The product variant relationships to remove must be specified if all the parent product variant's components aren't being removed.

enumValues.name: NESTED_PARENT_PRODUCT_VARIANT
enumValues.description: Nested parent product variants aren't supported.

enumValues.name: PARENT_PRODUCT_VARIANT_CANNOT_BE_GIFT_CARD
enumValues.description: Gift cards cannot be parent product variants.

enumValues.name: PARENT_PRODUCT_VARIANT_CANNOT_REQUIRE_SELLING_PLAN
enumValues.description: Parent product variants cannot require a selling plan.

enumValues.name: PARENT_REQUIRED
enumValues.description: A parent product variant ID or product ID must be provided.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_EXPANDER_APP_OWNERSHIP_ALREADY_EXISTS
enumValues.description: The products for these product variants are already owned by another App.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_VARIANTS_NOT_COMPONENTS
enumValues.description: Some of the provided product variants are not components of the specified parent product variant.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_VARIANTS_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: The product variants were not found.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_VARIANT_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE_CONFLICT
enumValues.description: A Core type relationship cannot be added to a composite product variant with SFN type relationships.

enumValues.name: UNEXPECTED_ERROR
enumValues.description: Unexpected error.

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_MULTIPACK_RELATIONSHIP
enumValues.description: Multipack bundles are not supported.

enumValues.name: UPDATE_PARENT_VARIANT_PRICE_REQUIRED
enumValues.description: A price must be provided for a parent product variant if the price calucation is set to fixed.

types.name: QuantityRule
types.description: The quantity rule for the product variant in a given context.

fields.name: increment
fields.description:
The value that specifies the quantity increment between minimum and maximum of the rule.
Only quantities divisible by this value will be considered valid.

The increment must be lower than or equal to the minimum and the maximum, and both minimum and maximum
must be divisible by this value.

fields.name: isDefault
fields.description: Whether the quantity rule fields match one increment, one minimum and no maximum.

fields.name: maximum
fields.description:
An optional value that defines the highest allowed quantity purchased by the customer.
If defined, maximum must be lower than or equal to the minimum and must be a multiple of the increment.

fields.name: minimum
fields.description:
The value that defines the lowest allowed quantity purchased by the customer.
The minimum must be a multiple of the quantity rule's increment.

fields.name: originType
fields.description: Whether the values of the quantity rule were explicitly set.

fields.name: productVariant
fields.description: The product variant for which the quantity rule is applied.

types.name: QuantityRuleConnection
types.description: An auto-generated type for paginating through multiple QuantityRules.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of the nodes contained in QuantityRuleEdge.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The total count of QuantityRules.

types.name: QuantityRuleEdge
types.description: An auto-generated type which holds one QuantityRule and a cursor during pagination.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of QuantityRuleEdge.

types.name: QuantityRuleInput
types.description: The input fields for the per-order quantity rule to be applied on the product variant.

inputFields.name: increment
inputFields.description: The quantity increment.

inputFields.name: maximum
inputFields.description: The maximum quantity.

inputFields.name: minimum
inputFields.description: The minimum quantity.

inputFields.name: variantId
inputFields.description: Product variant on which to apply the quantity rule.

types.description: The origin of quantity rule on a price list.

enumValues.name: FIXED
enumValues.description: Quantity rule is explicitly defined.

enumValues.name: RELATIVE
enumValues.description: Quantity rule falls back to the relative rule.

fields.description: The error code.

fields.name: field

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `QuantityRuleUserError`.

enumValues.name: BLANK
enumValues.description: The input value is blank.

enumValues.name: CATALOG_CONTEXT_DOES_NOT_SUPPORT_QUANTITY_RULES
enumValues.description: Quantity rules can be associated only with company location catalogs.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE_INPUT_FOR_VARIANT
enumValues.description: Quantity rule inputs must be unique by variant id.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_ERROR
enumValues.description: Something went wrong when trying to save the quantity rule. Please try again later.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Value must be greater than or equal to 1.

enumValues.name: INCREMENT_IS_GREATER_THAN_MINIMUM
enumValues.description: Increment must be lower than or equal to the minimum.

enumValues.name: INCREMENT_NOT_A_MULTIPLE_OF_QUANTITY_PRICE_BREAK_MINIMUM
enumValues.description: Increment must be a multiple of all quantity price break minimums associated with this variant in the specified price list.

enumValues.name: MAXIMUM_IS_LOWER_THAN_QUANTITY_PRICE_BREAK_MINIMUM
enumValues.description: Maximum must be greater than or equal to all quantity price break minimums associated with this variant in the specified price list.

enumValues.name: MAXIMUM_NOT_MULTIPLE_OF_INCREMENT
enumValues.description: The maximum must be a multiple of the increment.

enumValues.name: MINIMUM_IS_GREATER_THAN_MAXIMUM
enumValues.description: Minimum must be lower than or equal to the maximum.

enumValues.name: MINIMUM_IS_HIGHER_THAN_QUANTITY_PRICE_BREAK_MINIMUM
enumValues.description: Minimum must be less than or equal to all quantity price break minimums associated with this variant in the specified price list.

enumValues.name: MINIMUM_NOT_MULTIPLE_OF_INCREMENT
enumValues.description: The minimum must be a multiple of the increment.

enumValues.name: PRICE_LIST_DOES_NOT_EXIST
enumValues.description: Price list does not exist.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_VARIANT_DOES_NOT_EXIST
enumValues.description: Product variant ID does not exist.

enumValues.name: VARIANT_QUANTITY_RULE_DOES_NOT_EXIST
enumValues.description: Quantity rule for variant associated with the price list provided does not exist.

fields.name: fulfillmentOrders
fields.description:
The paginated list of all fulfillment orders.
The returned fulfillment orders are filtered according to the
[fulfillment order access scopes](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/fulfillmentorder#api-access-scopes)
granted to the app.

Use this query to retrieve fulfillment orders assigned to merchant-managed locations,
third-party fulfillment service locations, or all kinds of locations together.

For fetching only the fulfillment orders assigned to the app's locations, use the
[Shop.assignedFulfillmentOrders](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Shop#connection-shop-assignedfulfillmentorders)
connection.

fields.name: productByHandle
fields.description: Return a product by its handle.

args.name: handle
args.description: A unique string that identifies the product. Handles are automatically generated based on the product's title, and are always lowercase. Whitespace and special characters are replaced with a hyphen: `-`. If there are multiple consecutive whitespace or special characters, then they're replaced with a single hyphen. Whitespace or special characters at the beginning are removed. If a duplicate product title is used, then the handle is auto-incremented by one. For example, if you had two products called `Potion`, then their handles would be `potion` and `potion-1`. After a product has been created, changing the product title doesn't update the handle.

fields.name: scriptTag
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Script tag deprecation

Script tags will be sunset for the Order status page on August 28, 2025. Upgrade to Checkout Extensibility before this date. Shopify Scripts will continue to work alongside Checkout Extensibility until August 28, 2025.

Lookup a script tag resource by ID.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the ScriptTag to return.

fields.name: scriptTags
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Script tag deprecation

Script tags will be sunset for the Order status page on August 28, 2025. Upgrade to Checkout Extensibility before this date. Shopify Scripts will continue to work alongside Checkout Extensibility until August 28, 2025.

A list of script tags.

types.name: ResourceAlert
types.description:
An alert message that appears in the Shopify admin about a problem with a store resource, with 1 or more actions to take. For example, you could use an alert to indicate that you're not charging taxes on some product variants.
They can optionally have a specific icon and be dismissed by merchants.

fields.name: actions
fields.description:
Buttons in the alert that link to related information.
For example, _Edit variants_.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The secondary text in the alert that includes further information or instructions about how to solve a problem.

fields.name: dismissibleHandle
fields.description:
Unique identifier that appears when an alert is manually closed by the merchant.
Most alerts can't be manually closed.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: An icon that's optionally displayed with the alert.

fields.name: severity
fields.description: Indication of how important the alert is.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The primary text in the alert that includes information or describes the problem.

types.name: ResourceAlertAction
types.description: An action associated to a resource alert, such as editing variants.

fields.name: primary
fields.description: Whether the action appears as a button or as a link.

fields.name: show
fields.description: Resource for the action to show.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The text for the button in the alert. For example, _Edit variants_.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The target URL that the button links to.

types.name: ResourceAlertIcon
types.description: The available icons for resource alerts.

enumValues.name: CHECKMARK_CIRCLE
enumValues.description: A checkmark inside a circle.

enumValues.name: INFORMATION_CIRCLE
enumValues.description: A lowercase `i` inside a circle.

types.name: ResourceAlertSeverity
types.description: The possible severity levels for a resource alert.

enumValues.name: CRITICAL
enumValues.description: Indicates a critical alert. For example, a blocked app.

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: Indicates a neutral alert. For example, an accepted dispute.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.deprecationReason: `ERROR` severity is being deprecated in favour of `WARNING` or `CRITICAL` instead.

enumValues.name: INFO
enumValues.description: Indicates an informative alert. For example, an escalated dispute.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: Indicates a success alert. For example, a winning a dispute.

enumValues.name: WARNING
enumValues.description: Indicates an informative alert. For example, a new dispute.

types.name: ResourceFeedback
types.description: Represents feedback from apps about a resource, and the steps required to set up the apps on the shop.

fields.name: appFeedback
fields.description: Feedback from an app about the steps a merchant needs to take to set up the app on their store.

fields.name: details
fields.description: List of AppFeedback detailing issues regarding a resource.

fields.name: summary
fields.description: Summary of resource feedback pertaining to the resource.

types.name: ResourceFeedbackCreateInput
types.description: The input fields for a resource feedback object.

inputFields.name: feedbackGeneratedAt
inputFields.description:
The date and time when the feedback was generated. Used to help determine whether
incoming feedback is outdated compared to existing feedback.

inputFields.name: messages
inputFields.description:
If the feedback state is `requires_action`, then you can send a string message that communicates the action to be taken by the merchant.
The string must be a single message up to 100 characters long and must end with a period.
You need to adhere to the message formatting rules or your requests will fail:
- `[Explanation of the problem]. [Suggested action].`

**Examples:**
- `[Your app name]` isn't connected. Connect your account to use this sales channel. `[Learn more]`
- `[Your app name]` isn't configured. Agree to the terms and conditions to use this app. `[Learn more]`
Both `Your app name` and `Learn more` (a button which directs merchants to your app) are automatically populated in the Shopify admin.

inputFields.name: state
inputFields.description: The state of the feedback and whether it requires merchant action.

types.name: ResourceFeedbackState
types.description: The state of the resource feedback.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: No action required from merchant.

enumValues.name: REQUIRES_ACTION
enumValues.description: The merchant needs to resolve an issue with the resource.

types.name: ResourcePublication
types.description:
A resource publication represents information about the publication of a resource.
An instance of `ResourcePublication`, unlike `ResourcePublicationV2`, can be neither published or scheduled to be published.

See [ResourcePublicationV2](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/ResourcePublicationV2) for more context.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The channel the resource publication is published to.

fields.name: isPublished
fields.description:
Whether the resource publication is published. Also returns true if the resource publication is scheduled to be published.
If false, then the resource publication is neither published nor scheduled to be published.

fields.name: publication
fields.description: The publication the resource publication is published to.

fields.name: publishDate
fields.description:
The date that the resource publication was or is going to be published to the publication.
If the product isn't published, then this field returns an epoch timestamp.

fields.name: publishable
fields.description: The resource published to the publication.

types.name: ResourcePublicationV2
types.description:
A resource publication represents information about the publication of a resource.
Unlike `ResourcePublication`, an instance of `ResourcePublicationV2` can't be unpublished. It must either be published or scheduled to be published.

See [ResourcePublication](/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/ResourcePublication) for more context.

fields.name: isPublished
fields.description:
Whether the resource publication is published. If true, then the resource publication is published to the publication.
If false, then the resource publication is staged to be published to the publication.

fields.name: publication
fields.description: The publication the resource publication is published to.

fields.name: publishDate
fields.description: The date that the resource publication was or is going to be published to the publication.

fields.name: publishable

types.name: ReverseDelivery
types.description:
A reverse delivery is a post-fulfillment object that represents a buyer sending a package to a merchant.
For example, a buyer requests a return, and a merchant sends the buyer a shipping label.
The reverse delivery contains the context of the items sent back, how they're being sent back
(for example, a shipping label), and the current state of the delivery (tracking information).

fields.description: The deliverable associated with the reverse delivery.

fields.name: id

types.name: Sale
types.description: An individual sale record associated with a sales agreement. Every money value in an order's sales data is represented in the currency's smallest unit. When amounts are divided across multiple line items, such as taxes or order discounts, the amounts might not divide evenly across all of the line items on the order. To address this, the remaining currency units that couldn't be divided evenly are allocated one at a time, starting with the first line item, until they are all accounted for. In aggregate, the values sum up correctly. In isolation, one line item might have a different tax or discount amount than another line item of the same price, before taxes and discounts. This is because the amount could not be divided evenly across the items. The allocation of currency units across line items is immutable. After they are allocated, currency units are never reallocated or redistributed among the line items.

fields.name: actionType
fields.description: The type of order action that the sale represents.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique ID for the sale.

fields.name: lineType
fields.description: The line type assocated with the sale.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of units either ordered or intended to be returned.

fields.name: taxes
fields.description: All individual taxes associated with the sale.

fields.name: totalAmount
fields.description: The total sale amount after taxes and discounts.

fields.name: totalDiscountAmountAfterTaxes
fields.description: The total discounts allocated to the sale after taxes.

fields.name: totalDiscountAmountBeforeTaxes
fields.description: The total discounts allocated to the sale before taxes.

fields.name: totalTaxAmount
fields.description: The total amount of taxes for the sale.

types.name: SaleLineType
types.description: The possible line types for a sale record. One of the possible order line types for a sale is an adjustment. Sales adjustments occur when a refund is issued for a line item that is either more or less than the total value of the line item. Examples are restocking fees and goodwill payments. When this happens, Shopify produces a sales agreement with sale records for each line item that is returned or refunded and an additional sale record for the adjustment (for example, a restocking fee). The sales records for the returned or refunded items represent the reversal of the original line item sale value. The additional adjustment sale record represents the difference between the original total value of all line items that were refunded, and the actual amount refunded.

enumValues.name: ADDITIONAL_FEE
enumValues.description: An additional fee.

enumValues.name: ADJUSTMENT
enumValues.description: A sale adjustment.

enumValues.name: DUTY
enumValues.description: A duty charge.

enumValues.name: GIFT_CARD
enumValues.description: A gift card.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT
enumValues.description: A product purchased, returned or exchanged.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING
enumValues.description: A shipping cost.

enumValues.name: TIP
enumValues.description: A tip added by the customer.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: An unknown sale line. Represents new types that may be added in future versions.

types.name: SalesAgreement
types.description: A contract between a merchant and a customer to do business. Shopify creates a sales agreement whenever an order is placed, edited, or refunded. A sales agreement has one or more sales records, which provide itemized details about the initial agreement or subsequent changes made to the order. For example, when a customer places an order, Shopify creates the order, generates a sales agreement, and records a sale for each line item purchased in the order. A sale record is specific to a type of order line. Order lines can represent different things such as a purchased product, a tip added by a customer, shipping costs collected at checkout, and more.

fields.name: app
fields.description: The application that created the agreement.

fields.name: happenedAt
fields.description: The date and time at which the agreement occured.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique ID for the agreement.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: The reason the agremeent was created.

fields.name: sales
fields.description: The sales associated with the agreement.

types.name: ScriptDiscountApplication
types.description:
Script discount applications capture the intentions of a discount that
was created by a Shopify Script for an order's line item or shipping line.

Discount applications don't represent the actual final amount discounted on a line (line item or shipping line). The actual amount discounted on a line is represented by the [DiscountAllocation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/discountallocation) object.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is applied to its entitled items.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the application as defined by the Script.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
An ordered index that can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the application as defined by the Script.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

types.name: ScriptTag
types.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Script tag deprecation

Script tags will be sunset for the Order status page on August 28, 2025. Upgrade to Checkout Extensibility before this date. Shopify Scripts will continue to work alongside Checkout Extensibility until August 28, 2025.

A script tag represents remote JavaScript code that is loaded into the pages of a shop's storefront or the **Order status** page of checkout.

fields.name: cache
fields.description:
Whether the Shopify CDN can cache and serve the script tag.
If `true`, then the script will be cached and served by the CDN.
The cache expires 15 minutes after the script tag is successfully returned.
If `false`, then the script will be served as is.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the script tag was created.

fields.name: displayScope
fields.description: The page or pages on the online store that the script should be included.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: src
fields.description: The URL to the remote script.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the script tag was last updated.
