types.name: SellingPlan
types.description:
Represents how a product can be sold and purchased. Selling plans and associated records (selling plan groups
and policies) are deleted 48 hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app. We recommend backing
up these records if you need to restore them later.

For more information on selling plans, refer to
[*Creating and managing selling plans*](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/selling-strategies/subscriptions/selling-plans).

fields.name: billingPolicy
fields.description: A selling plan policy which describes the recurring billing details.

fields.name: category
fields.description: The category used to classify the selling plan for reporting purposes.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the selling plan was created.

fields.name: deliveryPolicy
fields.description: A selling plan policy which describes the delivery details.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Buyer facing string which describes the selling plan commitment.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: inventoryPolicy
fields.description: When to reserve inventory for a selling plan.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
A customer-facing description of the selling plan.

If your store supports multiple currencies, then don't include country-specific pricing content, such as "Buy monthly, get 10$ CAD off". This field won't be converted to reflect different currencies.

fields.name: options
fields.description: The values of all options available on the selling plan. Selling plans are grouped together in Liquid when they're created by the same app, and have the same `selling_plan_group.name` and `selling_plan_group.options` values.

fields.name: position
fields.description: Relative position of the selling plan for display. A lower position will be displayed before a higher position.

fields.name: pricingPolicies
fields.description: Selling plan pricing details.

fields.name: translations
fields.description: The translations associated with the resource.

args.name: locale
args.description: Filters translations locale.

args.name: marketId
args.description: Filters translations by market ID. Use this argument to retrieve content specific to a market.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchor
types.description: Represents a selling plan policy anchor.

fields.name: cutoffDay
fields.description:
The cutoff day for the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` is MONTHDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

If `type` is YEARDAY, then the value must be `null`.

fields.name: day
fields.description:
The day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` isn't WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

fields.name: month
fields.description:
The month of the anchor. If type is different than YEARDAY, then the value must
be `null` or between 1-12.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Represents the anchor type, it can be one one of WEEKDAY, MONTHDAY, YEARDAY.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchorInput
types.description: The input fields required to create or update a selling plan anchor.

inputFields.name: cutoffDay
inputFields.description:
The cutoff day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` is MONTHDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

If `type` is YEARDAY, then the value must be `null`.

This field should only be set if the cutoff field for the delivery policy is `null`.

inputFields.name: day
inputFields.description:
The day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` isn't WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

inputFields.name: month
inputFields.description:
The month of the anchor. If type is different than YEARDAY, then the value must
be `null` or between 1-12.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: Represents the anchor type, must be one of WEEKDAY, MONTHDAY, YEARDAY.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchorType
types.description: Represents the anchor type.

enumValues.name: MONTHDAY
enumValues.description: Which day of the month, between 1-31.

enumValues.name: WEEKDAY
enumValues.description: Which day of the week, between 1-7.

enumValues.name: YEARDAY
enumValues.description: Which days of the month and year, month between 1-12, and day between 1-31.

types.name: SellingPlanBillingPolicy
types.description:
Represents the billing frequency associated to the selling plan (for example, bill every week, or bill every
three months). The selling plan billing policy and associated records (selling plan groups, selling plans, pricing
policies, and delivery policy) are deleted 48 hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app.
We recommend backing up these records if you need to restore them later.

types.name: SellingPlanBillingPolicyInput
types.description: The input fields that are required to create or update a billing policy type.

inputFields.name: fixed
inputFields.description: The fixed billing policy details.

inputFields.name: recurring
inputFields.description: The recurring billing policy details.

types.name: SellingPlanCategory
types.description:
The category of the selling plan. For the `OTHER` category,
         you must fill out our [request form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeU18Xmw0Q61V8wdH-dfGafFqIBfRchQKUO8WAF3yJTvgyyZQ/viewform),
         where we'll review your request for a new purchase option.

enumValues.name: OTHER
enumValues.description: The selling plan is for anything not in one of the other categories.

enumValues.name: PRE_ORDER
enumValues.description: The selling plan is for pre-orders.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: The selling plan is for subscriptions.

enumValues.name: TRY_BEFORE_YOU_BUY
enumValues.description: The selling plan is for try before you buy purchases.

types.name: SellingPlanFixedBillingPolicy
types.description:
The fixed selling plan billing policy defines how much of the price of the product will be billed to customer
at checkout. If there is an outstanding balance, it determines when it will be paid.

fields.name: checkoutCharge
fields.description: The checkout charge when the full amount isn't charged at checkout.

fields.name: remainingBalanceChargeExactTime
fields.description: The exact time when to capture the full payment.

fields.name: remainingBalanceChargeTimeAfterCheckout
fields.description: The period after remaining_balance_charge_trigger, before capturing the full payment. Expressed as an ISO8601 duration.

fields.name: remainingBalanceChargeTrigger
fields.description: When to capture payment for amount due.

types.name: SellingPlanFixedBillingPolicyInput
types.description: The input fields required to create or update a fixed billing policy.

inputFields.name: checkoutCharge
inputFields.description: The checkout charge policy for the selling plan.

inputFields.name: remainingBalanceChargeExactTime
inputFields.description: The date and time to capture the full payment.

inputFields.name: remainingBalanceChargeTimeAfterCheckout
inputFields.description: The period after capturing the payment for the amount due (`remainingBalanceChargeTrigger`), and before capturing the full payment. Expressed as an ISO8601 duration.

inputFields.name: remainingBalanceChargeTrigger
inputFields.description: When to capture the payment for the amount due.

types.name: SellingPlanFixedDeliveryPolicy
types.description: Represents a fixed selling plan delivery policy.

fields.name: anchors
fields.description: The specific anchor dates upon which the delivery interval calculations should be made.

fields.name: cutoff
fields.description: A buffer period for orders to be included in next fulfillment anchor.

fields.name: fulfillmentExactTime
fields.description: The date and time when the fulfillment should trigger.

fields.name: fulfillmentTrigger
fields.description: What triggers the fulfillment. The value must be one of ANCHOR, ASAP, EXACT_TIME, or UNKNOWN.

fields.name: intent
fields.description:
Whether the delivery policy is merchant or buyer-centric.
Buyer-centric delivery policies state the time when the buyer will receive the goods.
Merchant-centric delivery policies state the time when the fulfillment should be started.
Currently, only merchant-centric delivery policies are supported.

fields.name: preAnchorBehavior
fields.description: The fulfillment or delivery behavior of the first fulfillment when the order is placed before the anchor. The default value for this field is `ASAP`.

types.name: SellingPlanFixedDeliveryPolicyInput
types.description: The input fields required to create or update a fixed delivery policy.

inputFields.name: anchors
inputFields.description: The specific anchor dates upon which the delivery interval calculations should be made.

inputFields.name: cutoff
inputFields.description: A buffer period for orders to be included in a cycle.

inputFields.name: fulfillmentExactTime
inputFields.description: The date and time when the fulfillment should trigger.

inputFields.name: fulfillmentTrigger
inputFields.description: What triggers the fulfillment.

inputFields.name: intent
inputFields.description: Whether the delivery policy is merchant or buyer-centric.

inputFields.name: preAnchorBehavior
inputFields.description: The pre-anchor behavior.

types.name: SellingPlanFixedDeliveryPolicyIntent
types.description: Possible intentions of a Delivery Policy.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_BEGIN
enumValues.description: A merchant-centric delivery policy. Mark this delivery policy to define when the merchant should start fulfillment.

types.name: SellingPlanFixedDeliveryPolicyPreAnchorBehavior
types.description: The fulfillment or delivery behavior of the first fulfillment when the orderis placed before the anchor.

enumValues.name: ASAP
enumValues.description: Orders placed can be fulfilled / delivered immediately. Orders placed inside a cutoff can be fulfilled / delivered at the next anchor.

enumValues.name: NEXT
enumValues.description:
Orders placed can be fulfilled / delivered at the next anchor date.
Orders placed inside a cutoff will skip the next anchor and can be fulfilled /
delivered at the following anchor.

types.name: SellingPlanFixedPricingPolicy
types.description:
Represents the pricing policy of a subscription or deferred purchase option selling plan.
The selling plan fixed pricing policy works with the billing and delivery policy
to determine the final price. Discounts are divided among fulfillments.
For example, a subscription with a $10 discount and two deliveries will have a $5
discount applied to each delivery.

fields.name: adjustmentType
fields.description: The price adjustment type.

fields.name: adjustmentValue
fields.description: The price adjustment value.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the fixed selling plan pricing policy was created.

types.name: SellingPlanFixedPricingPolicyInput
types.description: The input fields required to create or update a fixed selling plan pricing policy.

inputFields.name: adjustmentType
inputFields.description: Price adjustment type defined by the policy.

inputFields.name: adjustmentValue
inputFields.description: Price adjustment value defined by the policy.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the pricing policy.

types.name: SellingPlanFulfillmentTrigger
types.description: Describes what triggers fulfillment.

enumValues.name: ANCHOR
enumValues.description: Use the anchor values to calculate fulfillment date.

enumValues.name: ASAP
enumValues.description: As soon as possible.

enumValues.name: EXACT_TIME
enumValues.description: At an exact time defined by the fulfillment_exact_time field.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown. Usually to be determined in the future.

types.name: SellingPlanGroup
types.description:
Represents a selling method (for example, "Subscribe and save" or "Pre-paid"). Selling plan groups
and associated records (selling plans and policies) are deleted 48 hours after a merchant
uninstalls their subscriptions app. We recommend backing up these records if you need to restore them later.

fields.name: appId
fields.description: The ID for app, exposed in Liquid and product JSON.

types.name: SellingPlanInput
types.description: The input fields to create or update a selling plan.

inputFields.name: billingPolicy
inputFields.description: Selling plan policy which describes the billing details.

inputFields.name: category
inputFields.description: The category used to classify this selling plan for reporting purposes.

inputFields.name: deliveryPolicy
inputFields.description: A selling plan policy which describes the delivery details.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Buyer facing string which describes the selling plan commitment.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the selling plan.

inputFields.name: inventoryPolicy
inputFields.description: A selling plan policy which describes the inventory details.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Buyer facing string which describes the selling plan content.

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description: The values of all options available on the selling plan. Selling plans are grouped together in Liquid when they're created by the same app, and have the same `selling_plan_group.name` and `selling_plan_group.options` values.

inputFields.name: position
inputFields.description: Relative value for display purposes of this plan. A lower position will be displayed before a higher one.

inputFields.name: pricingPolicies
inputFields.description:
The pricing policies which describe the pricing details. Each selling plan
can only contain a maximum of 2 pricing policies.

enumValues.name: YEAR
enumValues.description: Year interval.

inputFields.description: When to reserve inventory for the order. The value must be ON_FULFILLMENT or ON_SALE.

types.name: SellingPlanPricingPolicy
types.description:
Represents the type of pricing associated to the selling plan (for example, a $10 or 20% discount that is set
for a limited period or that is fixed for the duration of the subscription). Selling plan pricing policies and
associated records (selling plan groups, selling plans, billing policy, and delivery policy) are deleted 48
hours after a merchant uninstalls their subscriptions app. We recommend backing up these records if you need
to restore them later.

enumValues.description: Fixed amount off adjustment.

enumValues.name: PERCENTAGE
enumValues.description: Percentage off adjustment.

enumValues.name: PRICE
enumValues.description: Price of the policy.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringBillingPolicy
types.description: Represents a recurring selling plan billing policy.

fields.name: anchors
fields.description: Specific anchor dates upon which the billing interval calculations should be made.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the selling plan billing policy was created.

fields.name: interval

fields.description: The number of intervals between billings.

fields.name: minCycles

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringBillingPolicyInput
types.description: The input fields required to create or update a recurring billing policy.

inputFields.name: anchors
inputFields.description: Specific anchor dates upon which the billing interval calculations should be made.

inputFields.name: interval
inputFields.description: The billing frequency, it can be either: day, week, month or year.

inputFields.name: intervalCount
inputFields.description: The number of intervals between billings.

inputFields.name: maxCycles
inputFields.description: Maximum number of billing iterations.

inputFields.name: minCycles
inputFields.description: Minimum number of billing iterations.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicy
types.description: Represents a recurring selling plan delivery policy.

fields.name: anchors
fields.description: The specific anchor dates upon which the delivery interval calculations should be made.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the selling plan delivery policy was created.

fields.name: cutoff
fields.description: Number of days which represent a buffer period for orders to be included in a cycle.

fields.name: intent
fields.description:
Whether the delivery policy is merchant or buyer-centric.
Buyer-centric delivery policies state the time when the buyer will receive the goods.
Merchant-centric delivery policies state the time when the fulfillment should be started.
Currently, only merchant-centric delivery policies are supported.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The delivery frequency, it can be either: day, week, month or year.

fields.name: intervalCount
fields.description: The number of intervals between deliveries.

fields.name: preAnchorBehavior
fields.description: The fulfillment or delivery behavior of the first fulfillment when the order is placed before the anchor. The default value for this field is `ASAP`.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyInput
types.description: The input fields to create or update a recurring delivery policy.

inputFields.name: anchors
inputFields.description: The specific anchor dates upon which the delivery interval calculations should be made.

inputFields.name: cutoff
inputFields.description: A buffer period for orders to be included in a cycle.

inputFields.name: intent
inputFields.description: Intention of this delivery policy, it can be either: delivery or fulfillment.

inputFields.name: interval
inputFields.description: The delivery frequency, it can be either: day, week, month or year.

inputFields.name: intervalCount
inputFields.description: The number of intervals between deliveries.

inputFields.name: preAnchorBehavior
inputFields.description: The pre-anchor behavior. It can be either: asap or next.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyIntent
types.description: Whether the delivery policy is merchant or buyer-centric.

enumValues.name: FULFILLMENT_BEGIN
enumValues.description: A merchant-centric delivery policy. Mark this delivery policy to define when the merchant should start fulfillment.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringDeliveryPolicyPreAnchorBehavior
types.description: The fulfillment or delivery behaviors of the first fulfillment when the orderis placed before the anchor.

enumValues.name: ASAP
enumValues.description: The orders placed can be fulfilled or delivered immediately. The orders placed inside a cutoff can be fulfilled or delivered at the next anchor.

enumValues.name: NEXT
enumValues.description:
The orders placed can be fulfilled or delivered at the next anchor date.
The orders placed inside a cutoff will skip the next anchor and can be fulfilled or
delivered at the following anchor.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringPricingPolicy
types.description: Represents a recurring selling plan pricing policy. It applies after the fixed pricing policy. By using the afterCycle parameter, you can specify the cycle when the recurring pricing policy comes into effect. Recurring pricing policies are not available for deferred purchase options.

fields.name: adjustmentType
fields.description: The price adjustment type.

fields.name: adjustmentValue
fields.description: The price adjustment value.

fields.name: afterCycle
fields.description: Cycle after which this pricing policy applies.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the recurring selling plan pricing policy was created.

types.name: SellingPlanRecurringPricingPolicyInput
types.description: The input fields required to create or update a recurring selling plan pricing policy.

inputFields.name: adjustmentType
inputFields.description: Price adjustment type defined by the policy.

inputFields.name: adjustmentValue
inputFields.description: Price adjustment value defined by the policy.

inputFields.name: afterCycle
inputFields.description: Cycle after which the pricing policy applies.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the pricing policy.

types.name: SellingPlanRemainingBalanceChargeTrigger
types.description: When to capture the payment for the remaining amount due.

enumValues.name: EXACT_TIME
enumValues.description: At an exact time defined by the remaining_balance_charge_exact_time field.

enumValues.name: NO_REMAINING_BALANCE
enumValues.description: When there's no remaining balance to be charged after checkout.

enumValues.name: TIME_AFTER_CHECKOUT
enumValues.description: After the duration defined by the remaining_balance_charge_time_after_checkout field.

types.name: SellingPlanReserve
types.description: When to reserve inventory for a selling plan.

enumValues.name: ON_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Reserve inventory when order is fulfilled.

enumValues.name: ON_SALE
enumValues.description: Reserve inventory at time of sale.

fields.name: assignedFulfillmentOrders
fields.description:
The paginated list of fulfillment orders assigned to the shop locations owned by the app.

Assigned fulfillment orders are fulfillment orders that are set to be fulfilled from locations
managed by
[fulfillment services](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentService)
that are registered by the app.
One app (api_client) can host multiple fulfillment services on a shop.
Each fulfillment service manages a dedicated location on a shop.
Assigned fulfillment orders can have associated
[fulfillment requests](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderRequestStatus),
or might currently not be requested to be fulfilled.

The app must have `read_assigned_fulfillment_orders`
[access scope](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/usage/access-scopes)
to be able to retrieve fulfillment orders assigned to its locations.

All assigned fulfillment orders (except those with the `CLOSED` status) will be returned by default.
Perform filtering with the `assignmentStatus` argument
to receive only fulfillment orders that have been requested to be fulfilled.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: assignmentStatus
args.description:
The assigment status of the fulfillment orders that should be returned.
If `assignmentStatus` argument is not provided, then
the query will return all assigned fulfillment orders,
except those that have the `CLOSED` status.

fields.name: productByHandle
fields.description: Return a product by its handle.

args.name: handle
args.description: A unique string that identifies the product. Handles are automatically generated based on the product's title, and are always lowercase. Whitespace and special characters are replaced with a hyphen: `-`. If there are multiple consecutive whitespace or special characters, then they're replaced with a single hyphen. Whitespace or special characters at the beginning are removed. If a duplicate product title is used, then the handle is auto-incremented by one. For example, if you had two products called `Potion`, then their handles would be `potion` and `potion-1`. After a product has been created, changing the product title doesn't update the handle.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsDisputeReason
types.description: The reason for the dispute provided by the cardholder's bank.

enumValues.name: BANK_CANNOT_PROCESS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank can't process the charge.

enumValues.name: CREDIT_NOT_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that the purchased product was returned or the transaction was otherwise canceled, but you haven't yet provided a refund or credit.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_INITIATED
enumValues.description: The customer initiated the dispute. Contact the customer for additional details on why the payment was disputed.

enumValues.name: DEBIT_NOT_AUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: The customer's bank can't proceed with the debit since it hasn't been authorized.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The customer claims they were charged multiple times for the same product or service.

enumValues.name: FRAUDULENT
enumValues.description: The cardholder claims that they didnt authorize the payment.

enumValues.name: GENERAL
enumValues.description: The dispute is uncategorized, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ACCOUNT_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The customer account associated with the purchase is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank account has insufficient funds.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_NOT_RECEIVED
enumValues.description: The customer claims they did not receive the products or services purchased.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_UNACCEPTABLE
enumValues.description: The product or service was received but was defective, damaged, or not as described.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION_CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that you continued to charge them after a subscription was canceled.

enumValues.name: UNRECOGNIZED
enumValues.description: The customer doesnt recognize the payment appearing on their card statement.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutInterval
types.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

enumValues.name: DAILY
enumValues.description: Each business day.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Payouts will not be automatically made.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY
enumValues.description: Each month, on the day of month specified by monthlyAnchor.

enumValues.name: WEEKLY
enumValues.description: Each week, on the day of week specified by weeklyAnchor.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutSchedule
types.description: The payment schedule for a payments account.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

fields.name: monthlyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the month funds will be paid out.

The value can be any day of the month from the 1st to the 31st.
If the payment interval is set to monthly, this value will be used.
Payouts scheduled between 29-31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

fields.name: weeklyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the week funds will be paid out.

The value can be any weekday from Monday to Friday.
If the payment interval is set to weekly, this value will be used.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutStatus
types.description: The transfer status of the payout.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The payout has been canceled by Shopify.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The payout has been declined by the bank.

enumValues.name: IN_TRANSIT
enumValues.description: The payout has been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: PAID
enumValues.description: The payout has been successfully deposited into the bank.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description:
The payout has been created and had transactions assigned to it, but
it has not yet been submitted to the bank.

types.name: ShopifyProtectEligibilityStatus
types.description: The status of an order's eligibility for protection against fraudulent chargebacks by Shopify Protect.

enumValues.name: ELIGIBLE
enumValues.description:
The order is eligible for protection against fraudulent chargebacks.
If an order is updated, the order's eligibility may change and protection could be removed.

enumValues.name: NOT_ELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: The order isn't eligible for protection against fraudulent chargebacks.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The eligibility of the order is pending and has not yet been determined.

types.name: ShopifyProtectOrderEligibility
types.description: The eligibility details of an order's protection against fraudulent chargebacks by Shopify Protect.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of whether an order is eligible for protection against fraudulent chargebacks.

types.name: ShopifyProtectOrderSummary
types.description: A summary of Shopify Protect details for an order.

fields.name: eligibility
fields.description: The eligibility details of an order's protection against fraudulent chargebacks.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the order's protection against fraudulent chargebacks.

types.name: ShopifyProtectStatus
types.description: The status of an order's protection with Shopify Protect.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description:
The protection for the order is active and eligible for reimbursement against fraudulent chargebacks.
If an order is updated, the order's eligibility may change and protection could become inactive.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: The protection for an order isn't active because the order didn't meet eligibility requirements.

enumValues.name: NOT_PROTECTED
enumValues.description: The order received a chargeback but the order wasn't protected because it didn't meet coverage requirements.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The protection for the order is pending and has not yet been determined.

enumValues.name: PROTECTED
enumValues.description: The order received a fraudulent chargeback and it was protected.

enumValues.description: The staff member can manage and install sales channels.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view, create, update, and delete customers, and respond to customer messages in the Shopify Messaging API.

enumValues.name: DASHBOARD
enumValues.description: The staff member can view the Shopify Home page, which includes sales information and other shop data.

enumValues.name: DOMAINS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view, buy, and manage domains.

enumValues.name: DRAFT_ORDERS
enumValues.description: The staff member can create, update, and delete draft orders.

enumValues.name: EDIT_ORDERS
enumValues.description: The staff member can update orders.

enumValues.name: FULL
enumValues.description: The staff has the same permissions as the [store owner](https://shopify.dev/en/manual/your-account/staff-accounts/staff-permissions#store-owner-permissions) with some exceptions, such as modifying the account billing or deleting staff accounts.
enumValues.deprecationReason: Use the list of the staff member's explicit permissions returned in the `StaffMember.permissions.userPermissions` field instead of `full` permission.

enumValues.name: GIFT_CARDS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view, create, issue, and export gift cards to a CSV file.

enumValues.name: LINKS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view and modify links and navigation menus.

enumValues.name: LOCATIONS
enumValues.description: The staff member can create, update, and delete locations where inventory is stocked or managed.

enumValues.name: MARKETING
enumValues.description: The staff member can view and create discount codes and automatic discounts, and export discounts to a CSV file.

enumValues.name: MARKETING_SECTION
enumValues.description: The staff member can view, create, and automate marketing campaigns.

enumValues.name: ORDERS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view, create, update, delete, and cancel orders, and receive order notifications. The staff member can still create draft orders without this permission.

enumValues.name: OVERVIEWS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view the Overview and Live view pages, which include sales information, and other shop and sales channels data.

enumValues.name: PAGES
enumValues.description: The staff member can view, create, update, publish, and delete blog posts and pages.

enumValues.name: PAY_ORDERS_BY_VAULTED_CARD
enumValues.description: The staff member can pay for an order by using a vaulted card.

enumValues.name: PREFERENCES
enumValues.description: The staff member can view the preferences and configuration of a shop.

enumValues.name: PRODUCTS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view, create, import, and update products, collections, and inventory.

enumValues.name: REPORTS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view and create all reports, which includes sales information and other shop data.

enumValues.name: THEMES
enumValues.description: The staff member can view, update, and publish themes.

enumValues.name: TRANSLATIONS
enumValues.description: The staff member can view and create translations.
enumValues.deprecationReason: Unused.

for the [productCreateMedia](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/2022-04/mutations/productCreateMedia)
and [fileCreate](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/2022-04/mutations/fileCreate)

enumValues.name: BULK_MUTATION_VARIABLES
enumValues.description:
Represents bulk mutation variables.

For example, bulk mutation variables can be used for bulk operations using the
[bulkOperationRunMutation mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/bulkOperationRunMutation).

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_IMAGE
enumValues.description:
An image associated with a collection.

For example, after uploading an image, you can use the
[collectionUpdate mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/collectionUpdate)
to add the image to a collection.

enumValues.name: FILE
enumValues.description:
Represents any file other than HTML.

For example, after uploading the file, you can add the file to the
[Files page](https://shopify.com/admin/settings/files) in Shopify admin using the
[fileCreate mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fileCreate).

enumValues.name: IMAGE
enumValues.description:
An image.

For example, after uploading an image, you can add the image to a product using the
[productCreateMedia mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/productCreateMedia)
or to the [Files page](https://shopify.com/admin/settings/files) in Shopify admin using the
[fileCreate mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fileCreate).

enumValues.name: MODEL_3D
enumValues.description:
A Shopify hosted 3d model.

For example, after uploading the 3d model, you can add the 3d model to a product using the
[productCreateMedia mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/productCreateMedia).

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_IMAGE
enumValues.description:
An image that's associated with a product.

For example, after uploading the image, you can add the image to a product using the
[productCreateMedia mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/productCreateMedia).

enumValues.name: RETURN_LABEL
enumValues.description:
Represents a label associated with a return.

For example, once uploaded, this resource can be used to [create a
ReverseDelivery](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/unstable/mutations/reverseDeliveryCreateWithShipping).

enumValues.name: SHOP_IMAGE
enumValues.description:
An image.

For example, after uploading the image, you can add the image to the
[Files page](https://shopify.com/admin/settings/files) in Shopify admin using the
[fileCreate mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fileCreate).

enumValues.name: URL_REDIRECT_IMPORT
enumValues.description:
Represents a redirect CSV file.

Example usage: This resource can be used for creating a
[UrlRedirectImport](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/2022-04/objects/UrlRedirectImport)
object for use in the
[urlRedirectImportCreate mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/urlRedirectImportCreate).

enumValues.name: VIDEO
enumValues.description:
A Shopify-hosted video.

For example, after uploading the video, you can add the video to a product using the
[productCreateMedia mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/productCreateMedia)
or to the [Files page](https://shopify.com/admin/settings/files) in Shopify admin using the
[fileCreate mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/fileCreate).

Each template has a specific namespace and key that we've reserved to have specific meanings for common use cases.

Refer to the [list of standard metafield definitions](https://shopify.dev/apps/metafields/definitions/standard-definitions).

types.name: SubscriptionBillingAttempt
types.description:
A record of an execution of the subscription billing process. Billing attempts use
idempotency keys to avoid duplicate order creation. A successful billing attempt
will create an order.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the billing attempt was completed.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the billing attempt was created.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: A code corresponding to a payment error during processing.

fields.name: errorMessage
fields.description: A message describing a payment error during processing.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: idempotencyKey
fields.description: A unique key generated by the client to avoid duplicate payments.

fields.name: nextActionUrl
fields.description: The URL where the customer needs to be redirected so they can complete the 3D Secure payment flow.

fields.name: order
fields.description: The result of this billing attempt if completed successfully.

fields.name: originTime
fields.description:
The date and time used to calculate fulfillment intervals for a billing attempt that
successfully completed after the current anchor date. To prevent fulfillment from being
pushed to the next anchor date, this field can override the billing attempt date.

fields.name: ready
fields.description: Whether the billing attempt is still processing.

fields.name: subscriptionContract
fields.description: The subscription contract.

types.name: SubscriptionBillingAttemptErrorCode
types.description:
The possible error codes associated with making billing attempts. The error codes supplement the
`error_message` to provide consistent results and help with dunning management.

enumValues.name: AMOUNT_TOO_SMALL
enumValues.description: The amount is too small.

enumValues.name: AUTHENTICATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error during the authentication.

enumValues.name: BUYER_CANCELED_PAYMENT_METHOD
enumValues.description: Payment method was canceled by buyer.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_INVALID
enumValues.description: Customer is invalid.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Customer was not found.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED_PAYMENT_METHOD
enumValues.description: Payment method is expired.

enumValues.name: INVALID_CUSTOMER_BILLING_AGREEMENT
enumValues.description: The billing agreement ID or the transaction ID for the customer's payment method is invalid.

enumValues.name: INVALID_PAYMENT_METHOD
enumValues.description: Payment method is invalid. Please update or create a new payment method.

enumValues.name: INVALID_SHIPPING_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: The shipping address is either missing or invalid.

enumValues.name: INVENTORY_ALLOCATIONS_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: No inventory location found or enabled.

enumValues.name: INVOICE_ALREADY_PAID
enumValues.description: A payment has already been made for this invoice.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_DECLINED
enumValues.description: Payment method was declined by processor.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_GATEWAY_CONFIG
enumValues.description: Payment method cannot be used with the current payment gateway test mode configuration.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Payment method was not found.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_PROVIDER_IS_NOT_ENABLED
enumValues.description: Payment provider is not enabled.

enumValues.name: TEST_MODE
enumValues.description: Gateway is in test mode and attempted to bill a live payment method.

enumValues.name: TRANSIENT_ERROR
enumValues.description: Transient error, try again later.

enumValues.name: UNEXPECTED_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an unexpected error during the billing attempt.

types.name: SubscriptionBillingAttemptInput
types.description: The input fields required to complete a subscription billing attempt.

inputFields.name: billingCycleSelector
inputFields.description:
Select the specific billing cycle to be billed.
Default to bill the current billing cycle if not specified.

inputFields.name: idempotencyKey
inputFields.description: A unique key generated by the client to avoid duplicate payments. For more information, refer to [Idempotent requests](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/idempotent-requests).

inputFields.name: originTime
inputFields.description:
The date and time used to calculate fulfillment intervals for a billing attempt that
successfully completed after the current anchor date. To prevent fulfillment from being
pushed to the next anchor date, this field can override the billing attempt date.

enumValues.name: RELEVANCE
enumValues.description:
Sort by relevance to the search terms when the `query` parameter is specified on the connection.
Don't use this sort key when no search query is specified.

types.name: SubscriptionBillingCycleErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `SubscriptionBillingCycleUserError`.

enumValues.name: BILLING_DATE_SET_ON_SKIPPED
enumValues.description: Billing date cannot be set on skipped billing cycle.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE
enumValues.description: Billing cycle selector cannot select billing cycle outside of index range.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Can't find the billing cycle.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_START_DATE_OUT_OF_RANGE
enumValues.description: Billing cycle selector cannot select billing cycle outside of start date range.

enumValues.name: EMPTY_BILLING_CYCLE_EDIT_SCHEDULE_INPUT
enumValues.description: Billing cycle schedule edit input provided is empty. Must take in parameters to modify schedule.

enumValues.name: INCOMPLETE_BILLING_ATTEMPTS
enumValues.description: Billing cycle has incomplete billing attempts in progress.

enumValues.name: INVALID
enumValues.description: The input value is invalid.

enumValues.name: INVALID_CYCLE_INDEX
enumValues.description: The index selector is invalid.

enumValues.name: INVALID_DATE
enumValues.description: The date selector is invalid.

enumValues.name: NO_CYCLE_EDITS
enumValues.description: There's no contract or schedule edit associated with the targeted billing cycle(s).

enumValues.name: OUT_OF_BOUNDS
enumValues.description: Billing date of a cycle cannot be set to a value outside of its billing date range.

enumValues.name: UPCOMING_CYCLE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
enumValues.description: Billing cycle selector cannot select upcoming billing cycle past limit.

types.name: SubscriptionContractSubscriptionStatus
types.description: The possible status values of a subscription.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The contract is active and continuing per its policies.

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The contract was ended by an unplanned customer action.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The contract has ended per the expected circumstances. All billing and deliverycycles of the subscriptions were executed.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The contract ended because billing failed and no further billing attempts are expected.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: The contract is temporarily paused and is expected to resume in the future.

types.name: SubscriptionDeliveryMethod
types.description: Describes the delivery method to use to get the physical goods to the customer.

types.name: SubscriptionDeliveryMethodInput
types.description:
Specifies delivery method fields for a subscription draft.
This is an input union: one, and only one, field can be provided.
The field provided will determine which delivery method is to be used.

inputFields.name: localDelivery
inputFields.description: The input fields for the local delivery method.

inputFields.name: pickup
inputFields.description: The input fields for the pickup delivery method.

inputFields.name: shipping
inputFields.description: The input fields for the shipping delivery method.

types.name: SubscriptionDeliveryMethodLocalDelivery
types.description:
A subscription delivery method for local delivery.
The other subscription delivery methods can be found in the `SubscriptionDeliveryMethod` union type.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The address to deliver to.

fields.name: localDeliveryOption
fields.description: The details of the local delivery method to use.

types.name: SubscriptionDeliveryMethodLocalDeliveryInput
types.description:
The input fields for a local delivery method.

This input accepts partial input.When a field is not provided,
its prior value is left unchanged.

inputFields.name: address
inputFields.description: The address to deliver to.

inputFields.name: localDeliveryOption
inputFields.description: The details of the local delivery method to use.

types.name: SubscriptionDeliveryMethodLocalDeliveryOption
types.description: The selected delivery option on a subscription contract.

fields.name: code
fields.description: A custom reference to the delivery method for use with automations.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The details displayed to the customer to describe the local delivery option.

fields.name: instructions
fields.description: The delivery instructions that the customer can provide to the merchant.

fields.name: phone

types.name: SubscriptionDraftErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `SubscriptionDraftUserError`.

enumValues.name: ALREADY_REMOVED
enumValues.description: This line has already been removed.

enumValues.name: BILLING_CYCLE_ABSENT
enumValues.description: Cannot commit a contract draft with this mutation. Please use SubscriptionDraftCommit.

enumValues.name: BILLING_CYCLE_CONTRACT_DRAFT_BILLING_POLICY_INVALID
enumValues.description: Billing policy cannot be updated for billing cycle contract drafts.

enumValues.name: BILLING_CYCLE_CONTRACT_DRAFT_DELIVERY_POLICY_INVALID
enumValues.description: Delivery policy cannot be updated for billing cycle contract drafts.

enumValues.name: BILLING_CYCLE_PRESENT
enumValues.description: Cannot commit a billing cycle contract draft with this mutation. Please use SubscriptionBillingCycleContractDraftCommit.

enumValues.name: BLANK
enumValues.description: The input value is blank.

enumValues.name: COMMITTED
enumValues.description: Subscription draft has been already committed.

enumValues.name: CONCATENATION_BILLING_CYCLE_CONTRACT_DRAFT_REQUIRED
enumValues.description: Contract draft must be a billing cycle contract draft for contract concatenation.

enumValues.name: CURRENCY_NOT_ENABLED
enumValues.description: Currency is not enabled.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_DOES_NOT_EXIST
enumValues.description: The customer doesn't exist.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_MISMATCH
enumValues.description: The payment method customer must be the same as the contract customer.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_DISCOUNTS_UNIQUE_AFTER_CYCLE
enumValues.description: The after cycle attribute must be unique between cycle discounts.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE
enumValues.description: Billing cycle selector cannot select billing cycle outside of index range.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_SELECTOR_VALIDATE_ONE_OF
enumValues.description: Billing cycle selector requires exactly one of index or date to be provided.

enumValues.name: CYCLE_START_DATE_OUT_OF_RANGE
enumValues.description: Billing cycle selector cannot select billing cycle outside of start date range.

enumValues.name: DELIVERY_METHOD_REQUIRED
enumValues.description: The delivery method can't be blank if any lines require shipping.

enumValues.name: DELIVERY_MUST_BE_MULTIPLE_OF_BILLING
enumValues.description: The delivery policy interval must be a multiple of the billing policy interval.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE_CONCATENATED_CONTRACTS
enumValues.description: Concatenated contracts cannot contain duplicate subscription contracts.

enumValues.name: EXCEEDED_MAX_CONCATENATED_CONTRACTS
enumValues.description: Maximum number of concatenated contracts on a billing cycle contract draft exceeded.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than the minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than or equal to the minimum value allowed.

enumValues.name: HAS_FUTURE_EDITS
enumValues.description: Cannot update a subscription contract with a current or upcoming billing cycle contract edit.

enumValues.name: INVALID
enumValues.description: The input value is invalid.

enumValues.name: INVALID_ADJUSTMENT_TYPE
enumValues.description: The adjustment value must the same type as the adjustment type.

enumValues.name: INVALID_ADJUSTMENT_VALUE
enumValues.description: The adjustment value must be either fixed_value or percentage.

enumValues.name: INVALID_BILLING_DATE
enumValues.description: Next billing date is invalid.

enumValues.name: INVALID_LINES
enumValues.description: Must have at least one line.

enumValues.name: INVALID_NOTE_LENGTH
enumValues.description: Note length is too long.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than or equal to the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: MISSING_LOCAL_DELIVERY_OPTIONS
enumValues.description: The local delivery options must be set for local delivery.

enumValues.name: NOT_AN_INTEGER
enumValues.description: The value is not an integer.

enumValues.name: NOT_IN_RANGE
enumValues.description: Value is not in range.

enumValues.name: NO_ENTITLED_LINES
enumValues.description: Discount must have at least one entitled line.

enumValues.name: PRESENCE
enumValues.description: Input value is not present.

enumValues.name: SELLING_PLAN_MAX_CYCLES_MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_MIN_CYCLES
enumValues.description: The maximum number of cycles must be greater than the minimum.

enumValues.name: STALE_CONTRACT
enumValues.description: Another operation updated the contract concurrently as the commit was in progress.

enumValues.name: TOO_LONG
enumValues.description: The input value is too long.

enumValues.name: TOO_SHORT
enumValues.description: The input value is too short.

enumValues.name: UPCOMING_CYCLE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
enumValues.description: Billing cycle selector cannot select upcoming billing cycle past limit.

fields.description: The price per unit for the subscription line in the contract's currency.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the unit selected for the subscription line.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: sellingPlanId
fields.description:
The selling plan ID associated to the line.

Indicates which selling plan was used to create this
contract line initially. The selling plan ID is also used to
find the associated delivery profile.

The subscription contract, subscription line, or selling plan might have
changed. As a result, the selling plan's attributes might not
match the information on the contract.

fields.name: sellingPlanName
fields.description:
The selling plan name associated to the line. This name describes
the order line items created from this subscription line
for both merchants and customers.

The value can be different from the selling plan's name, because both
the selling plan's name and the subscription line's selling_plan_name
attribute can be updated independently.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: Variant SKU number of the item associated with the subscription line.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product title of the item associated with the subscription line.

fields.name: variantId
fields.description: The product variant ID associated with the subscription line.

fields.name: variantImage
fields.description: The image associated with the line item's variant or product.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: Product variant title of the item associated with the subscription line.

types.name: SuggestedRefund
types.description: Represents a refund suggested by Shopify based on the items being reimbursed. You can then use the suggested refund object to generate an actual refund.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The total monetary value to be refunded.

fields.name: amountSet
fields.description: The total monetary value to be refunded in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: discountedSubtotalSet
fields.description: The sum of all the discounted prices of the line items being refunded.

fields.name: maximumRefundable
fields.description: The total monetary value available to refund.

fields.name: maximumRefundableSet
fields.description: The total monetary value available to refund in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: refundDuties
fields.description: A list of duties to be refunded from the order.

fields.name: refundLineItems
fields.description: A list of line items to be refunded, along with restock instructions.

fields.name: shipping
fields.description: The shipping costs to be refunded from the order.

fields.name: subtotal
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of the line items being refunded.

fields.name: subtotalSet
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of the line items being refunded in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: suggestedTransactions
fields.description: A list of suggested order transactions.

fields.name: totalCartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The total cart discount amount that was applied to all line items in this refund.

fields.name: totalDutiesSet
fields.description: The sum of all the duties being refunded from the order in shop and presentment currencies. The value must be positive.

fields.name: totalTaxSet
fields.description: The sum of the taxes being refunded from the order in shop and presentment currencies. The value must be positive.

fields.name: totalTaxes
fields.description: The sum of the taxes being refunded from the order. The value must be positive.

types.name: SuggestedReturnRefund

fields.name: discountedSubtotal
fields.description: The sum of all the discounted prices of the line items being refunded.

fields.name: maximumRefundable
fields.description: The total monetary value available to refund in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.description: A list of duties to be refunded from the order.

fields.name: shipping
fields.description: The shipping costs to be refunded from the order.

fields.name: subtotal
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of the line items being refunded in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: suggestedTransactions
fields.description: A list of suggested order transactions.

fields.name: totalCartDiscountAmount
fields.description: The total cart discount amount that was applied to all line items in this refund.

fields.name: totalDuties
fields.description: The sum of all the duties being refunded from the order in shop and presentment currencies. The value must be positive.

types.name: TenderTransaction
types.description:
A TenderTransaction represents a transaction with financial impact on a shop's balance sheet. A tender transaction always
represents actual money movement between a buyer and a shop. TenderTransactions can be used instead of OrderTransactions
for reconciling a shop's cash flow. A TenderTransaction is immutable once created.

fields.description: The amount and currency of the tender transaction.

fields.name: id

fields.name: paymentMethod

fields.name: processedAt

fields.name: remoteReference
fields.description: The remote gateway reference associated with the tender transaction.

fields.name: test
fields.description: Whether the transaction is a test transaction.

fields.name: transactionDetails
fields.description: Information about the payment instrument used for the transaction.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The staff member who performed the transaction.

[RFC 3987](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987)-compliant URI string.

types.name: WebhookSubscription
types.description:
A webhook subscription is a persisted data object created by an app using the REST Admin API or GraphQL Admin API.
It describes the topic that the app wants to receive, and a destination where Shopify should send webhooks of the specified topic.
When an event for a given topic occurs, the webhook subscription sends a relevant payload to the destination.
Learn more about the [webhooks system](https://shopify.dev/apps/webhooks).

fields.name: apiVersion
fields.description: The Admin API version that Shopify uses to serialize webhook events. This value is inherited from the app that created the webhook subscription.

fields.name: callbackUrl
fields.description: The destination URI to which the webhook subscription will send a message when an event occurs.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the webhook subscription was created.

fields.name: endpoint
fields.description: The endpoint to which the webhook subscription will send events.

fields.name: format
fields.description: The format in which the webhook subscription should send the data.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: includeFields
fields.description: An optional array of top-level resource fields that should be serialized and sent in the webhook message. If null, then all fields will be sent.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: metafieldNamespaces
fields.description: The list of namespaces for any metafields that should be included in the webhook subscription.

fields.name: privateMetafieldNamespaces
fields.description: The list of namespaces for private metafields that should be included in the webhook subscription.
fields.deprecationReason:
Metafields created using a reserved namespace are private by default. See our guide for
[migrating private metafields](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/custom-data/metafields/migrate-private-metafields).

fields.name: subTopic
fields.description: An additional constraint to refine the type of event that triggers the webhook. Only supported on certain topics. See our guide to [sub-topics](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/webhooks/sub-topics) for more.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The type of event that triggers the webhook. The topic determines when the webhook subscription sends a webhook, as well as what class of data object that webhook contains.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the webhook subscription was updated.

types.name: WebhookSubscriptionTopic
types.description:
The supported topics for webhook subscriptions. You can use webhook subscriptions to receive
notifications about particular events in a shop.

You create mandatory webhooks either via the
[Partner Dashboard](https://shopify.dev/apps/webhooks/configuration/mandatory-webhooks#subscribe-to-privacy-webhooks)
or by updating the
[app configuration TOML](https://shopify.dev/apps/tools/cli/configuration#app-configuration-file-example).

enumValues.name: APP_PURCHASES_ONE_TIME_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `app_purchases_one_time/update` events. Occurs whenever a one-time app charge is updated.

enumValues.name: APP_SUBSCRIPTIONS_APPROACHING_CAPPED_AMOUNT
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `app_subscriptions/approaching_capped_amount` events. Occurs when the balance used on an app subscription crosses 90% of the capped amount.

enumValues.name: APP_SUBSCRIPTIONS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `app_subscriptions/update` events. Occurs whenever an app subscription is updated.

enumValues.name: APP_UNINSTALLED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `app/uninstalled` events. Occurs whenever a shop has uninstalled the app.

enumValues.name: ATTRIBUTED_SESSIONS_FIRST
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `attributed_sessions/first` events. Occurs whenever an order with a "first" attributed session is attributed. Requires the `read_marketing_events` scope.

enumValues.name: ATTRIBUTED_SESSIONS_LAST
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `attributed_sessions/last` events. Occurs whenever an order with a "last" attributed session is attributed. Requires the `read_marketing_events` scope.

enumValues.name: AUDIT_EVENTS_ADMIN_API_ACTIVITY
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `audit_events/admin_api_activity` events. Triggers for each auditable Admin API request. This topic is limited to one active subscription per Plus store and requires the use of Google Cloud Pub/Sub or AWS EventBridge. Requires the `read_audit_events` scope.

enumValues.name: BULK_OPERATIONS_FINISH
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `bulk_operations/finish` events. Notifies when a Bulk Operation finishes.

enumValues.name: CARTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `carts/create` events. Occurs when a cart is created in the online store. Other types of carts aren't supported. For example, the webhook doesn't support carts that are created in a custom storefront. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CARTS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `carts/update` events. Occurs when a cart is updated in the online store. Other types of carts aren't supported. For example, the webhook doesn't support carts that are updated in a custom storefront. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CHANNELS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `channels/delete` events. Occurs whenever a channel is deleted. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `checkouts/create` events. Occurs whenever a checkout is created. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUTS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `checkouts/delete` events. Occurs whenever a checkout is deleted. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUTS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `checkouts/update` events. Occurs whenever a checkout is updated. Requires the `read_orders` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTIONS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collections/create` events. Occurs whenever a collection is created. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTIONS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collections/delete` events. Occurs whenever a collection is deleted. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTIONS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collections/update` events. Occurs whenever a collection is updated, including whenever products are added or removed from the collection. Occurs once if multiple products are added or removed from a collection at the same time. Requires the `read_products` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_LISTINGS_ADD
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_listings/add` events. Occurs whenever a collection listing is added. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_LISTINGS_REMOVE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_listings/remove` events. Occurs whenever a collection listing is removed. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_LISTINGS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_listings/update` events. Occurs whenever a collection listing is updated. Requires the `read_product_listings` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_PUBLICATIONS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_publications/create` events. Occurs whenever a collection publication listing is created. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_PUBLICATIONS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_publications/delete` events. Occurs whenever a collection publication listing is deleted. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_PUBLICATIONS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `collection_publications/update` events. Occurs whenever a collection publication listing is updated. Requires the `read_publications` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANIES_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `companies/create` events. Occurs whenever a company is created. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANIES_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `companies/delete` events. Occurs whenever a company is deleted. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANIES_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `companies/update` events. Occurs whenever a company is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANY_CONTACTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `company_contacts/create` events. Occurs whenever a company contact is created. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANY_CONTACTS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `company_contacts/delete` events. Occurs whenever a company contact is deleted. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANY_CONTACTS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `company_contacts/update` events. Occurs whenever a company contact is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANY_CONTACT_ROLES_ASSIGN
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `company_contact_roles/assign` events. Occurs whenever a role is assigned to a contact at a location. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANY_CONTACT_ROLES_REVOKE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `company_contact_roles/revoke` events. Occurs whenever a role is revoked from a contact at a location. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANY_LOCATIONS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `company_locations/create` events. Occurs whenever a company location is created. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANY_LOCATIONS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `company_locations/delete` events. Occurs whenever a company location is deleted. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: COMPANY_LOCATIONS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `company_locations/update` events. Occurs whenever a company location is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/create` events. Occurs whenever a customer is created. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/delete` events. Occurs whenever a customer is deleted. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_DISABLE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/disable` events. Occurs whenever a customer account is disabled. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_EMAIL_MARKETING_CONSENT_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers_email_marketing_consent/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer's email marketing consent is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_ENABLE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/enable` events. Occurs whenever a customer account is enabled. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_MARKETING_CONSENT_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers_marketing_consent/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer's SMS marketing consent is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_MERGE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/merge` events. Triggers when two customers are merged Requires the `read_customer_merge` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customers/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_GROUPS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_groups/create` events. Occurs whenever a customer saved search is created. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_GROUPS_DELETE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_groups/delete` events. Occurs whenever a customer saved search is deleted. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_GROUPS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_groups/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer saved search is updated. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_PAYMENT_METHODS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_payment_methods/create` events. Occurs whenever a customer payment method is created. Requires the `read_customer_payment_methods` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_PAYMENT_METHODS_REVOKE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_payment_methods/revoke` events. Occurs whenever a customer payment method is revoked. Requires the `read_customer_payment_methods` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_PAYMENT_METHODS_UPDATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer_payment_methods/update` events. Occurs whenever a customer payment method is updated. Requires the `read_customer_payment_methods` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_TAGS_ADDED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer.tags_added` events. Triggers when tags are added to a customer. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_TAGS_REMOVED
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `customer.tags_removed` events. Triggers when tags are removed from a customer. Requires the `read_customers` scope.

enumValues.name: DISCOUNTS_CREATE
enumValues.description: The webhook topic for `discounts/create` events. Occurs whenever a discount is created. Requires the `read_discounts` scope.

enumValues.name: DISCOUNTS_DELETE
